loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio G. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 50 years old. Gregorio is married and has five children. His eldest child is 27 years old and the youngest is 17. Just like any other father, he only wants the best for his family. He works hard to make them happy and healthy. To make a living, Gregorio raises livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale.

Gregorio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Gregorio has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Gregorio is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase pig feeds and vitamins. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase pig feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth B. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 33 years old. Jeneth is married and has three children. Her eldest child is 15 years old. To make a living, Jeneth cooks and sells food for daily meals. Jeneth has been engaged in her business for almost six years now. She earns PHP 4000 a month.

Jeneth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and  living situation. Jeneth has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase vegetables and other ingredients. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and other ingredients

loans.name: Dorcah

texts.en:
Dorcah is 39 years old, a resident of Kisii Town in Western Kenya. She is married with six children aged between twenty and six, all attending school. She has been doing mixed farming for thirteen years, producing millet, maize and beans, and sells locally. She has employed one farmhand.

She has requested this loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.She says the milk will be a good source of food for the family and will pay the children's school fees. Dorcas wants to own a retail shop for cereals and buy better quality dairies in future.

Her challenges are fluctuating market prices and diseases.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Launh

texts.en: Launh S. is a 45-year-old married woman and mother. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. Launh S. has a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crops on her land, such as cabbages and cucumbers, which she sells to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. Her husband is a fisherman. The couple has four school-aged children. Currently, Launh S. is concerned that she faces difficulties in traveling anywhere. She and her husband always travel to work by hiring a taxi or walking because they don't have their own vehicle. To solve the problem, Launh S. has requested a loan to be used to buy a second motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a second motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia A. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 48 years old and has a 2-year-old child. To make a living, Julia owns and operates a general store. Julia wants her child to have a better future. She works hard to have her own savings.

Julia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Julia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
Rizza P. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 28 years old. Rizza is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rizza owns and operates a general store. Rizza sells shampoo, soft drinks and other things. She wishes for her family to have better living conditions.

Rizza joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rizza is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a 41 year-old mother who aims to become successful by developing her fishing business. Her husband works closely with her as fisherman. They work together for the future of their family. Rosalie is thankful to ASHI for the loan they provided. Since 1997, Rosalie has been able to support the maintenance of her fishing business by purchasing fishing net, a fishing boat, and other fishing equipment.  She hopes to further improve her fishing business through hard work and with continuous support from ASHI and the Kiva Partner.

Due to a lack of business capital, she was encouraged to seek financial support from Kiva lenders. She will be glad if her loan request is granted.  She will use the loan wisely by purchasing materials for her business; such as a fishing cage (fish trap) and other related materials. Her hard work and patience are her foundation to achieve a better life. 

The income she earns from the business is very helpful, as it supports her business and sustains the needs of her family, especially by providing school allowances for her only son, Romeo, a high school student. She hopes that someday she will be able to expand her fishing business. Rosalie is glad to have the secure opportunity to request this loan and for your support and encouragement. 

Her long-term goal is to have a fish farm so that she can offer support to others in her village, especially her relatives. Rosalie hopes to maintain long-term, sustainable fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her fishing business, such as a fishing cage (fish trap) and other related materials.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a resident of Kisii Town in Western Kenya. He is married with seven children aged between twenty-five and seventeen. He has been in mixed farming for over twenty years producing onions, beans, milk, and cabbages which are sold locally.

He has applied for this loan of 70,000 KES, his second with Juhudi Kilimo after the first of 45,000 KES which he repaid successfully. He wants to improve his dairy farming to earn more income so as to pay school fees for the children still in school. He believes the milk will also be good for family consumption.

His challenges remain drought, poor market prices, and diseases.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Melcris

texts.en:
Melcris A. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 22 years old and married. Melcris raises pigs for fattening and sale. She sells pork meat to the market. She also started her own Internet cafe. She has a few computer units now and she hopes to expand her business because it is very helpful to the students in her neighborhood. Melcris works hard to build her businesses. She wants to be financially prepared when she has children.

Melcris joined CEVI to access financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Melcris has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Melcris is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase scrap metal

loans.name: Mashkhura

texts.ru: Раимкулова Машхура проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 26 лет. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений. Она хочет посеить и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Mashkhura R. lives in Shahrituz.  She is 26 years old, married, and has two children. She has a high school education. She has been farming for more than five years.  She rents the plot of land where she sows wheat and grows vegetables.  She is taking a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She wants to sow the seeds and to reap a good harvest.

loans.use: buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Barack

texts.en:
Barack O. O. is thirty-one years old and married. His wife helps him run his business and they have five children between the ages of ten years and one year old.  They hope to give their children a good education to the University level. 

His business is located at the busy Juakali Market in Nairobi. He makes and sells items, such as steel doors and cookers. He serves the local people.  He has been in this business for fifteen years and has four employees. He says that his business is profitable, but a major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He will use the loan of KES 40,000 to buy scrap metal to grow his business. He hopes to expand his business until it becomes a company that can provide employment to many people. He describes himself as determined, God-fearing, and ambitious.

loans.use: Scrap metal

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a resident of Kisii Town in Western Kenya. He is married with seven children, all adults. He has been in the farming business for 25 years, producing and selling tea, sugarcane, potatoes and milk locally. He has employed two farmhands.

He has applied for this loan of 90,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his dairy farming and dairy products retail shop. He hopes this expansion will improve the family income and give them a better living standard. He aspires to have a van for public transport.

He faces the challenges of finances for family expenses and inputs like fertilizers.

loans.use: Purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay P., 25 years old, owns a small shop in the province of Kompong Chhnang where she sells soft drinks, plastic products, and food. She typically makes a profit of around US$ 2 per day to support her family expenses. She has been married for many years, but does not yet have children. Her husband earns a living by entering battery water for his neighbors and other villagers when their batteries run out of water. Lay P.’s husband’s business is progressing well.  He wants to increase his capital to buy equipment to support his work and to earn additional profit. Lay P. wishes to help her husband’s business plan, but she does not have enough funds. Lay P. would like to request a loan to help her husband buy equipment for his battery water services.

loans.use: To buy equipment for husband's battery water services.

loans.name: Badiallo's Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) qui se connaissent bien car vivent ensemble dans le même quartier, dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et coépouses. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, sont mariées et sont mères d’au moins 3 enfants.
Les membres du groupe Danaya font l’achat et la vente de fruits et légumes d’huile alimentaire et  de la restauration.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe Danaya ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Ils sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Afou O.  qui est un des membres du groupe Danaya fait de la restauration. Elle est très sollicitée car elle occupe une bonne place devant la grande cour scolaire de  koutiala. Connue sous le pseudonyme de Afou farine elle fait une bonne affaire  pour les élèves qui se régalent pendant la récréation. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des sacs de farines de blé et des bidons d’huile d’arachide. Elle se procure de ces marchandises au  grand marché de Koutiala avec les boutiquiers et vend  après une bonne friture au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes et de scolaires.
Tandis que Les autres membres du groupe Danaya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55 000FCFA chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Afou O.,  compte réaliser 120 000 FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent renforcer leur partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour pouvoir diversifier  leurs activités.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of women from the neighborhood of Hamdallaye, in the city of Koutiala (third administrative region of Mali). They know each other well because they live together in the same neighborhood in large traditional families with their husbands, children and co-wives. On average, they are 30 years old, married, and have at least three children each.

The Danaya group members are engaged in the purchase and sale of fruits, vegetables, and cooking oil, and in the restaurant business.

In order to expand their activities, the group turned to the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution. They are on their first group loan cycle.

Afou O. is one of the group members involved in the restaurant business. She is in high demand due to a good location in front of the large schoolyard of Koutiala. Known by the name “Afou farine”, she is very popular with the schoolchildren coming to get treats at recess.

She plans to use her loan to buy bags of wheat flour and cans of peanut oil. She gets some of these supplies from the shopkeepers at the big market of Koutiala and after frying her products, she sells them for cash to a customer base composed of women and students.

While the other group members of Danaya expect to earn an average profit of 55,000FCFA each during this cycle, Afou O. expects to make 120,000 FCFA.

In addition to the repayment of loans, they use a portion of the income to cover ongoing family expenses.

They wish to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to diversify their activities.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for restaurant activities

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Né le 24 Mai 1982 à Sikasso, Monsieur Bakary K. est marié et père d’une fille, vivant dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Mamassooni-Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, il s’est vite initié à cette activité de coiffure des hommes et d’achat vente de matériels de coiffure  depuis maintenant 10 ans. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes de matériels de salon et divers, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut; il décida alors d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour ainsi solliciter un prêt lui permettant de mieux satisfaire ses clients.
Il est actuellement à son deuxième prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter 5 nouvelles tondeuses, 6 paires de peigne et brosses, 5 bidons d’eau de Javel, 5 bouteilles d’alcool de 90°, 10 bouteilles de pommade pour cheveux, etc. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on May 24, 1982 in Sikasso, Mr. Bakary K. is a married father of one daughter living in a large traditional extended family in Mamassooni-Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  Not having had the chance to progress in school, Bakary soon became familiar with cutting men's hair and with the buying and selling of barber supplies.  He has been in this business for ten years now.  

With experience such as this, Bakary enjoys a good reputation and accommodates many orders for salon supplies and sundry items.  But the resources necessary for satisfying these needs is lacking.  He therefore decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to request a loan that will enable him to satisfy his customers further.

He is currently on his second loan that will enable him to buy 5 new clippers, 6 pairs of combs and brushes, 5 containers of bleach, 5 bottles of 90% alcohol, 10 bottles of hair ointment, etc.  

With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA.  He plans on using the profits to settle most of his expenses and his family expenses, as well as to pay the loan interest. He will reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: Buying equipment and supplies for his barbershop (clippers, hair ointment, combs, brushes, etc.)

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Kadiatou B. est née le 07 Mai 1966 à BanamB. (région de Koulikoro), elle est divorcée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle réside avec ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Kaboïla II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Kadiatou B., après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, elle décide finalement de s’initier l’activité de restauration depuis plus de quinze ans, auprès d’une voisine du quartier. Elle mène son activité  à Kaboïla II en face de l’antenne de Soro Yiriwaso Sikasso tous les jours où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux années avec laquelle elle est à son troisième prêt et tous ses deux prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Ce troisième prêt  lui permettra d’améliorer ses prestations de services en achetant plus de viandes de brousses avec les chasseurs des localités environnantes de Sikasso, 45kg de poissons frais, 60kg de haricot, 25 poulets, 1 sac de pomme de terre, 20kg de haricot vert etc.
 Les recettes alimentaires sont vendues au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes, de jeunes (célibataires) surtout de noctambules. Son restaurant marche en merveille surtout avec la vente des viandes de brousse appréciées par la population. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Kadiatou B. was born on 7th May 1966 in BanaB. (in the Koulikoro region). She is divorced and mother to four children who are in her care. She lives with her children in a large extended traditional family in Kaboïla II, in the centre of Sikasso (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region). 

Mrs. B.  had many unsuccessful business ventures but finally decided to set up a restauration business over 15 years ago with a neighbor in the district. She carries out her business every day in Kaboïla II opposite Soro Yiriwaso's Sikasso branch and is in great demand from her customers for the quality of her products.

In order to satisfy ever growing customer demand, she decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, around two years ago and she is now on her third loan from the institution; her two previous loans were repaid in full. This third loan will allow her to improved the quality of her service by buying more bush meat from hunters in the towns surrounding Sikasso, 45kg of fresh fish, 60kg of beans, 25 chickens, one sack of potatoes, 25kg of green beans etc..

She sells her meals for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of women, young single people and above all, nightowls. Her restauration business is going wonderfully well, particularly the sale of bush meat which is appreciated by the working population. She expects to make a monthly profit of 150,000FCFA, which will be used essentially to increase her business, contribute to family expenses and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for restauration

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 32 years old and is married with three children. She runs her used clothing business in the city center of Freetown, Sierra Leone. Aminata has many customers and her clothes are in high demand in the city.  She typically travels to Guinea by bus to buy used clothing in bulk. 

Aminata is very personable and has many repeat customers.  She needs a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to travel to Guinea and buy more used clothes.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing

loans.name: Ton

texts.en: Ton S. V. has been married for many years to Phan Heng. They currently live in Kompong Chhnang Province. Ton S. V. sells a few products such as potatoes and wood charcoal in the S. Chrom District. She makes an income of approximately $2.50 per day. Her husband assists her with the business.  They also raise ducks to produce eggs to sell. Ton S. V. wants to improve her duck-raising business, which is the most profitable one for the family. She has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more feed, small ducks, and a small pig to breed.

loans.use: To purchase feed, small ducks, and a small pig to breed

loans.name: Madougou

texts.fr:
Madougou S. est une veuve a plus de 63 ans qui réside avec sa coépouse et leurs enfants chez leur défunt époux à Mancourani II, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, cette dame s’est initiée aux activités de petit commerce  tels l’achat-vente des pagnes wax, des tissus brodés, de chaussures, de tasses, de parfums etc depuis  maintenant plus de trente ans. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée surtout de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des femmes) pour la qualité de ses produits. Elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes des localités environnantes et son activité marche en merveille. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante et exigeante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de sept ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, il est à son onzième prêt individuel, tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursé.Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 30 pièces de pagnes wax, 15 complets de tissus brodés, 10 paires de chaussures plastique, etc. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako ensuite elle les revend de façon ambulante à Sikasso et souvent dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Madougou S. is a widow who is over 63 years old.  She resides with her co-spouse and their children in their deceased husband’s house in Mancourani II, the downtown of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having had the chance to advance in school for societal reasons, this lady became familiar with small-scale commerce, such as the buying and selling of wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), embroidered cloth, shoes, basins, perfumes, etc.  Madougou has been in this business for over thirty years.  She is in high demand, especially by her customer base (composed essentially of women) for the quality of her products.  She receives many orders from the surrounding towns.  And her business is doing wonderfully.   Concerned with satisfying further her growing customer demands, Madougou decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso over seven years ago. After several solidarity loan (group loans) in a women’s association in her district, she is now on her 11th individual loan. All the preceding loans have been properly repaid. She plans on using her loan to buy 30 bolts of wax pagnes, 15 outfits of embroidered fabrics, 10 pairs of plastic footwear, etc. She gets her supplies in Bamako and then she resells them door-to-door in and around Sikasso. With this loan, Madougou envisions making a monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially for helping to cover family expenses and paying the loan interest. The rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: Buying pagne cloth, embroidered fabrics, etc.

loans.name: Ekoué

texts.fr: Ekoue a 29 ans et est marié. IL est né à Agbetiko et  vit à Lomé.  Il est électronicien mais associe la vente d’appareils électroniques. Il achète  habituellement  au port autonome de Lomé et revient vendre dans son atelier à Akodessewa. Il demande un crédit au près de WAGES pour acheter d’autre nouveaux appareils et de là satisfaire beaucoup de clients.
texts.en: Ekoué is 29 years old and married. He was born in Agbetiko and lives in Lomé. He is an expert in electronics and also a retailer of electronic devices. He usually buys his supplies at the autonomous port of Lomé and retails in his workshop in Akodessewa. He came to WAGES and applied for a loan to buy new devices, so that he can satisfy his many customers.

loans.use: To buy electronic devices

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Yacouba TRAORE N.1 a 33 ans, marié et père de six enfants dont 3 garçons et 3 filles. Il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle Bougoula Hameau situé environ à 7 kilomètres de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Yacouba TRAORE après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié au commerce d’articles divers. Il dispose D4une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où il mène cette activité d’achat et vente des articles divers (maïs, Cigarette, bonbon, allumette, Chewing gum, lait en poudre, Thé, sucre, savon, etc) depuis plus de douze années. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y'a environ quatre ans. Ainsi il a bénéficié de trois prêts individuels qui ont été tous correctement remboursés.
Il sollicite ce quatrième prêt  pour lui permettre d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de se procurer de, 5 tonnes de maïs, 10 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 2 cartons du thé, 4 sacs du sucre, 8 paquets de lait en poudre, 4 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquet de Chewing-gum, 30 paquets d’allumette, 4 cartons de savon, etc.
auprès des commerçants grossistes de la ville de Sikasso et environnants. Il revend ses marchandises en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de toutes sortes de couches sociales de sa localité.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr Yacouba Traoré No. 1, aged 33, is married and the father of six children, three sons and three daughters. He lives with his wife and their children in a large traditional family in the hamlet of Bougoula, located about 7 kilometers from Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr Yacouba Traoré, after having tried several activities without success, opened a grocery store with various articles. His store is in front of the family home, and he has been buying and selling various articles (corn, cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing gum, milk powder, tea, sugar, soap, etc.) for over a dozen years. He enjoys a high demand from his customers due to the good quality of his products.

To satisfy his ever increasing clientele, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. He was granted three individual loans that have been properly repaid. He applies for his fourth loan to increase his working capital. He will buy 5 tons of corn, 10 cartridges of various cigarette brands, 2 boxes of tea, 4 sacks of sugar, 8 packs of milk powder, 4 packs of candy, 10 packs of chewing gum, 30 packs of matches, 4 packs of soap, etc. He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Sikasso and neighboring villages. He retails his products, for cash and credit, to a clientele made up of people from all levels of society in his village.

Thanks to this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 300,000 CFA francs, which he will use primarily to increase his working capital, provide for his family and pay the interests of his loan.

loans.use: To buy various grocery items

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr: K. a 29 ans.  Il exerce comme activité la vente de porcs que lui-même élève.  Il a remboursé plusieurs  crédits  déjà grâce à cette activité.  Pour nourrir les porcs, il achète leur bétail à Gleyi pour les satisfaire  et compte dans cette activité 4 ans déjà. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter leurs  nourritures et se réapprovisionner.
texts.en: K. is 29 years old. His activity consists in rearing and selling pigs. He has taken out and repaid several loans for this activity. He buys pig feed in Gleyi. He has been in this trade for 4 years already. He applies for this loan to buy pig feed and stock up.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion V. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Presentacion is married and has 9 adult-aged children. To make a living, Presentacion owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products, including milk fish, mackerel and sardines in the local community. Presentacion has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Presentacion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Presentacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to buy and sell. loans.name: Nurbubu

texts.en:
Nurbubu A. is 50 years old and married. She was born in a large family and from early childhood she helped her parents around the house.   Nurbubu got married at the age of 21 and had three children. In 1983, Nurbubu with her husband started to work at the Karabalta’s carpet factory but their wages didn’t cover household expenses, like rent and supplies. For this reason, Nurbubu decided to start her own business in furniture production. She purchased a garage to use as a furniture workshop and bought equipment. Nurbubu has been engaged in this activity for more than 20 years and has achieved success. With the revenues,  Nurbubu was able to buy an undeveloped house, where she still lives with her family. Last year, she obtained her first loan from Bai Tushum and Partners for purchasing wood and repaid it without any delays. 

Now Nurbubu plans to use the loan of 40,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy wood, fibreboards and fittings. With the revenues from this investment, Nurbubu plans to open a furniture-making shop near her house.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.  Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase materials for furniture manufacturing

loans.name: Dedé Akofa

texts.fr: Akofa a 45 ans et est mariée. Elle a en sa charge 3 enfants.  Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants, elle fait la vente de produits d’alimentations générale. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend au marché local d’Akodessewa. Elle compte dans cette activité 15 ans d’expérience. Le crédit sollicité permettra de satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Akofa is 45 years old and married. She cares for three children. To improve the living standard of her children, she sells grocery products. She gets her supplies at the great market in Lomé and retails at the local market in Akodessewa. She has more than 15 years' experience in this business. She applies for this loan to satisfy more customers.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Gandjali

texts.ru:
Gandjali  C. 53 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Gandjali yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste s semyoy. 

Gandjali uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Gandjali delayet moloko sir i yogurt vmeste s jenoy. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi. Gandjali prodayet molochniye produkti u sebya doma tak kak on imeyet mnoqo kliyentov sredi sosedey.
texts.en:
Gandjali C. is 53 years old.  He is married and has two children.  Gandjali is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).   He is a refugee from the city of Fuzuli who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family.

Gandjali has been a herdsman for seven years.  He and his wife make milk, cheese, and yogurt.  Now, he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows.   Gandjali sells dairy products out of his home, and many of his neighbors are customers.

loans.use: Buying cows

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Elle est mariée et a 40 ans. Elle participe au foyer en exerçant  la vente de produits BB. Elle est née dans la préfecture de Wawa et réside à Lomé. Elle achète souvent à la Brasserie du Bénin Lomé et revend dans un  bar à Akodessewa. Le prêt demandé lui permettra d’acheter de nouveaux  boissons pour augmenter son commerce.
texts.en: Afi A. is married and 40 years old. She helps with household expenses by selling products from Brasserie BB Lomé, a local brewery. She was born in the prefecture of Wawa and lives in Lomé. She buys most of her products from this brewery in Lomé and retails them in her bar in Akodessewa. She applies for this loan to buy more drinks and increase her turnover.

loans.use: To buy products from a local brewery

loans.name: Djiwonou Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo est mariée et a 3 enfants en charge. Elle est née à Lomé et habite quartier adakpamé.  Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait la vente de produits génériques.  Elle s’approvisionne dans une pharmacie villageoise et expose ses différents produits à la devanture de sa maison. En plus, elle exerce cette activité il y a de cela 7 ans. L’objet du crédit sera essentiellement destiné à l’achat de nouveaux produits pour satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Adjo is married and has 3 children in her care. She was born in Lomé and lives in the Adakpamé area. To contribute to her household, she sells generic drugs. She gets her supplies at a village pharmacy and displays her various products in front of her house. She has run this business for 7 years. The loan she is seeking will be used to buy new products to satisfy more customers.

loans.use: To buy generic products

texts.ru:

Nabat uje 7 let kak imeyet bizness prodaji tovari domashneqo upotrebleniya. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Nabat v pervuyu ssudu ona brala 1000$ chtobi kupit tovar dlya prodaji, ona ochen blagodarna lenderam za ssudu za etu summu ona pokupala kostruli skovorodki chayniki elektronniye( ranshe ona prodovaal tolka tarelki, stakani, lojki ,vilki i t.d). Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.  

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/52398
texts.en:
Nabat H. is 39 years old.  She is married with three children.  Nabat is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from the city of Fuzuli who now lives in the Fuzuli region.

Nabat has owned her housewares business for seven years.  This is her second loan.  Before, she borrowed $1000 to buy goods to sell.  She is very grateful to lenders for the loan.  She bought cooking pots, skillets, and electric tea kettles.  Before the loan, she only sold plates, glasses, spoons, forks, etc.  Now, she needs 2000 AZN to increase the size of her shop and further develop her business.

Here is a link to her previous loan:  http://partners.kiva.org/lend/52398

loans.use: Expanding the shop

loans.name: Ibragim

texts.en:
Ibragim is married with three children. He lives in Shahrituz, Tajikistan and runs a store selling carpets of different kinds and tastes. His business is very prospective and flourishing. Ibragim has an individual approach to each of his customers which has helped him win many loyal clients. He has been in this trade for 6 years. Currently he needs a loan of $3000 USD to expand the range of his products. Ibragim is happy to have access to lending services as additional financial assistance gives him options in his dealings with different suppliers of specific merchandise. Ibragim’s business is developed and settled. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar V. lives in Yerevan with her son, whom she brought up by herself. For more than 10 years Gohar worked in a shoe shop as a salesperson, and for about 14 years Gohar has run her own clothes trading business in different markets. Now, Gohar is renting a trading stall in the biggest Yerevan clothes market, where she manages her business.
 
Gohar sells only men’s clothes, and she says it is a correct choice, because the majority of offered merchandise in Armenian markets is women’s clothes, so she has a lot of regular customers. Once a month she imports clothes from neighboring countries to resell. 

For a long time Gohar has solved her family’s needs and paid for her son's education thanks to her business income. Owing to this education, now Gohar’s son has a job and he shares the family’s expenses with his mother.

Gohar seeks a loan of $3,000 to buy winter assortment of sweaters, blazers, sweatshirts, jackets, etc. for her shop.

In order to provide better service for his clients and earn more, Hasan needs to make major repairs to his lorry. He believes that this will make his business more profitable. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD.

loans.name: Dunda Mu Yesu Group

texts.fr: Kahindo M.  est  présidente du groupe Dunda mu yesu, âgée de 27 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants dont tous  étudient. Son mari est  petit commerçant.  Elle vend aussi les divers  comme son conjoint. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu  de son mari,  il ya 2 ans. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Elle installe ses produits  au le marché Nyabushongo. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’augmenter son stock avec  10 pièces des pagnes dame. En plus, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle et construire une maison. La cliente Kahindo M. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Dunda mu Yesu est  composé de 44 membres.photo prise devant la chapelle catholique, du quartier Ndosho, avenue cariere.
texts.en: Kahindo Mbilize is the president of the Dunda mu Yesu group, and is 27 years old, married, and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Her husband is a small shopkeeper. Like her husband, she also sells various items. She began her business with her own funds, provided by her husband 2 years ago. Later, she benefited from a $50 loan through the microfinance institution Hekima. She sells her products at the Nyabushongo market. This new loan will serve to increase her stock with 10 sets of ladies pagnes (a type of brightly printed cloth). In addition, she aspires to buy a plot of land and to build a house. The client Kahindo Mbilize is grateful to Hekima for its actions on behalf of the poor who are excluded from the traditional banking system. It should be noted that this group, Dunda mu Yesu, is composed of 44 members. The photo shown here was taken in front of the Catholic chapel in the Ndosho area, on Avenue Cariere.

loans.use: To buy 10 sets of ladies' pagnes (a type of African cloth)

Barshad has been a herdsman for two years.  Before that, he owned a store where he sold foodstuffs.  Then he decided to change businesses.  This is his second loan.  The first time, Barshad borrowed $725 to buy scales and groceries.  He is very thankful to the lenders for the loan.  Now, he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to expand his new business.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur A. is 30 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 3 children. He has been a farmer for the past 4 years, which he began with the goal of supporting his household and above all to satisfy the needs of his children. For Sayali, agriculture is an activity that he likes to do. Within it, vegetable production is what he likes most, as it is easier to cultivate these plants and the product is profitable in season, which is annually. But the earnings are greater and beneficial for every farmer, especially when buyers purchase the production in great quantities and the expense of transporting the products is avoided as the buyers come to harvest and take it away themselves. Now Sayali wishes to borrow money which he wants to invest in seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. Sayali is sincerely grateful to all of you.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Ancilla

texts.en:
Ancilla is 46 years old and is married with eight children between the ages of 8 and 26. She also takes care of two dependents, who are 4 and 8 years old. Ancilla has been struggling to provide for her large family by selling drinks she makes from sorghum.

Although Ancilla has thirty years of experience in this business, her earned profits are still too low to care for her children and dependents. She has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business.  With this loan, she will purchase a large quantity of sorghum, which will help her increase the sales of her drinks.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of sorghum to make more drinks to sell.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. She operates a vegetable stall, selling sukuma wiki (green vegetables) and coconuts. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and price fluctuation in her business. Lydia hopes to have a big grocery store in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, 3 crates of tomatoes and 50 coconuts. She decided to join Yehu to get financial services to improve her business.

texts.ru:
Tabriz G. 45 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Tabriz yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayets v Fuzuli regione vmeste s semyoy. Oni jivut v obshejiteye v kotorom imeyut odnu komnatu.

Tabriz uje 9 let kak chinit isporchenniye mashini. Tabriz seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit instumenti i aparaturu dlya toqo chtobi chinit mashini.
texts.en:

Tabriz has worked as an auto mechanic for nine years.  Tabriz now needs 2000 AZN to buy tools and instruments to repair automobiles.

The loans he receives through Al Majmoua encourage him to continue in his work and develop his business.

Mwanaisha operates a restaurant business, cooking rice and beans, chapati (flat bread) for sale. Her potential customers are laborers from a nearby business. She  faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business.  

With a loan of Kshs 20,000 Mwanaisha wants to purchase sacks of maize, rice, wheat flour and cooking oil. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’être fournisseur de secteur du Ruhuha.  Elle voudrait devenir commerçant et agriculteur moderne. loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:

She has been selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mariam faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season, firewood becomes less available in the market.  

Mariam decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she plans to purchase a bundle of firewood for resale.  Mariam hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.name: Boaventura Chachuai

texts.pt:
Boaventura Chachuai B. nasceu na cidade de Xai-xai, província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique casado pai de 5 filhos de idades entre 02 a 18 anos de idade, os 4 mais velhos vão a Escola. Fez 4ª classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com sua a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Gaza para a cidade da Maputo com seus pais quando estes foram transferidos pelos serviços. Trabalha como motorista numa empresa e também tem um negocio de venda de frangos ha mais de 18 anos. Conta com ajuda de seus filhos e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de conversas com um amigo que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 24.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos, ração e vitaminas para aumentar a quantidade da sua criação. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 15.000.00 e 20.000.00mt aplicados na habitação.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro credito, para continuar com a criação de mais frangos.
texts.en:
Boaventura Chachuai B. was born in the city of Xai-xai, province of Gaza, in the south of Mozambique.  He is married, the father of five children aged 2 to 18 years, the four eldest of which attend school.  He finished fourth grade but didn't continue due to financial conditions.  He lives in his own house with his family and doesn't have any other dependents.

He left Gaza for the city of Maputo with his parents when they were transferred for work.  He works as a company driver and also has had a business selling chickens for more than 18 years.  He depends on the help of his children, and manages to bring in an income of about 5,000 MT per month, which he puts towards household expenses and still is able to put some aside in his bank account.

He has never had loans with other banks, and got to know about Hluvuku through conversations with a friend who is also a client of this institution.  This is his third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 24,500 MT, with which he plans to purchase chicks, feed, and vitamins to increase the quantity of his livestock.  The previous loans were in the amounts of 15,000 and 20,000 MT, and were invested in his residence.

He is confident that he will repay by the deadline and will ask for another loan in order to continue breeding more chickens.

loans.use: purchase of chicks, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Armando Jose

texts.pt:
Armando José A. nasceu na Província de Sofala, centro de Moçambique casado pai de 2 filhos maiores de idade. Fez apenas 4ª classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com sua a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Sofala para a cidade da Maputo cumprindo com o serviço militar Obrigatório. É pensionista do Ministério da Defesa ha mais de 20 anos e recebe 7.081.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de conversas com um amigo que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro e outros) para melhorar a sua residência.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros empréstimos. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro credito, para concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Armando José A. was born in the province of Sofala in the centre of Mozambique.  He is married and the father of two adult children.  He only finished grade four and didn't continue on in school due to financial conditions.  He lives in his own house with his family and has no other dependents.

He left Sofala for the city of Maputo in serving his compulsory military service.  He has been a pensioner of the Ministry of Defence for more than 20 years, and receives 7,081 MT per month, which he puts towards household expenses, and still manages to put some aside in his bank account.

He has never had loans with other banks.  He got to know about Hluvuku through conversations with a friend who is also a client of this institution.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 MT, with which he plans to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stone, metal, and other things) in order to improve his residence.

He promises to duly repay in order to be able to apply for further loans.  He is confident that he will repay before the deadline and will ask for another loan to finish the work.

loans.use: purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, stone, metal, and other things)

loans.name: Patriciah
