With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: A. Pascaline est née le 16 Janvier 1976 et est mariée à OUSSOUPOE Pierre. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a une dizaine d'année que la famille s'est installée à Ekpè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Pascaline n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Pascaline mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, eau minérale, différentes sortes de savons, conserves de sardine, etc.) depuis une douzaine d'année. Pascaline achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. Pascaline vend ses produits dans le même marché à Dantokpa. C'est la première fois que Pascaline sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Pascaline A. was born on 16 January 1976 and is married to Pierre Oussoupoe. The couple have three children, all in school. For about ten years, the family has lived in Ekpè in the town of Sèmè-Podji. Pascaline never attended school. To meet her needs, Pascaline has run a business selling various items (pasta, mineral water, various kinds of soap, canned sardines, etc.) for about twelve years. Pascaline buys her goods at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, and also in Lomé, Togo. Pascaline sells her products at Dantokpa market itself. This is the first time Pascaline is seeking a loan through ALIDE, with the goal of strengthening her business and better meeting the needs of her clientele.

loans.use: To buy various items (canned goods, boxes of soap, and pasta)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills. 

She operates an open-air food market, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  Mary faces the major challenges of price fluctuation and competition in her business. She hopes to expand her business and establish a cosmetic shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, cooking oil, and a big umbrella to create shade for her customers. She decided to join Yehu so she could access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes, cooking oil, and a big umbrella to create a shade for her customers.

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en:
Janvier is 29 years old and married with three children between the ages of 1 and 7 years old.  His wife is a teacher and he runs a hair salon.  The salon is well-organised and well-established.  Janvier has had his business for 12 years and employs 3 people.  His salon is open from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day of the week.

Janvier has requested this loan from the Kiva partner Vision Finance Company.  The loan will be used to purchase more materials for the salon, such as items required to do hair braiding.  He plans to reinvest any profits back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for hair salon

loans.name: Paulino

texts.pt:
Paulino M. nasceu no Distrito de Milange, Província da Zambezia, centro de Moçambique casado pai de 6 filhos ja maiores de idade. Fez 3ª classe não continuou porque foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com sua a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Milange para Tanzânia na formação militar, mais tarde volta a Maputo, Moçambique para continuar com a sua formação como militar. Atualmente é pensionista do Ministério da Defesa ha mais de 18 anos, e recebe 4.136.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (varões de ferro, chapas de zinco, cimento e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Paulino M. was born in Milange District, Zambezia Province, located in central Mozambique.  He is married and has six grown-up children.  He completed the 3rd grade but did not continue because he was drafted into obligatory military service.  He lives in his own home with his family and does not support anyone else.

He left Milange for Tanzania with the corps, he returned to Maputo, Mozambique so he could continue his military training.  He has received a pension from the Ministry of Defense for more than 18 years.  From this, Paulino receives 4,136 MZN per month, which he uses to pay for household expenses.  He also manages to save some in his bank account.

Paulino has never had loans from other banks.  He found out about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku.  Paulin is requesting 15,000 MZN, which he will use to buy construction material (rebar, galvanized roofing sheets, cement, etc.) to continue building his house.

He promises to pay back the loan on time in order to be able to request more loans in the future.  He plans to ask for new loans to furnish his home.

loans.use: To buy construction material (rebar, galvanized roofing sheets, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Djuma

texts.en:
Djuma is 43 years old and married with three children between the ages of 3 and 8 years old.  He has been working at his food stall for 10 years and knows the business well.  His stall is kept clean and full of produce.  He works from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day of the week.

Djuma has requested this loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company to purchase new products for his stall, including milk, onions, and eggplant.  He would like to use the profits from his business to continue to expand.

loans.use: To purchase more milk, onions, and eggplant

loans.name: Aimee

texts.en:
Aimee is 31 years old and married with three children between the ages of 8 and 12 years old.  She owns a well-organised clothing boutique in the Musanze Markets.  She has had her business for one year and employs one other person.    She works from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. during the week.

Aimee has requested this loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothing for her store and expand her business.  Aimee currently owns some land and she hopes to build a house using the profits gained from the use of this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 48 years old.  She is married and has six children between the ages of 4 and 15 years old.  Her husband works as a teacher.  Beatrice has a business selling bedding items such as sheets and pillowcases.  Her store is well-organized and open from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. during the week.  

Beatrice will use this loan to purchase more sheets and other bedding items.  She is a determined woman who hopes to use the profits from this business to reinvest in more stock to improve her store.

loans.use: To purchase more bedding items to sell

loans.name: Kalisa

texts.en:
Kalisa is 29 years old and is married with a 3 year old child.  His wife works in his business as well.  Kalisa has a clean and well-stocked store selling a large variety of groceries and other items.  He has been in this business for 7 years and is well-known in the district.

Kalisa has requested this loan to expand his stock.  With any profits Kalisa makes from this loan, he will reinvest into the business and continue to expand.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and other items to sell

loans.name: Gbènato Rébecca

texts.fr: Née en 1957, B. Gbènato Rébecca est une veuve ayant à sa charge trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Rébecca vit ensemble avec ses enfants à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Rébecca n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Rébecca mène comme activité depuis vingt deux ans, la vente de divers produits (conserves, sucre, lait, savons, les produits cosmétiques, etc.) dans son quartier. Rébecca s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant obtenu quatre crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus grandissante de sa clientèle, Rébecca souhaite augmenter son stock de produits et se faire plus de profits ; raison pour laquelle Rébecca sollicite un autre prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en: Born in 1957, Gbènato Rébecca B. is a widow with three children in her care, all of whom are in school. Rébecca lives together with her children in Ekpè, in the town of Sèmè-Podji, Benin. Rébecca never attended school. To provide for herself and her children, Rébecca has run a business selling various items (canned goods, sugar, milk, soap, cosmetics, etc.) for 22 years in her area. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She is a longstanding client of ALIDE, having obtained four loans, all of which were repaid properly. Faced with the increasing demands from her customers, Rébecca hopes to increase her stock of goods and obtain greater profits; for this reason, she is seeking another loan from ALIDE.

loans.use: To buy various items (sugar, soap, canned goods, cosmetics, etc.)

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married with 5 children between the ages of 2 and 14.  Emmanuel drives a taxi between Ruhengeri and Cyanika and works from 5am until 7pm.

Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company to purchase spare parts.  He plans to reinvest the profits he makes back into his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for a taxi

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for basic needs for her mother, rent bills and electricity bills. 

She has operated a cosmetic shop for the past three years; her customers are neighbors and passersby. In addition, she operates M-pesa (mobile money transfer service). Susan faces a major challenge of competition in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase hair, food, oil and cosmetics for her cosmetic shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her cosmetic shop.

loans.name: Laura Batista

texts.pt:
Laura Batista B. nasceu no Distrito da Manhiça, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 2 e 8 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Fez 6ª classe não continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa própria com sua a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu da Manhiça para cidade de Maputo com seus pais. Tem um negocio próprio de venda de produtos diversos ha mais de 8 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (ovos, mantas, batata, óleo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para concluir a sua casa.
texts.en:
Laura Batista B. was born in the District of Manhiça, Maputo Province, located in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother of 2 children who are 2 and 8 years old.  The oldest goes to school.  Laura completed 6th grade but did not continue due to financial difficulties.  She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

Laura left Manhiça for Maputo City with her parents.  For more than 8 years, she has had her own business, through which she sells a wide range of goods.  She does not have any employees.  She earns about 4,000 MZN per month, which she uses to pay for household expenses.  She even manages to save some in her bank account.

She has never had loans with other banks.  She found out about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is her first loan with Hluvkuku.  It has a value of 15,000 MZN, which she plans to use to buy products (eggs, blankets, potatoes, oil, etc.) in order to increase her business's stock supply.

Laura promises to pay back the loan on time to be able to have access to others in the future.  She plans to request more loans in order to finish construction on her house.

loans.use: To buy products (eggs, blankets, potatoes, oil, etc.)

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is married with five children, aged between 2 and 14.  He is a motorbike taxi driver in the town of Musanze and works long hours, from 5am until 7pm.   

With the loan he has requested from Kiva through Vision Finance Company, he will purchase spare parts for his motorbike.  With the profits he makes from his work as a taxi driver he hopes to reinvest in his business and eventually buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: Spare parts for motorbike taxi

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 25 years old. He is married with two children who are 1 and 3 years old. Celestin's wife is a housewife. Both of them work to provide for their family. Celestin is a serious businessman and works hard to increase his profit. Normally Celestin sells different kinds of products such as flasks, plates, spoons, other cosmetic products and so forth.  His small shop is open from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day and he has been working in this business for 4 years.

Celestin is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more household products to sell. This loan will be important for him because he will be able to attract more customers by satisfying their demands. With this loan, Celestin believes he will obtain more profit, which he will reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more household items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy products (beer, soft drinks, eggs, potatoes, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Marcelina pertenece al Bancomunal Esperanza que inicia su ciclo 24 con 18 socias. 
Marcelina tiene en FINCA Perú 3 ciclos, le gusta las reuniones D. su bancomunal porque le dan préstamos y pueD. ahorrar, ha aprendido mucho en las capacitaciones sobre la familia, matrimonio, cuidado D. los hijos  y lo pone en práctica en su vida diaria.
Marcelina tiene 41 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideos, huevo, harina, aguas gaseosas entre otros para surtir su tienda D. abarrotes.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca, comprarse un carro y ver a sus hijos profesionales
texts.en:
Marcelina belongs to the Esperanza community bank which is beginning its 24th loan cycle with 18 members.  Marcelina has been with FINCA Perú for 3 loan cycles.  She likes the meetings held by her community bank because they give loans and she can save.  She has learned a lot in their training sessions about family, marriage and caring for children, and she puts it all into practice in her daily life.

Marcelina is 41 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  The loan which she is requesting will be invested in buying rice, sugar, noodles, eggs, flour and soda as well as other products to stock her grocery store.  Her dream is for her business to grow, to buy a car and to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and soda

loans.name: Perpetue

texts.en:
Perpetue is 39 and has 3 children, aged between 14 and 18 years old.  Perpetue sells clothes in the Musanze district of Rwanda.  She has been doing this for 10 years and has a good-sized store that is open from 8am until 6pm during the week.

Perpetue has requested this loan to help her purchase more clothing including different dresses, pants and other items for sale.  She would like to increase her profits from the business and hopes to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with five children, four of whom graduated while one still attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and rent bills.

For over thirteen years, she has operated her business of selling leso (Kikoi’s) and bed sheets from home to her neighbors and passersby.  Halima faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors who buy clothes in credit. She hopes to establish a cloth selling shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a bale of Leso’s (Kiko’s) and bed sheets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of Leso’s (Kiko’s) and bed sheets for resale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr: Emmanuel B. est tailleur à Gisenyi.  Il est marié, et il a un enfant qui a 2 mois. Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter une machine à coudre pour son atelier.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter les matériels de technologie, et le recrutement de personnels.  Avec ses affaires, il cherchera sa propre maison commerciale, et il enseignera les autres personnes ce projet.  Cet affaire lui permettra à accéder toujours au bien être de sa famille, et minerval pour ses enfants.  Emmanuel est aussi éleveur de 3 vaches et 5 chèvres à Nyagatare.
texts.en: Emmanuel B. is a tailor in Gisenyi. He is married and has one child who is two months old. He is going to use his loan to buy a sewing maching for his workshop. His strategy for expanding his business is to increase his technical equipment and to recruit staff. He is planning to find his own commercial premises for his business and he will teach other people his trade. This business will allow him to look after his family and pay his children's school fees. Emmanuel is also raising three cows and five goats in Nyapatare.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Mujeres Vencedoras Unidas 2 Group

texts.en:
Marleny is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Vendedoras Unidas  2 (Unite winners women). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and 2 children. She says that her most difficult challenges is to work hard for her children.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to watch television.

Marleny is excited to be taking her 2nd loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 2 years, starting with her own money. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying beauty and cosmetics products. She will use the profits to finish her house. She wants to have an improve business.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because with this loan the borrowers can go forward with their business and her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally, her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics products for resale

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Née en 1969, D. Philomène est mariée à Janvier et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. La famille réside depuis neuf ans environs à Ekpè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les différents besoins de la famille. Philomène a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour se prendre en charge et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Philomène mène comme activité la vente de tissus et de bidons d'huile végétale à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Philomène achète ses produits dans la même ville. Philomène exerce cette activité depuis treize ans et a déjà bénéficié de cinq crédits  auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Philomène désire renforcer son activité et augmenter le stock de ses produits, mais est limitée par ses moyens ; raison pour laquelle Philomène sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Philomène D. was born in 1969, is married to Janvier, and is mother to three children, who are all at school. As well as their own children, the couple have another child in their care. The family have lived for around nine years in Ekpé in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. The couple provide for the various family needs between them. Philomène attended school very little. In order to provide for her children's needs, she has a business selling fabric and containers of vegetable oil in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Philomène buys her products in the same town. She has been carrying out this business for thirteen years and has already had five loans from ALIDé, all of which she has repaid in full. She would like to boost her business and increase her stock but has limited means to do so; for this reason she is requesting another loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and containers of vegetable oil

loans.name: Felix Obtavio

texts.es:
Felix Obtavio P. T. tiene 36 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Felix   se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 9 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa y terrenos propios y tener buena salud.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Felix Obtavio P. T. is 36 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and child in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He has one child.

The members of the community bank 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) is located in Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Felix grows corn, rice and beans.  He has been doing this for 9 years.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan would help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  His dream is to have his own home and land and to enjoy good health.  Felix likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Elisa Aurelio

texts.pt:
Elisa Aurélio N. nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique casada mãe de 5 filhos de idades entre 1 a 17 anos, os mais velhos continuam a estudar. Fez somente 6ª classe não continuou devido ao casamento pré maturo. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Gaza para Maputo devido a problemas sociais, trabalha como operaria agrícola numa empresa de produção agrícola ha mais de 8 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salario de 1.830.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e não consegue poupar quase nada devido ao elevado custo de vida.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de suas colegas que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas de zinco, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a melhoria da sua casa.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para conclusão da sua casa.
texts.en:
Elisa Aurélio N. was born in the District of Manjacaze in Gaza Province, located in southern Mozambique.  She is married and is the mother of 5 children, who range in age from 1 to 17 years old.  The oldest continue to go to school.  She only completed 6th grade because she married when she was young.  She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left Gaza for Maputo due to social problems.  Elisa has been a worker at an agricultural production company for more than 8 years.  She does not have any of her own employees.  She earns a monthly salary of 1,830 MZN, which she uses to pay for household expenses.  She is not able to save very much due to the high cost of living.

Elisa has never had loans with any other banks.  She found out about Hluvuku through her colleagues who are also clients of the institution.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku.  She is requesting 10,500 MZN, with which she plans to buy construction material (cement, galvanized roofing sheets, sand, etc.) to continue making improvements on her house.

She promises to pay back the loan on time to have access to others in the future.  She plans to request new loans in order to finish construction on her house.

loans.use: To buy construction material (cement, galvanized roofing sheets, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Angella

texts.en: M. Angela lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, three of whom are in school. Angela has a business of selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Angela sells her products from home, by means of retail. Angela has requested for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of oranges, mangoes and cabbage. She also generates additional income through her restaurant. The main business challenge(s) for Angela include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing fruits and vegetables. Angela lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of oranges, mangoes and cabbage

loans.name: Santiago Leonardo

texts.es:
Santiago Leonardo M. T. tiene 22 años. Es soltero, vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No Tiene  hijo 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Santiago    se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 3 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Santiago Leonardo  M. T. is 22 years old.  He is single.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He doesn't have any children.

The members of the community bank 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) is located in  Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Santiago has been growing corn, rice and beans for 3 years.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan would help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  His dream is to have his own home.  Santiago likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean de dieu in Kigali, Rwanda!  Jean de dieu is 27 years old, is single and has adopted two orphans.

Jean de dieu has been a motorbike taxi driver for three years. He is a hard worker and gets up at 7 am everyday to start transporting people to their work places. 

Jean de dieu has requested a loan of 500,000 RWF to buy his own motorbike taxi. His goal is to cover the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school and one who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills, school fees, and electricity bills. 

She operates a restaurant business from home; her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Salim faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She hopes to expand and establish a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, bundles of wheat flour, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business and her living standards.

loans.use: To  purchase sacks of beans, bundles of wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia lives in Kasur, a small city in Pakistan known for its leather industry, in a three-room brick house with her family in the Chaki Piaray Lal area. She is 45 and has three sons, all of whom are involved in different businesses and contribute financially to the family. Her husband operates a business selling floor tiles. He runs a shop in the market, earning income by selling different colored and designed tiles to customers. Nowadays, tiles are in high demand as people like to cover their floors with tiles rather than with marble, etc.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her clothes selling business, which she started fifteen years ago. She purchases clothes from Lahore’s wholesale market, Ichra and Shahalmi, and sells them to her local area clients on profit. With the loan, she will buy different varieties of clothes in bulk in order to increase her sales. She is hopeful that a loan investment will put her business in a better position and that she will be able to make more money by offering more variety to her clients. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. She has maintained good credit behavior in her previous loan years.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Catine Alberto

texts.pt:
Catine Alberto N. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casado e pai de 1 filho de 1 ano de idade. Fez 10ª classe não continuou devido as dificuldades financeiras pelos pais. Vive na casa dispensada pelos familiares com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Nunca saiu da Província de Maputo, apenas tem viajado para os países vizinhos para a compra da sua mercadoria. Tem um negocio próprio de venda de produtos diversos ha mais de 3 anos, não possui empregados e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 8.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum em sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através do secretario do bairro que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (farinha, sardinhas em lata, pilhas, cerveja, refrescos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para ampliar o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Catine Alberto N. was born in the District of Boane in Maputo Province, located in southern Mozambique.  He is married and is the father of 1 child who is 1 year old.  He completed 10th grade but did not continue due to his parents' financial difficulties.  With his family, he lives in alternative housing for families with low incomes does not support anyone else.

He has never left Maputo Province though he has traveled to neighboring countries to buy merchandise for his store.  For more than 3 years, Catine has had his own business selling a variety of products; he does not have any employees.  He earns about 8,000 MZN each month, which he uses to pay for household expenses.  He even manages to save some in his bank account.

Catine has never had loans through other banks.  He found out about Hluvuku from the district secretary, who is also a client of the institution.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku.  He is requesting 10,500 MZN, which he plans to use to buy products (flour, canned sardines, batteries, beer, soda, etc.) to increase his inventory.

He promises to pay back the loan on time in order to have access to others in the future.  He plans to request new loans to help him expand his business.

loans.use: To buy products (flour, canned sardines, batteries, beer, soda, etc.)

loans.name: Choukouratou

texts.fr: O. Choukouratou est née le 08 Octobre 1975 à Sakété, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Mariée à AMBALIOU Razack, un couturier, Choukouratou  est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Choukouratou habite depuis dix huit ans, le quartier Pk10 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec son mari et ses enfants. Choukouratou assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. N'ayant jamais été à l'école, Choukouratou  a commencé depuis dix huit ans environs, la vente de divers produits (savons, lait, farine de manioc, bombons, biscuits, etc.) et aussi des sandalettes dans son quartier. Choukouratou achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. La clientèle de Choukouratou s'accroît de plus en plus et elle désire renforcer son activité afin de mieux les satisfaire. C'est pour cette raison que Choukouratou  sollicite à nouveau un concours financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: Choukouratou O. was born on October 8, 1975 in Sakété, in the Ouémé Department. Married to Razack Ambaliou, a taylor, Choukouratou is the mother of three children, all of whom go to school. For 18 years, Choukouratou has been living in the Pk10 neighborhood in the community of Sèmè-Podji, with her husband and children. Choukouratou and her husband jointly provide for various family needs. Never having attended school, about 18 years ago Choukouratou started selling miscellaneous products (soap, milk, manioc flour, candy, cookies etc) as well as sandals in her neighborhood. Choukouratou stocks up in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is an old-time client of ALIDé and took out four loans in the past, all of them well repaid. Choukouratou’s customer base keeps growing, and she would like to strengthen her business  in order to better meet customer demand. This is why Choukouratou is again seeking financing from ALIDé.

loans.use: Purchasing miscellaneous products (soap, milk, manioc flour, candy, cookies, sugar etc)

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena R. C. tiene 36 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con los padres y con un hijo vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene  1 hijo 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Maria   se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 95años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos para tener sus propios cultivos.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Maria Elena R. C. is 36 years old.  She has a common-law husband and lives with her parents and child in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has one child.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Maria has been growing corn, rice and beans for 5 years. She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to buy her own land so that she can have her own crops.  She likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa Graciela

texts.es:
Rosa Graciela M. P. tiene 33 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Rosa  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 8 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un solar en el pueblo para un negocio familiar y dar el estudio a los hijos.
Le gusta hacer deporte y los fines de semana asistir a la iglesia.
texts.en:
Rosa Graciela M. P. is 33 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has 3 children.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Rosa has been growing corn, rice and beans for 8 years. She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to buy an undeveloped plot of land in the town for a family business and for her children to have an education.

She likes taking part in sports and going to church on the weekend.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, clothing, and food. 

She has operated a tailoring business for over six years from home. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Mwanaidi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to build her own home in the future. 

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase cloth for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 32 years old and married with three children who are between the ages of 1 and 7 years old. She is commonly known for selling a variety of goods in her boutique.  Jacqueline has been in this business for about five years and works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m.  She employs 4 people to help her run the business.

Jacqueline has requested a loan from the Kiva partner Vision Finance Company to expand her business by adding more products that she can sell.  With the help of this loan, Jacqueline has hope for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more products for wholesale

loans.name: Ygnacio Cecilio

texts.es:
Ygnacio Cecilio P. T. tiene 65 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañera y los nietos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 8 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Ygnacio  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 15 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener buena salud y que les vaya bien en la cosecha de los cultivos.
Le gusta trabajar en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Ygnacio Cecilio P. T. is 65 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and their grandchildren in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  They have 8 children.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Ygnacio has been growing corn, rice and beans for 15 years.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan would help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  His dream is to enjoy good health and for his harvests to go well.  Ygnacio likes farming.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Hello from Faustin in Rwanda!  Faustin is 45 years old and married with seven children between the ages 10 and 27. He also has one adopted orphan. This is the first loan he has requested from Kiva lenders.  He has 15 years of experience as a butcher and his shop is open from 6 am until 8 pm.   Faustin runs a butcher business where he sells beef to the local people. He employs four people to help him run the business. A kilogram of beef costs 1800 Rwandan Francs ($3), and Faustin sells about 350 kilograms a day.

Faustin has requested a loan of 600,000 Rwandan Francs to be repaid in 10 months.  He wants to buy two cows to slaughter during the upcoming Christmas festivals.

loans.use: To buy two cows to slaughter during Christmas festivals

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.fr: Jean Pierre Habyarimana est commerçant, et il a une boutique à Gisenyi.  Il a 23 ans, et il est célibataire.  Avec son prêt, il veut acheter 200 paires de chaussures et 30 pantalons pout son commerce dans le marché de Gisenyi.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de l’augmentation des quantités vendues dans sa boutique.  Il voudrait devenir un grand commerçant dans le secteur Gisenyi, dans la province de l’ouest. Pour sa famille et lui-même, il voudrait construire sa propre maison d’habitation, et, suite aux bénéfices réalisés, il payera les frais d’études pour son petit frère.  Quand il n’est pas dans le marché, il est aussi éleveur des chèvres.
texts.en: Jean Pierre Habyarimana is a merchant; he has a store in Gisenyi. He is 23 years old and single. With his loan, he would like to  buy 200 pairs of shoes and 30 trousers for his store at the GIsenyi market. His strategy for increasing his revenue is to increase the quantities of goods sold in his store. He would like to have a big store in the Gisenyi sector, in the Western province. For his relatives and himself, he would like to build a house to live in; also, thanks to his revenues, he will play the tuition of his younger brother. When he is not at the market, he also works raising goats.

loans.use: Purchasing shoes and trousers for his business

loans.name: Amelia Graca

texts.pt:
Amélia Graça C. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada esperando um filho. Fez 12ª classe não continuou porque não conseguiu ingressar no ensino superior. Vive na casa própria com seu esposo e sustenta sua mãe e sobrinho enviando algum dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas de casa.

Nunca saiu da Província de Maputo, trabalha como docente ha mais de 2 anos e não possui nenhum empregado. Tem um salario mensal de 3.359.00mt e 2.000.00mt da prestação de serviços no salão de cabeleireiro o qual aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar um pouco em sua casa para as despesas de melhoria da sua casa.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de suas colegas que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas de zinco, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a melhoria da sua casa.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para conclusão da sua casa.
texts.en:
Amélia Graça C. was born in the city of Matola in Maputo Province, located in southern Mozambique.  She is married and is pregnant.  She finished 12th grade but did not continue studying because she was not able to enroll in a higher education program.  She lives in her own house with her husband and supports her mother and nephew by sending them some money to help pay for household expenses.

She has never left Maputo Province.  For more than 2 years, Amélia has worked a teacher.  She does not employ anybody to help her.  She earns a monthly salary of 3,359 MZN from this job and 2,000 MZN as a hairdresser at a beauty salon.  She uses the money to pay for household expenses and manages to save some of her earnings in her house in order to pay for home improvements.  

Amélia has never had loans with other banks.  She found out about Hluvuku through her colleagues who are also clients of this institution.  This is her first loan with Hluvuku.  She is requesting 12,000 MZN, which she will use to buy construction material (cement, galvanized roofing sheets, sand, etc.) in order to keep making house improvements.  

She promises to pay back the loan on time so she will be able to have access to others in the future.  She plans to request new loans in order to finish construction on her house.

loans.use: To buy construction material (cement, galvanized roofing sheets, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single woman with seven children. The elder daughter is married, two of the children have graduated, while four still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees. 

She operates an open-air food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passerby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish a cereal shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of Irish potatoes and packets of baking powder. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of Irish potatoes and packets of baking powder.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 24 years old and married with one child who is three years old.  Christine owns a small business selling tomatoes, onion and cooking oil.  These are very common foodstuffs used by all families in Rwanda.  Christine works hard in order to improve her economic situation. The hours of her business are from 7 in the morning until 8 in the evening every day. Christine is very new to this business and has been working in the food market for only eight months.

Christine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more tomatoes and other foodstuffs, which can help her attract more customers. Christine hopes the business will be profitable, as she would like to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes and other vegetables to sell

loans.name: Gbossèdé Célestine

texts.fr: H. Gbossèdé Célestine est née le 31 Juillet 1976 à Adjohoun, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Mariée à ALANMENOU Rémi, Célestine est mère de quatre enfans, dont deux sont à sa charge. Célestine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à PK11 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis cinq ans. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Célestine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Célestine prépare et vend de la nourriture (riz, haricot, pâte de maïs, oeufs, etc.) à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Célestine achète ses produits à Cotonou. Célestine exerce cette activité depuis trois ans et a obtenu une fois déjà de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse, Célestine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité, afin d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et ses revenus. C'est pour cette raison que Célestine sollicite un nouveau crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Gbossèdé Célestine H. was born on July 31, 1976 in Adjohon, in the Ouémé district. Married to Rémi Alanmenou, Célestine is the mother of four children,   two of whom are in her care. For five years, Célestine has been living together with her children and husband in the PK11 neighborhood in the Sèmè-Podji community. The spouses jointly take care of various family needs. Célestine has had very little schooling. To support herself, Célestine prepares food for sale (rice, beans, soft-boiled polenta, eggs, etc) in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Celestine purchases her groceries in Cotonou. She has been in this business for three years and already obtained a loan from ALIDé before, repaying it well. Facing an increase in customer demand, Célestine would like to bolster her stock and expand her business, in order to increase her sales and  revenues. This is why Célestine is seeking a new loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries (rice, beans, corn) and sauce condiments

loans.name: Francisca Bremilda

texts.es:
Francisca Bremilda T. R. tiene 60 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y los nietos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 7 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Francisca  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 8 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta realizar sus tareas dentro de su hogar y ayudar al esposo en la cosecha.
texts.en:
Francisca Bremilda T. R. is 60 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and their grandchildren in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has 7 children.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in  Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Francisca has been growing corn, rice and beans for 8 years. Francisca is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to own her own home.

Francisca likes doing her household chores and helping her husband with their harvests.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José de 47 años, tiene una panadería en la parte delantera de su casa surtida con algunos viveres de primera necesidad. Vive con su esposa y su hijo en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes. 
 
Hace 5 años atrás el aprendió hacer panes ya que sus hermanos tenían panaderías y le ayudaron para que el tenga una. Comprar un horno para tener su propia panadería en la parte delantera de su casa. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00am haciendo panes hasta las 20h00pm. Ha podido surtir su panadería con algunos víveres de primera necesidad para tener más ingresos.  

El quiere comprar con el préstamo levaduras, harina, lácteos para su panadería. En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de su panadería en calles principales para tener más oportunidades de venta.
texts.en:
José who is 47 years old and has a bakery in the front part of his house also stocked with some some basic products.  He lives with his wife and son in an urban zone called Guasmo, where the majority of the residents are business people.

Five years ago he learned to make bread since his brothers had bakeries and helped him get one of his own. He purchased an oven to start the bakery in the front of his house.  He currently works from 7 in the morning to 8 in the evening.  He has been able to stock his bakery with some basic products to improve his income.

With the loan he wants to buy yeast, flour, milk for his bakery.  In the future he wants to open branches of his bakery in the main streets in order to have more sales opportunities.

loans.use: Purchase flour and butter.

loans.name: Susana Eufemia

texts.es:
Susana Eufemia M. T. tiene 29 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Susana  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 4 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una casa propia y grande.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Susana Eufemia M. T. is 29 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and her children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has 2 children.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Susana has been growing corn, rice and beans for 4 years. Susana is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to own her own big home.  She likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Josefa Johanna

texts.es:
Josefa Johanna Munoz T. tiene 27 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Susana  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 3 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Josefa Johanna M. T. is 27 years old. She has a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and children in the canton of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province. She has three children.

The members of the Unidos Somos Más solidarity group are located in the Marañon area, in the Puerto Pechiche parish which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This rural cooperative works in short cycle farming planting corn, rice, and beans.

Susana has worked growing corn, rice and beans especially for the past three years. She buys her products in Comercial López in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same area.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops. The loan support will help her financially to meet her needs. She faces challenges such as pests, diseases, and the change in climate. Her dream is to buy a car.

She likes to play sports.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

She operates a business selling natural fresh juices. In addition, she has been selling handbags and fresh water from home for over two years, which adds to her other source of income. Her major customers are neighbors and passersby. Halima faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase a water tank for selling fresh water. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business and her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank for selling fresh water.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz lives in Kasur, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its leather industry. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family in the Chaki Piaray Lal area. She is married to A. A. who has a shopping bag selling business. He purchases them in wholesale and sells them to shoppers in various markets, who use them to keep their purchases. He has been operating this business for over 10 years and earns a good income from it.

Shahnaz supports her family by doing embroidery work. She receives orders from neighboring clients and fulfills them on time to earn an income. This income helps her to pay the utility expenses and her children's school fees. She has three sons and three daughters. Her eldest daughter helps her with the embroidery business and the remaining children attend school.

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy shopping bags in bulk for resale. She hopes that the loan investment will bring good profits to her husband and that his business will grow further. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In her previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy shopping bags for resale.

loans.name: B. Valentine

texts.fr: A. B. Valentine est née en 1964 à Sèmè-Podji au Bénin et est mariée à SEGLA Appolinaire. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Il y a près de cinq ans que la famille s'est installée à PK10, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Valentine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Depuis cinq ans environs, Valentine mène comme activité la vente de produits vivriers (maïs, haricot, riz, etc.), des plateaux d'oeufs frais, de l'huile de palme, des savons, etc. à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est aussi à Cotonou que Valentine se ravitaille. Valentine désire élever le niveau de son activité et accroître sa clientèle et donc son chiffre d'affaire ; raison pour laquelle Valentine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un nouveau crédit.
texts.en:
B. Valentine A. was born in 1964 in Sèmè-Podji, Benin. She is married to Appolinaire SEGLA. The couple has four children in their care, two of which are their own. All the children attend school. 

The family settled in PK10, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, almost five years ago. Valentine seldom attended school. About five years ago, she started a business selling food products (maize, beans, rice, etc.), trays of fresh eggs, palm oil, soap, etc. She gets her stocks and sells the merchandise in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. 

Valentine wishes to bolster her activity and increase her customer base, and as a result, boost her profits. For this reason, she is seeking a new loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: To purchase grain, palm oil, soap and eggs

loans.name: Juana Anatolia

texts.es:
Juana Anatolia M. A. tiene 81 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Juana  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 25 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un tienda de abastos.
Le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Juana Anatolia M. A. is 81 years old. She has a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and children in the canton of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province. She has three children.

The members of the Unidos Somos Más solidarity group are located in the Marañon area, in the Puerto Pechiche parish which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This rural cooperative works in short cycle farming planting corn, rice, and beans.

Juana has worked growing corn, rice and beans especially for the past 25 years. She buys her products in Comercial López in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same area.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops. The loan support will help her financially to meet her needs. She faces challenges such as pests, diseases, and the change in climate. Her dream is to have a grocery store.

She likes to work.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Lorena Pilar

texts.es:

Lorena  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 2 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.
Le gusta cocinar toda clase de comidas.
texts.en:
Lorena Pilar M. P. is 24 years old. She has a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and children in the canton of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province. She has three children.

The members of the Unidos Somos Más solidarity group are located in the Marañon area, in the Puerto Pechiche parish which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This rural cooperative works in short cycle farming planting corn, rice, and beans.

Lorena has worked growing corn, rice and beans especially for the past two years. She buys her products in Comercial López in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same area.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Sixto Fariel

texts.es:
Sixto B. R. tiene su negocio en el centro de Barranquilla donde confluye  una gran parte del comercio de Barranquilla, allí comercializa ropa deportiva para caballeros que es la única línea con la que trabaja. Sixto solicita su credikiva que es el tercer financiamiento de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el comprará sudaderas suéteres pantalonetas que exhibirá en una época de mayor ventas para su negocio, como lo es el fin de año, época en la que   sus clientes reciben primas, bonificaciones, aguinaldos  y lo dedican a los gastos de la  ropa deportiva que requieren  para provisionarse para todo el año.
Cuando Sixto llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla procedente de Cúcuta,  una ciudad  fronteriza al norte del municipio de Santander, lo hizo en busca de mejores oportunidades porque en su natal Cúcuta, la situación se había vuelto difícil por cuestiones de la devaluación del Bolívar, moneda de Venezuela, país frontera de Colombia.  Sixto viene de una familia de comerciantes,  especialmente en la linea de ropa, y él una vez llegó a Barranquilla se dedicó a la venta de jugos elaborados con frutas naturales, pero hace 8 años empezó a vender  camisillas y como le fue muy bien, gradualmente adicionó ropa deportiva. El se siente muy feliz con su vida  en Barranquilla, porque en esta  ciudad  no solo encontró su fuente de empleo, sino también el amor de su esposa, con quien comparte todos sus sueños en especial el de construir un futuro exitosos. Ellos en la actualidad cuentan con dos puestos de trabajo y planea mas adelante en un futuro no inmediato tener un almacén y comprar su casa con el fruto de su trabajo y sacrificio constante.  Con los financiamientos realizados por la Fundación, ha logrado ampliar su negocio y hoy no solo cuenta con un punto de ventas como cuando inició,  sino con dos que ha levantado con la ayuda de su esposa y por eso aunque se siente satisfecho tiene grandes aspiraciones de mejoramiento con su vida y con su empresa.
texts.en:
Sixto B. R. has a business in the center of Barranquilla, where a lot part of the business of Barranquilla happens. There, he sells sports clothing for men and it is the only line with which he works. Sixto is requesting his third loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy sweatshirts, sweaters and pants to sell during the season with the highest sales. As it is the end of the year, his customers receive bonuses and spend them on sports clothing to last them the year.

When Sixto arrived in Barranquilla from Cúcuta, a border city north of the municipality of Santander, he was in search of better opportunities. At that time, the situation was difficult in his native city of Cúcuta because of the devaluation of the Venezuelan currency (the bolívar), as the country borders Colombia. Sixto comes from a family of merchants, especially in clothing. When he arrived to Barranquilla, he worked selling juices made from fresh fruits. However, he began selling sports tops and when it went well for him, he gradually added sports clothing. He is happy with his life in Barranquilla because he not only found his job in this city, but also the love of his wife, with whom he shares all of his dreams, especially that of building a successful future. They currently have two places of business and in the more distant future, he plans to have a store and buy a house with the fruit of his labor and constant sacrifice. With the loans made by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, he has been able to expand his business and today he not only has the one place of business with which he began, but two which he started with the help of his wife. This is why although he is satisfied, he has big aspirations of improving his life and his business.

loans.use: To buy sweatshirts, sweaters and pants to sell during the season where his business has the highest sales

loans.name: Alicia Yisenia

texts.es:
Alicia Yisenia F. M. tiene 34 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Alicia  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 8 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia y comprar terreno.
Le gusta cocinar toda clase de comidas y lavar la ropa.
texts.en:
Alicia Yisenia F. M. is 34 years old. She has a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and children in the canton of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province. She has three children.

The members of the Unidos Somos Más solidarity group are located in the Marañon area, in the Puerto Pechiche parish which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This rural cooperative works in short cycle farming planting corn, rice, and beans.

Alicia has worked growing corn, rice and beans especially for the past eight years. She buys her products in Comercial López in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same area.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops. The loan support will help her financially to meet her needs. She faces challenges such as pests, diseases, and the change in climate. Her dream is to have her own house and to purchase land.

She likes to cook all kinds of food and wash clothes.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 28 years old and single. Eugene is known in the business of selling new clothes, mainly men’s clothes. He has been in this business for about five years and the hours of his business are from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day except Saturday and Sunday. He currently employs two people in this business.

Eugene has now requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business by adding a variety of styles of men’s and women’s clothes. If successful, Eugene hopes to build a house and would like to get married soon.

loans.use: To add men's and women's clothes

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

She has operated a dumpling sale business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she sells fresh water which contributes to her other source of income. Kibibi faces a major challenge of seasonality and fluctuation of prices of commodities in the market. She hopes to establish a big retail shop in the future. 

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase water pipes for her fresh water selling business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase water pipes for her fresh water sale business

loans.name: Karina Silvana

texts.es:
Karina Silvana M. A. tiene 21 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Karina se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 2 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa y ponerse un negocio.
Le gusta ir a misa los domingos.
texts.en:
Karina Silvana M. A. is 21 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she lives with her life-partner and child in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.

The members of the “Unidos Somos Más” (United We Are More) Communal Bank are located in the Marañon precinct of the Puerto Pechiche parish belonging to the Pueblo Viejo canton.  This communal bank devotes itself to the short cycle of growing corn, rice, and beans.

Karina has been growing crops, especially corn, rice, and beans, for two years.  She buys the products at the López business in Ventanas, and she sells her products at the Ventanas market in the same precinct.

She is requesting the loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of the loan will help her  get the necessary supplies.  She faces challenges like pest infestations, illnesses, and climate changes.  Her dream is to buy a house and set up a business.

She likes to go to mass on Sundays.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Shareefan's Group

texts.en:
Shareefan, 54, supports her family with her thread-selling business. She gets thread from used sweaters and sells the thread to thread sellers. Her husband is also involved in the business and has a power loom machine, used to weave textiles, at home.  

Shareefan lives in Kasur, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan famous for its leather industry, in a three-room brick house in the Chaki Piaray Lal area. She has four sons and two daughters. Her daughters are married and her sons are young and stay at home. Shareefan could not provide an education for her children due to financial constraints.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her thread-selling business. With the loan, she will buy used sweaters to get a large quantity of thread. This will help her increase her sales and fulfill the orders of her clients. She has been operating this business for over ten years and is hopeful that a loan investment will bring further profit. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior by paying the loan installments on time.

loans.use: To buy used sweaters for her thread-making business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: S. Josephine est mariée à DEDJI Bernard et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge, en plus de leurs enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Il y a près de onze ans que la famille s'est installée à Djeffé dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Josephine apporte une aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les différents besoins de la famille. Josephine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Josephine vend des draps, des rideaux, et des tissus par le système de distribution. Josephine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Josephine exerce cette activité depuis huit ans. C'est la première fois que Josephine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit en vue d'augmenter son stock de produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Josephine S. is married to Bernard Dedji and is the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. The couple has one other child in their care, besides their own children. All the children are in school.

About eleven years ago, the family moved to Djeffé, in the Sèmè-Podji district. Josephine helps her husband by taking responsibility, along with him, for the family's various needs.  She did not go to shcool, and to meet her needs, Josephine sells sheets, curtains, and other fabric through the distribution system.  Josephine gets her supplies at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She has been involved in this activity for eight years. 

This is the first time that Josephine has asked ALIDé for a loan, in order to increase her inventory and better meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy sheets, curtains, and fabric.

loans.name: Juana Rossana

texts.es:
Juana Rossana M. T. tiene 24 años. Es separada, vive con los padres y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Le gusta hacer deporte.

Her dream is to have her own house.  She likes to go play sports.

Le gusta cocinar y lavar.

Mónica Narcisa F. M. is 25 years old.  She is separated, and she lives with life partner and her children in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.
