Her dream is to have her own house.

She likes cooking and washing.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is a widowed woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees. 

For over 40 years, she has operated a tailoring business from home, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Charlotte faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition in her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of cloth materials for her tailoring shop. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cloth materials for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Amalia Rufina

texts.es:
Amalia Rufina Z. T. tiene 58 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 8 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Amalia se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 5 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es ponerse un negocio.
Le gusta cocinar y lavar.
texts.en:
Amalia Rufina Z. T. is 58 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children. They live in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos. She has 8 children.  

The members of the rural communal bank UNIDOS SOMO MAS [Together we are More] are in the community of El Marañon, in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. This bank is dedicated to short cycle agricultural work such as planting corn, rice and beans.  

Amalia has worked especially with planting corn, rice and beans for five years. She buys her products at Comercial López in Ventanas and sells them in  in the market in Ventanas and in the same community.  

She is asking for the loan to buy agricultural materials and fertilizers for her crops. The support of the loan will help her to meet her needs financially. They face challenges such as pests, diseases, and weather variation. Her dream is to open a business. She likes to cook and clean.

loans.use: Agricultural materials and fertilizers

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina lives in Kasur, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan famous for its tannery industry. She lives in the Chaki Piaray Lal area in a three-room brick house with her husband, two sons and daughter. Her daughter is studying while her sons have not yet started their education. Her husband is a government employee on a meager income and Rubina operates a thread-selling business. She gets thread from used sweaters and sells it to thread retailers for a profit.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her thread-selling business. She will use the loan to buy a large stock of used sweaters. This will help her make more thread which she can then sell to retailers for a good price and increase her household income. She has been doing this for five years and is hopeful that a loan investment will help her to become more profitable.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she proved herself to be a responsible client by paying her installments on time.

loans.use: To buy used sweaters for a thread-making business.

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia S. lives in the Kawala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. 

Lukia has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Lukia sells her products from home, by means of retail. 

Lukia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through selling piped water. The main business challenges for Lukia include the ever increasing prices of second-hand clothes and the rainy season.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and also buy a plot of land to build a permanent business premise. Lukia lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Gloriose

texts.en:
Gloriose is 46 years old and married to an accountant. She has five children who are between 17 and 27 years old. All her children attend school. 

Gloriose sells handcrafts such as shoes and baskets. She has been doing this business for three years. She has requested this loan to buy more handcrafts to sell and she expects to build a house from the profit and set up a guest house. She has revealed that her business succeeds because it sustains the family needs.

loans.use: To buy more handcrafts to sell

loans.name: Belgica Raquel

texts.es:
Belgica Raquel  G. S. tiene 33 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Belgica se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 5 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar casa.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Belgica Raquel G. S. is 33 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has two children.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Belgica has been growing corn, rice and beans for 5 years. She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to buy her own home.  She likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 41 years old. She is married and has five children who are between five and twenty years old. All her children go to school. Her husband works as a driver. She sells art crafts and she has had this business for a period of four years. She needs this loan to buy more shoes, necklaces and bags to sell. 

Pauline says that the profit from her business will be used to expand her house.  She says that her business succeeds because of customer satisfaction and the way she manages to raise school fees for her children also indicates her business success.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, necklaces and bags to sell.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 27 years old and single.  Theogene owns an Internet café in Kimironko, a suburb of Kigali. He provides internet access for his customers and has a secretarial service for his customers.  

Theogene has requested this loan to buy more paper, ink for printers, files, and more internet broadband.  His dream is to buy more computers for his growing business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Angela Domitila

texts.es:
Angela Domitila M. M. tiene 55 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Angela se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 15 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terreno.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Angela Domitila M. M. is 55 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has two children.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Angela has been growing corn, rice and beans for 15 years. She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to buy her own plot of land.  She likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Jennifer Carolina

texts.es:
Jennifer de 19 años, tiene una tienda de víveres. Vive con sus padres en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes.

Hace 1 año atrás tiene su tienda de víveres gracias a la ayuda de sus padres quienes le préstamo un pequeño capital y con algunos ahorros que tenia. En la actualidad trabaja con ayuda de su mama desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días vendiendo  arroz la libra a $ 0.32, bebidas a $ 1.25, confites de $ 0.05 c/u. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como arroz, azúcar, enlatados para que su tienda se vea mas surtida. En el futuro quiere agrandar la tienda con espacio y mercadería.
texts.en:
Jennifer is 19 years old and has a food store.  She lives with her parents in an urban zone called Guasmo, which is noted for the fact that most of its residents are business owners.

She has had the food store for 1 year.  She started it with some savings that she had and thanks to her parents who helped her by giving her a small loan.  She currently works, with the help from her mother, from 7 AM until 9 PM every day selling rice for $.32 per pound, beverages for $1.25 and sweets for $.05 each.

With the loan she wants to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, and canned goods to better supply her store.  In the future she wants to enlarge her store space and merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase rice , sugar and canned goods.

loans.name: Gil Esteban

texts.es:
Gil Esteban C. T. tiene 42 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Gil se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 15 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar el estudio a los hijos.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Gil Esteban C. T. is 42 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos. He has 3 children.  

The members of the rural communal bank UNIDOS SOMO MAS [Together We Are More] are in the community of El Marañon, in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. This bank is dedicated to short cycle agricultural work such as corn, rice and beans.  

Gil has worked especially with the planting of corn, rice and beans for 15 years. He buys his products at the Comercial López in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in his same community.  

He is asking for the loan to buy agricultural materials and fertilizers for his crops. The support of the loan will help him to meet his financial needs. They have faced challenges such as pests and diseases and weather variation. His dream is give his children and education. He likes to play sports.

loans.use: Agricultural materials and fertilizers.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel vive en casa propia en la zona de Senkata de la ciudad de el Alto, su esposo se dedica al transporte como chofer asalariado, vive junto a su hijo el cual esta en el ultimo curso de colegio. 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de material de construcción, para construir una habitación para vivir más confortablemente y así mejorara su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Es el primer crédito en Impro y primero vía kiva.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel lives in her own house in the zone of Senkata, Alto City. Her husband is a driver and they live with their son who is a senior in high school.

The loan will be used to buy construction materials to build an additional room. This would allow them to improve their living conditions and quality of life. 

This is her first loan with IMPRO, through KIVA.

loans.use: To build an additional room in the house thus improving living conditions

loans.name: Jenny Marisol

texts.es:
Jenny Marisol C. C. tiene 32 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Jenny se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 10 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar el estudio a los hijos y comprar casa.
Le gusta hacer deporte
texts.en:
Jenny Marisol C. C. is 32 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and their children in Ventanas Canton in Los Rios Province. They have 5 children.

The members of the V.R.C. “UNIDOS SOMOS MAS” {Together We Are More] are in the area El Maranon, near the Puerto Pechiche parish part of Pueblo Viejo Canton. This service point is dedicated to farming short cycle crops like corn, rice and beans.

Jenny has grown corn, rice and beans for ten years. She buys her supplies in Comercial Lopez in Ventanas y sells her products in the market of Ventanas in the area of Maranon. 

She is requesting the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops. It will provide economic support to her household. They face challenges like plagues, illnesses and weather changes. She likes sports, and her dream is to provide for her children's schooling and to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Vianney

texts.en:
Vianney is 37 years old. He is married and the father of three children between the ages 5 and 11. He is a carpenter. He makes and repairs home and office furniture (e.g., tables, chairs, beds, wardrobes, etc.).  His business is open from 8a.m until 6p.m and he has 13 years experience working in this business.  Vianney currently employs six people. 

He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to add to his stock of wood. He says that once he gets this loan he will make a profit and pay the school fees of his children and improve the welfare of his family. He is seen by the community as a hard-working and trustworthy man.

loans.use: To increase his stock of wood

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. lives in the Kawala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children; all of them are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (sisters).    Annet has a business selling shoes.  She has been in this business for ten years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Annet sells her products in a market, retail.   

 Annet has requested a loan of 200,000/- Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of shoes. She also generates additional income through selling charcoal. The main business challenges for   include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only. 

Annet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of shoes

loans.name: Ines Marlene

texts.es:
Ines Marlene V. A. tiene 25 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Ines se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 10 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  comprar casa.
Le gusta cocinar, planchar y escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Ines Marlene V. A. is 25 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and their children in Ventanas Canton in Los Rios Province. They have 3 children.

The members of the V.R.C. “UNIDOS SOMOS MAS” {Together We Are More] are in the area El Maranon, near the Puerto Pechiche parish part of Pueblo Viejo Canton. This service point is dedicated to farming short cycle crops like corn, rice and beans.

Ines has grown corn, rice and beans for ten years. She buys her supplies in Comercial Lopez in Ventanas y sells her products in the market of Ventanas in the area of Maranon. 

She is requesting the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops. It will provide economic support to her household. They face challenges like plagues, illnesses and weather changes. She likes to cook, iron, listen to music and her dream is to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Renacer 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is the coordinator of her group Renacer 1 & 2 (Reborn). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 6 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to work hard for her children. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying reading the Bible. 

Rosa is excited to be taking her 2nd loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for a month, starting with some saving she had. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying chickens for her chicken butcher shop. She will use the profits to finish her house and to invest in her business. She dreams of having a farm. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to improve her economic situation and to go forward with her business, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and intermittent electricity.

loans.use: to buy chickens to butcher

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en:
Gerard is 26 years old and is single. He is commonly known in the business of selling a variety of products for the home. Gerard has been in this business for about one year and works from 6 am until 8 pm. He employs one person to help him run the business.

Gerard has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business by adding more products.  He would like to reinvest any new profits that he makes back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell in his store

loans.name: Clara Virginia

texts.es:
Clara Virginia A. M. tiene 54 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Clara se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 20 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  comprar casa.
Le gusta asistir a la iglesia los domingos.
texts.en:
Clara Virgina A. M. is 54 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and their children in Ventanas Canton in Los Rios Province. They have 3 children.

The members of the V.R.C. “UNIDOS SOMOS MAS” {Together We Are More] are in the area El Maranon, near the Puerto Pechiche parish part of Pueblo Viejo Canton. This service point is dedicated to farming short cycle crops like corn, rice and beans.

Clara has grown corn, rice and beans for twenty years. She buys her supplies in Comercial Lopez in Ventanas y sells her products in the market of Ventanas in the area of Maranon. 

She is requesting the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops. It will provide economic support to her household. They face challenges like plagues, illnesses and weather changes.  Her dream is to buy a house and she likes to attend church on Sundays.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 25 years old and is married. Charles runs a sorghum mill in Kanazi district in Rwanda.  His business is open from 6am until 6pm every day.

Charles has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business and buy another mill.  With this additional mill, Charles expects to earn more profits, which he will reinvest into the business.

loans.use: To buy a sorghum mill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Sara Priscila

texts.es:
Sara Priscila S. Z. tiene 35 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Sara Priscila S. Z. is 35 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has 4 children.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Sara has been growing corn, rice and beans for 10 years. She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to buy her own house and plot of land.  She likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Juana Elisa

texts.es:
Juana Elisa S. Z. tiene 31 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Juana se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 8 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  comprar casa y terreno.
Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Juana S. Z. is 31 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has 2 children.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Juana has been growing corn, rice and beans for 8 years. She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to buy her own house and plot of land.  She likes listening to music.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 24 years old and married.  Evariste owns a small business selling stones for construction and has eight years experience in his business.  He employs 17 people in his business and works from 6am until 5pm.  

Evariste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand his business.  Evariste will use this loan to purchase additional stones and other tools. Evariste will be able to attract more customers and earn more profit.  With this profit, Evariste will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: To invest in more tools and stones

loans.name: Robinson

texts.es:
Robinson tiene su negocio desde hace quince años, inicialmente comercializaba con vestidos femeninos maculinos e infantil, mientras simultaneamente se dedicaba al oficiol de albañilerìa y en oportunidades a la venta de verduras en el mercado`pùblico de Barranquilla. Asi fue que cuando se casò de 21 años y tuvo 2 niños y una niña, asumiò su gran responsabilidad con experiencia y aun lo hace con sus hijos que ahora tienen 15,27 y 28 años de edad y con sus nietos. Robinson es una persona dinàmica que participa en todas las actividades de la Fundaciòn, es asì como està vinculado al equipo de futbol microempresarial que organizò esta empresa, con la que en la actualidad ha realizado 2 financiamientos; con estè ùltimo, su CrediKiva,  planea comprar juguetes, porque está cercana la època de fin de año para que los padres de familia   compren juguetes y sea el "niño Dios" de los infantes quien se los traiga en la noche del 24 de Diciembre,  y los pequeños creen que los trajo Dios niño desde el cielo; asì que el dia 25 de Diciembre usted puede encontrar niños alegres jugando por las calles de Barranquilla, con los juguetes que Robinson vendiò a sus padres, como patinetas, muñecas, carros y los juguetes que esten de moda. Como Robinsos está pendiente a lo que se mueve en cada época, tambien vende ropa, calzado, fantasia, etc por eso le va muy bien porque es conciente de la oportunidad comercial. El negocio de Robinson  muestra los siguientes  indicadores financieros : una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 14 dias, su rentabilidad sobre las ventas de 40%, un endeudamiento actual del 1% y una capacidad de pago actual de 99%  y 94% con el nuevo financiamiento.
Desde su primer financiamiento Robinsòn sintiò que su negocio se moviò con un nuevo capital y pudo ahorrar un poco y aumentar ligeramente su utilidad, asì que espera que algun dia se convierta en un almacen y sueña con tener un vehiculo para el transporte, lo cual le facilitaria la vida.
texts.en:
Robinson has been in business for 15 years.  He started off selling women's, men's and children's clothes whilst also working as a construction worker and selling vegetables in Barranquilla public market.

When he married at 21 and had 3 children, 2 boys and a girl, he took on responsibility for his children with experience and he still assumes responsibility  for his children, who are now aged 15, 27 and 28, and his grandchildren.

Robinson is a dynamic person who takes part in all the activities Fundación Mario Santo Domingo offers.  He is a member of the football team which the firm organized and has had 2 loans.  With this latest Kiva loan, he plans to buy toys because the end-of-year period is approaching which is when parents buy toys and let their children know that it is “the Christ child” who brings the toys on the evening of 24th December.  The little ones think that “the Christ child” brought them from heaven.  On 25th December you can find happy children playing in the streets of Barranquilla with the toys that Robinson sold to their parents such as scooters, dolls, toy cars and whatever toys are popular that year.

As Robinson is always aware of what sells each season, he also sells clothes, footwear, costume jewelry, etc. His business does well because he is aware of sales opportunities.  Robinson's business has the following economic indicators: his accounts receivable turnover is 14 days, his current debt is 1% and his capacity to fulfil payment obligations is 99%, 94% with this new loan.

From the time of his first loan, Robinson felt that his business got moving with new capital.  He was able to save a little and increase his profits slightly.  He hopes that some day he will be able to have a store and he dreams of having a vehicle to transport his goods as this would make his life easier.

loans.use: To buy toys to sell as children's Christmas presents

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 30 years old and married with three children between the ages of 4 and 9 years old.  He runs a small bar in Miyove district in Rwanda and has had this bar for 12 years.  

He works hard and is requesting a loan from Kiva through Vision Finance Company to expand his business. The extra income from this loan will help his bar make a profit. He would like to use this profit to finish building his house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: N. Aisha lives in the Kawala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children who are not in school. She also takes care of additional family members (brother's children).    Aisha has a business selling second hand clothes.  She has been in this business for four years and she works seven days out of every week. Aisha sells her products door-to-door by means of retail. Aisha has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes. The main business challenge(s) for Aisha include rainy season and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are getting a permanent business premise and buying a plot of land.   Aisha lives in a home that she rents without access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a twenty-eight-year-old enterprising married man with three children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For fifteen years he has been farming and has also been in the motorcycle transport business amidst challenges with seasonal changes and unpredictable customers. His dream is to own  a motorcycle as he still has to remit some of his daily income to the current owner of the motorcycle he uses. Christopher intends to use the loan to buy a motorcycle for his own transport business.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Caminando Hacia El Progreso 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Elva is the coordinator of her group "Caminando hacia el progreso 2 & 3" (Walking toward progress). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 6 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to work in a foreign country.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying serving others.

Elva is excited to be taking her 8th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 7 years, starting with savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy vegetables like plantains, bananas, cassava, yams, sweet potatoes, tomatoes and others. She will use the profits to expand her business; she wishes to have a big food stall.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed capital to improve her business, and her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and its sugar cane industry. The main economic activities are its Free Trading Zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and also has unreliable electricity.

loans.use: to buy plantains, bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava, yams, etc.

loans.name: Arturo Abelardo

texts.es:
Arturo D. 50 años, es pescador y venD. pescados en el puerto donD. todos los pescadores venden. Vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno D. los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión D. mariscos.  

Cuando él era joven el papa le enseño como pescar y obtener su propia comida. Pescando con redes aprovecho lo que el papa le enseño y lo convirtió en su negocio para tener dinero para mantenerse. Compro un bote y un motor para salir a pescar desD. las 04h00 D. L. madrugada en su bote con ayuda D. un oficial a su cargo llegan a las 14h00 para vender los pescados. En L. actualidad sale en L. madrugada a pescar y regresa en L. mañana para vender L. libra D. pescado a $ 3.50, el langostino a $ 1.50. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar redes, alises para su bote y así tener más facilidad al pescar. En el futuro quiere tener una embarcación completa y así ayudarles a sus hermanos económicamente.
texts.en:
Arturo is 50 years old, is a fisherman and sells fish at the port where all other fishermen sell.  He lives in an area called Playas, a tourist area in Ecuador that has a very varied supply of seafood.

His father taught him how to fish and get his own food when he was young.  He took advantage of what his father taught him by fishing with nets and turning it into a business to be able to support himself.  He bought a boat and a motor.  He and his worker leave at 4 in the morning in the boat and return at 2PM to sell their fish.  Currently he goes to fish at dawn and returns in the morning to sell fish at $3.50 per pound and prawns for $1.50.

With the loan he wants to purchase nets, and parts for his boat to be able to fish more easily.  In the future he would like to have a fishing vessel and to be able to financially help his brothers.

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Armando Pedro

texts.es:
Armando Pedro M. T. tiene 25 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y el hijo vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Armando se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 3 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  comprar casa y terreno.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Armando Pedro M. T. is 25 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and son in the Ventanas settlement, located in the “de Los Ríos” province.

The members of the “UNIDOS SOMO MAS,” (United we are more) communal bank, located in Marañon, within the Puerto Pechiche parish; part of the Pueblo Viejo settlement.  This area produces short cycle crops, such as corn, beans, and rice.

Armando has specialized in raising corn, rice and beans for the past three years.  He buys his supplies at “Comercial López” in Ventanas and sells his harvest at the Ventanas marketplace.  

He is asking for this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizer.  This loan will help him to meet his financial needs.  He faces challenges, such as crop diseases and the weather.  Some day he would like to buy a house and his own house and some land.  He likes playing sports.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Main Dans La Main Plus Group

texts.en:
Main dans la Main Plus is a group of 17 owners of small businesses chaired by Blandine. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI (Micro-Finance Institution) HOPE DRC to grow their businesses.

Blandine N. is determined to be a successful businesswoman. She operates a general store. She became a microentrepreneur in 2007. She has already received 10 loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory. She will buy items for the store for resale in order to reinforce her working capital and increase the profit. She will seek to make more profit with more goods preferred by her customers.  Blandine is 39 years old, married and the mother of four children aged 6 to 13. All of them attend school. She is also taking care of four children left by her relatives.

loans.use: To purchase items for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Fernando Bismark

texts.es:

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol.

loans.use: Fertilizer and Farming supplies

loans.name: Caminando Hacia El Progreso 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is a member of her group "Caminando hacia el progreso 4 & 5" (Walking toward progress). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 2 children. She says that her most difficult challenge was to educate her children. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying attending church. 

Ramona is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 5 years, starting with Esperanza's first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business (a vegetables stand) by buying vegetables and fruit such as plantains, bananas, cassava, yams, sweet potatoes, tomatoes and others. She will use the profits to put aside savings and take care of her hearth; she wishes to have a peaceful life. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to have a business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and its sugar cane industry,where the main economic activity is Free Trading Zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and uncertain electricity.

loans.use: to buy plantains, bananas, cassava, yams, sweet potatoes, tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Perfecto Wellington

texts.es:
Perfecto Wellington M. M. tiene 53 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y el hijo vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene  1 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Perfecto se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 12 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  comprar casa y terreno.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Perfecto Wellington M. M. is 53 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and son in the canton of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province. He has one son.

The members of the Unidos Somos Más solidarity group are located in the Marañon area, in the Puerto Pechiche parish which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This rural cooperative works in short cycle farming planting corn, rice, and beans.

Perfecto has worked growing corn, rice and beans in a special way for the past twelve years. He buys his products in Comercial López in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same area.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of farming supplies and fertilizers for his crops. The loan support will help him financially to meet his needs. He faces challenges such as pests, diseases, and the change in climate. His dream is to buy a house and land.

He likes to play sports.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Namik

texts.en: Namik A. is a 41-year-old man who lives in Sabirabad. He is not married. He started his cattle breeding business in 2007. With the loan Namik received from Aqroinvest and Kiva, he bought three more cows. His business is his only source of income. He plans to expand his business and to buy two more cows. Namik is a very diligent person.

loans.use: To buy three cows

loans.name: Ónix

texts.es:
Ónix L. R., tiene la edad de 39 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos que es su mayor prioridad. El quiere abastecer de mayor mercadería su local y así tener una más amplia gama de productos para sus clientes. El tiene varios años que se ha dedico a esto, cuenta con mucha experiencia y le va bien  en su negocio por lo cual quiere aumentar su mercadería y generar mayores ventas para su bienestar familiar y el de su negocio,  el  también piensa en el futuro de sus hijos y quiere  poderles dar estudios para que en un futuro sean unos buenos profesionales en alguna área especifica.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja que los otros lugares de financiamiento.
texts.en:
Ónix L. R. is 39 years old, married, and has two children who are his biggest priority. He wants to stock his business with more merchandise so that he has a wider range of products for his customers. He has been in this business for several years and he has a lot of experience. His business is going well which is why he wants to increase his merchandise and generate more sales for his family and his business’ well-being. He is also thinking of his children’s future and wants to be able to provide them with schooling so that they will be good professionals in a specific area.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans in public banks before, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with greater facilities and the interest rate is much lower than other loan institutions.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Mi Amigo Jesus Group

texts.es:
ARSENIA ES INTEGRANTE DE LA ALCANCÍA COMUNAL  “MI AMIGO JESÚS”. TODOS SON DEVOTOS DE JESÚS  ES POR ELLO LA DENOMINACIÓN DEL GRUPO DE COMERCIANTES QUE DIARIAMENTE SE ESFUERZAN PARA LOGRAR TENER GANANCIAS DE SUS NEGOCIOS, ESTA COMPUESTO POR 8 INTEGRANTES  Y DESDE EL 2007 PARTICIPAN EN EL PROGRAMA .ARSENIA EJERCE EL CARGO DE SECRETARIA DEL GRUPO. 
CASADA Y CON 6 HIJOS DE LOS CUALES 02 ESTÁN DEPENDIENDO DE ELLOS. ARSENIA A LOGRADA VENCER LA ADVERSIDAD NOS CUENTA, PUES CUANDO SU ESPOSO DEJO DE TRABAJAR PARA UNA EMPRESA MINERA POR RECORTE DE PERSONAL, ELLA CON SUS MENORES HIJOS SE INICIARON EN  EL NEGOCIO DE LA PREPARACIÓN Y VENTA DE TAMALES, PUES SU SAZÓN LA HACÍAN MAS RECOMENDABLE Y EMPEZÓ COMO AMBULANTE Y AHORA COLOCA SUS PRODUCTOS SOBRE PEDIDOS EN DIVERSAS ZONAS ALEDAÑAS A SU VIVIENDA HASTA CHOSICA.  SUS HIJOS MAYORES LOGRARON ESTUDIAR CARRERAS TÉCNICAS Y UNA DE SUS HIJAS LOGRO VIAJAR AL EXTRANJERO Y ENVÍA REMESAS PARA SU APOYO PUES ARSENIA TIENE A SU ÚLTIMO NIÑO CON EL SÍNDROME DE DOWN.
ARSENIA  SOLICITO EL PRÉSTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE LOS INSUMOS PARA LA PREPARACIÓN DE LOS TAMALES  A ELLA LE ES CONVENIENTE COMPRAR EN CANTIDAD  MAÍZ PARA MOLER Y ACEITE EN LATA, HUEVOS, ACEITUNAS Y OTROS.
ARSENIA SUEÑA Y DESEARÍA  UNA MOLEDORA PARA  GRANOS DE MAIZ PUES LO HACE ARTESANALMENTE, UN SOPLETE QUE USA PARA AGILIZAR LA COCCIÓN DE LOS TAMALES PARA QUE LE DESCARGUE EL ESFUERZO YA QUE TIENE QUE LEVANTARSE VARIOS DÍAS A LA SEMANA A LAS 5.00AM PARA LA PREPARACIÓN DE SUS TAMALES.  MI AMIGO JESUS ES UNA ORGANIZACIÓN QUE PARTICIPAN ACTIVAMENTE Y ESTÁN CONTENTOS DE SER PARTICIPES DEL PROGRAMA PROSPERIDAD COMO PUEDEN APRECIAR EN LA FOTOGRAFÍA. AGRADECEN EL APOYO Y ESTÁN COMPROMETIDOS EN SER BUENOS SOCIOS.
texts.en:
Arsenia is a member of the “Mi Amigo Jesús” (My Friend Jesus) communal bank.  They are all devoted to Jesus, thus the group name.  They are a group of merchants who daily struggle to obtain profits from their businesses.  There are 8 members that have been participating in the program since 2007.  Arsenia is the group’s Secretary.

She is married and has 6 children, two of whom are still dependent on them.  Arsenia has managed to overcome adversity.  She tells us:  when her husband stopped working for a mining firm due to staff reductions, she and her minor children started making and selling tamales because her tasty way of making them made it advisable.  She started out as a street vendor and now she sells based on prior orders in various villages near her home; she goes as far as Chosica.  Her older children managed to study technical careers and one of her daughters managed to travel abroad and sends monthly stipends to help Arsenia because Arsenia’s youngest child has Down’s syndrome.

Arsenia requested the loan to buy ingredients to make tamales because it’s useful for her to be able to buy the corn in bulk to grind, the oil in cans, eggs, olives and others.

Arsenia dreams with having and wants to have a mill to grind the grains of maize because she currently does it by hand.  She also would like to have a stove to cook the tamales that will make things easier for her since she has to get up at 5am several days a week to prepare the tamales.

Mi Amigo Jesús is an organization whose members participate actively and are happy to be part of Prosperidad as can be seen in the photo.  They are grateful for the support and are committed to being good associates.

loans.use: To buy a corn mill.

loans.name: Luisana Virginia

texts.es:
Luisana Virginia M. A. tiene 25 años. Es soltera, vive con los padres, viven en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Luisana se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es estudiar sacar un titulo profesional y comprar una casa.

Le gusta cocinar y bailar.
texts.en:
Luisana Virginia M. A., 25, is single and lives with her parents in Ventanas, Los Ríos province.  She has no children.

The members of the “Unidos Somos Mas” (United We Are More) communal bank are located in Marañon, Puerto Pechiche parish, which is part of Pueblo Viejo canton.  The bank is dedicated to farming short cycle crops like corn, rice and broad beans.

Luisana, in particular, has farmed corn, rice and broad beans for the last five years.  She buys her products at Comercial López in Ventanas and she sells them in the Ventanas market.

She is asking for funds to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to provide schooling for her children and to buy a house.

She enjoys cooking and dancing.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Laly Missehounton

texts.fr: LALY MISSEHOUNTON D. C. est née le 27 septembre 1967 à Adjohoun  dans la commune de l’Ouémé au Bénin. D. C. est mariée à ALKARY Alassane, un magasinier et est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple vit à Lokokoukoumè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji et à quatre personnes à charge. Pour venir en aide à son mari, D. C. mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d’année la vente de Akpan, de Tapioka (bouillie à base d’amidon de manioc et de maïs accompagné de sucre, du lait, et de la glace). C’est à  Dantokpa, marché  international du Beinin que D. C. achète ses produits.  D. C. a déjà bénéficié de cinq crédits auprès de ALIDé qui ont été tous bien remboursés. C’est toujours dans le but d’améliorer la qualité de son repas que D. C. sollicite un nouveau crédit auprès de ALIDé.  D. C. ambitionne augmenter son stock de produit.
texts.en: D. C. Laly Missehounton was born on September 27, 1967 in Adjohoun, in Ouémé community in Benin. D. C. is married to Alassane ALkary, a warehouseman ,and is the mother of five children, all of whom go to school. The spouses live in Lokokoukoumè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, and have four additional persons to support. In order to help her husband, D. C. has been selling “akpan” [ corn patties] and tapioca (a dish based on manioc and corn starch, with the addition of sugar, milk and ice) for about fifteen years. D. C. buys her groceries in Dantokpa, at the international market of Benin. D. C. already  obtained loans from ALDIé five times in the past and repaid all of them well. With the same goal of improving the quality of her cooking, D. C. is seeking a new loan from ALID. She would like to expand her product stock.

loans.use: Purchasing  corn, sugar, milk, rice, etc

loans.name: Rosaura Cristina

texts.es:
Rosaura Cristina M. T. tiene 31 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Rosaura se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 5 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terreno.

Le gusta hacer deporte
texts.en:
Rosaura Cristina M. T. is 31 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has 2 children.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Rosaura has been growing corn, rice and beans for 5 years. She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to buy her own plot of land.  She likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan K. is a 35-year-old man who lives and works in Sabirabad. He is married and has 2 young sons. Rovshan runs his own general store with the help of  his brother. He started his business in 2005. This is Rovshan's first loan from Aqroinvest and Kiva. He used this loan of 1000 AZN to buy more goods to sell in his store. His business is the only source of income for his family. Rovshan plans to open another store in the future.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell in his store

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta lives in Khanewal, which is a small city in the Punjab Province of Pakistan that is known for its agriculture industry. She has been living in a two-room brick house with her family. She is married to M. H., who is a school teacher and also runs a grocery store after his school job. He sells daily-use items such as cooking oil, biscuits, soaps, spices and rice in his store.
 
Shagufta is very caring lady. She fulfills her responsibilities as a housewife and also helps her husband in his grocery store by serving his customers in his absence. She has given birth to 4 sons. All of them are enrolled in a school and getting their education. 

She has applied to Asasah, a Kiva field partner, for a loan for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to minimize his costs and to increase his sales. 

He has been in business for over 5 years. Shagufta hopes that the loan will make her husband’s business more profitable and, as a result, she will be able to provide better financial resources to her children. 

She is a regular Asasah borrower and this is her 2nd loan application. In her previous loan year, she never missed any meetings and she paid her installments on time. 

In the photo, Shagufta is the woman who is holding the Asasah Passbook.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery store

loans.name: Samil

texts.en:
Samil Nuruyev a 46-year-old man who lives and works in Imishli. He is married and the father of 2 sons and 1 daughter. Samil is a teacher in the village school. In 2004, for extra income, he started his animal-breeding business. His sons help him in his business. 

This is the first loan he has received from Aqroinvest and Kiva. He used this loan of 800 AZN to buy two cows. Samil is a hard-working man who has great plans for his future. After he repays this loan, he plans to apply for more loans to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products to stock her store.  To buy gas canisters as she is going to start selling them

loans.name: Adonay

texts.es:
Adonay B. Salmerón, tiene la edad de 41 años, está casado y tiene 1 hijo que es su mayor prioridad al igual que su esposa. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de su café y tenerlo  en buenas condiciones de producción. El tiene varios años que se ha dedico a este cultivo, cuenta con mucha experiencia y el terreno para su explotación, actualmente le va bien  en su negocio por lo cual quiere aumentar la producción del próximo año y tal vez generar más ingresos  de su café para tener una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar familiar,  También piensa en el futuro de su hijo que es su mayor prioridad y quiere  poderle dar  el estudio para que en un futuro sea un buen profesional en alguna área especifica.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja que los otros lugares de financiamiento.
texts.en:
Adonay B. Salmerón is 41 years old.  He is married and has one child.  His child and his wife are his top priorities.  Adonay would like to buy the supplies he needs to tend to his coffee crops and keep them in good condition.  He has been growing this crop for several years.  He has a lot of experience and a land on which he grows his crops.  His business is currently doing very well and so he would like to increase next year's production and perhaps make more income from his coffee so that his family can have a better quality of life and well-being.  Adonay is also thinking about his son's future which his top priority.  He would like him to be able to have an education so that in the future he can be a good professional in a specific field.

This is Adonay's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't had any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan which has easier terms and much lower interest rates than other loan companies.

loans.use: To improve his coffee crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk such as oil, fruit, corn, sugar and salt.  To buy an awning to protect her from the sun and the frequent rain and to buy a cylinder of gas

loans.name: Ayaz

texts.en:
Ayaz Q. is a 27-year-old man who lives in Sabirabad.  He is married and has one son. In 2007, Ayaz started his animal breeding business. His wife helps him in this business, which is the only source of income for their family. 

This is his first loan from Aqroinvest and Kiva. Ayaz used the 1000 AZN loan to buy two more cows. After repaying this loan, he plans to apply for another loan from Aqroinvest to buy four more cows.

loans.use: To buy two more cows

loans.name: Clémence

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Adjohoun dans le département de l’Ouémé, A. Clémence est mariée à KIFOULI Prosper, un chauffeur. Le couple vit avec leurs enfants depuis trois ans à Ekpè dans la commune de  Sèmè Podji. Le couple a un autre enfant à charge qui est aussi scolarisé. Clémence partage avec son mari les charges de la famille. Clémence n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais est couturière de carrière et vend parallèlement des produits de mercerie, des cartes de recharge etc. Clémence achète ses produits à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin et les revend dans son atelier de couture. Clémence a bénéficié d’un premier  prêt qui a été bien remboursé. C’est dans l’optique d’augmenter son stock que Clémence demande un second crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Born in 1980 in Adjohoun, in the Ouémé Department, Clémence A. is married to Prosper Kifouli, a driver. The couple and their children have been living for three years in Ekpè in the community of Sème-Podji. The couple have another child in their care, also in school. Clémence and her husband jointly provide for the family needs. Clémence did not go to school. She has been working as a seamsteress and, as a parallel activity, selling sewing supplies, recharge phone cards  etc. Clémence stocks up in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and resells in her sewing shop. CLémence already had a loan in the past and repaid it well. Envisioning an expansion of her stock, Clémence is seeking a second loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Purchasing sewing supplies and phone recharge cards

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en: Rafiq S. is a 58-year-old man who lives in Sabirabad. He is married and has a big family. He is a father to three sons and one daughter. Rafiq receives a monthly pension of 113 AZN. Since that is not enough to support his family, he started his own poultry business 10 years ago. His whole family helps him in his business, especially his son. This loan of 1000 AZN, to buy feed for his chickens and turkeys, is his first with Aqroinvest and Kiva. He plans to grow his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy feed for chickens and turkeys

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma (pictured with the book) is a very industrious lady. In addition to her household responsibilities, she does sewing and embroidery for her neighboring clients and supports her husband in fulfilling the basic needs of the family. Salma has given birth to five sons. Only three of them are able to get an education, and the others stay at home. 

Her husband has a business selling construction supplies. He sells his supplies to different construction companies and also to regular customers who buy supplies for building their houses, shops, etc. He has been in this business for over 15 years and has a good reputation among his customers. 

Salma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more construction supplies to fulfill his customers' orders in a timely manner and earn more income. Salma is hopeful that a loan investment will bring positive results to her husband’s business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She is a responsible client, having paid her installments on time and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for her husband's business

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en: Erwin is thirty-six years of age with two children living in a family house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after his extended family and his dream is to move out of his father’s house and build his own. For ten years now he has been growing tea, starting with one acre but now has five acres of tea plantation amidst challenges of hail storms. His business dream is to own at least twenty acres of tea plantation in the next five years. Erwin needs the loan to buy seedlings for planting this season.

loans.use: Buying seedlings for planting

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Rustam T. is a 32-year-old man who lives in Sabirabad. He is married and has one son and two daughters. He operates his own food store that he opened in 2007. His wife helps him in his business. Teyfi will use this loan of 1000 AZN to purchase more inventory for his store. This is Teyfi’s first loan with Aqroinvest and Kiva. Once he repays this loan he plans to apply for another loan to open another store.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for the store

loans.name: Cyprienne Eugénie

texts.fr: A. Cyprienne Eugénie est née le 26 septembre 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Cyprienne Eugénie est mariée à HOUSSOU D. Emmanuel, et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis environs sept ans à PK10 Marina dans la commune de Sèmè – Podji. Le couple a un autre enfant  à charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Cyprienne Eugénie a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Cyprienne Eugénie vend divers produits (liqueurs, savons, conserves, lait, mayonnaise, etc.) ainsi que des produits de SOBEBRA dans sa boutique à Cotonou. Cyprienne Eugénie se ravitaille également à Cotonou. Cyprienne Eugénie exerce cette activité depuis dix sept ans et a déjà obtenu deux prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. La demande de la clientèle de Cyprienne Eugénie se fait de plus en plus grande et Cyprienne Eugénie désire augmenter le stock de ses produits afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C’est pour ce faire que Cyprienne Eugénie sollicite un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Cyprienne Eugénie A. was born on September 26 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Emmanuel Houssou D., and is the mother of three children all attending school. For about seven years the family has been living in PK10 Marina in the commune of Seme- Podji. The couple is also financially responsible for another child. Some of the children are attending school. The couple shares in providing for the various family expenses.

Cyprienne Eugénie did not attend school for long. To provide for her needs and those of her children, she sells various items (liquor, soap, canned goods, milk, mayonnaise etc…) as well as items from SOBEBRA in her Cotonou store. She also gets her supplies in Cotonou. 

She has been practicing this activity for 17 years and has already received two loans that have been fully reimbursed.

Her customers’ demand is always increasing and she would like to augment her stock of items in order to better meet her clientele’s requests. This is the reason why Cyprienne Eugénie is requesting third loan.

loans.use: Purchase of various items (liquor, soap, canned goods, milk, mayonnaise)

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her canteen which she started 8 years ago in a nearby girls' school. In her canteen she sells French fries, samosas and tea and cold drinks to the school girls. She utilizes her earnings to pay  the utilities expenses of her family. With the loan, she will buy required items such as cooking oil, potatoes, cold drinks, etc. for her canteen to increase her sales and income. 

She has been living in a 2-room brick house with her family in a city called Khanewal. Khanewal is located in Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. Her husband’s name is K. A. and he works in a factory for a low wage.  She has given birth to 2 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is enrolled in school while the others are very young in age. Nusrat is a very loving and caring mother who is raising her children very well.  

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She is very confident about the future of her canteen business and hopeful that her business will grow further by utilizing the loan money into it. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy required items for canteen business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El Señor Juan Carlos Beltrán O. es soltero y no tiene hijos, desde muy pequeño el trabajo para subsistir ya que sus padres fallecieron cuando él era muy joven, el es  padre y madre para 5 hermanos a los cuales ayuda y apoya en su educación, dos de ellos se dedican de ayudantes de albañil para así poder ayudar a su hermano mayor, y dia a dia ellos van con las mejores intenciones para poder sobrevivir en esta vida tan dura, el cliente hace como unos 3 años que trabaja para tener un futuro muy prospero, él trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato “CARRASCO” en la localidad de Puerto Ivirgarzama, en el cual esta hace mas de 3 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y mejorar el servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos Beltrán O. is single and has no children.  From a very young age he has worked to survive because his parents died while he was still very young.  He has been both mother and father to 5 siblings that he helps with their schooling costs.  Two of them work as bricklayer assistants to help their older brother and every day they have the best intention to survive in this tough life.

The client has worked for about three years to have a more prosperous future as a mototaxi driver; he works in the “CARRASCO” syndicate in Puerto Ivirgarzama in which he’s been an active member for over three years.  The service he provides is profitable due to the large number of people that request the service because of its ease, speed and efficiency.  The syndicate has stops and routes available for each affiliated member in various locations in Ivirgarzama where people come by to request said service.

This is the first time that the client obtains a loan from our institution.  It will be used to buy a new motorcycle because the one he has now has completed its useful cycle and he wants to improve customer service in order to improve his income and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Las Consentidas Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama  “las consentidas” y su representante se llama Maritza M. A., el nombre del grupo se debe a que los integrantes se ayudan entre si y se dice que cuando hay espíritu de ayuda mutua se consienten entre ellos se apapachan, este es un grupo que en su mayoría esta formado por mujeres que viven en condiciones de pobreza, cabe mencionar que aunque se encuentran en esta situación son personas que trabajan y que cada día se proponen a salir adelante, puestos los ojos en la esperanza de un mejor futuro. 
Por esta ocasión hablaremos un poco de la vida de Maritza M.. Ella tiene 30 años de edad, ella es la representante del grupo esta casada con Margarito  de 29 años, quien es chofer de un microbus del transporte publico, tiene 5 hijos, ellos son: Daniela de 13, Alondra de 11, Yamilet de 9, Irving de 7  y Kimberly de 1 año.
Maritza, por las noches se dedica a la venta de comida tradicional o también conocida como antojitos que son; sopes, enchiladas, tacos, refrescos y dulces, a ella le ayuda su esposo a hacer los preparativos, Vende en las noches porque a esa hora su esposo ya esta libre de trabajo, desde hace mas de 5 años  decidió dedicarse a esto ya que el sueldo de su esposo no le alcanza para los gastos de sus hijos y en la actualidad la esuela es mas cara.
 Maritza se integro a un grupo de crédito, por la necesidad de un préstamo, mismo que utilizo para la adquisición de la materia prima necesaria, para la elaboración de sus productos, con este dinero ella  va poder comprar los siguientes ingredientes: tomate rojo, chiles verdes, chiles secos, maíz para nixtamal, cebollas, ajo, aceite, manteca de cerdo, pollo y leña para cocinar hilos. 
Uno de los sueños anhelados Maritza es tener un lugar donde ella pueda seguir vendiendo sus comidas a más personas, que sus ventas crezcan y así pueda poder invertir mas en su negocio para poder darle trabajo a las mujeres que lo necesitan. Ella también quiere que sus hijos puedan terminar una carrera escolar, que ninguno de sus cinco hijos se quede sin estudiar, que ellos tengan la oportunidad de superarse y aspirar a una mejor situación de vida, lo que ella no pudo que sus hijos si lo puedan lograr.
La mayoría de las personas que integran este grupo son mujeres y solamente un hombre, son  trabajadoras, llenas de ánimo y una esperanza infinita, que creen en los sueños y creen en la bondad de las demás personas. 
 Maritza, esta totalmente agradecida con el gesto noble de ayuda que demuestran las personas que apoyan a fundación realidad, a los que alrededor del mundo han puesto su granito de arena por medio de kiva para mejoramiento de las vidas de los más desprotegidos. A nombre de sus compañeras que integran su grupo les envía un fuerte abrazo.
A continuación aquí se dan a conocer los nombres de los que integran el grupo de “Las Consentidas” y sus actividades productivas: 

Maritza M. A.. – Venta de antojitos
Zoila A. C..- Venta de dulces y golosinas
Digna González González.- Venta de carne de pollo
Maximina Hernández S..- Venta de dulces y golosinas 
Julia V. C..- Venta de antojitos
Brayan David R. Nicolás.- Abarrotes
Alicia V. C..- Venta de zapatos por catalogo
Estela M. Benítez.- Venta de perfumes 
Fidelfa Minerva M. C..- Bisutería y accesorios 
Juventina Martínez López.- Venta de perfumes
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Consentidas” (The Pampered Ones) and it is represented by Maritza M. A..  The name of the group is due to the fact that the members help each other and they feel that when there is a spirit of mutual support among them they feel much pampered.  This is a group consisting for the most part of women living in poverty.  It merits mentioning that even though they are in this condition they are people who work and every day propose to get ahead in life with their eyes always looking towards hope for a better future.

On this occasion we will speak about the life of Maritza M..  She is 30 years old and is the group representative.  She’s married to Margarito, 29, who is a public transportation microbus driver.  She has five children: Daniela, 13, Alondra, 11, Yamilet, 9, Irving, 7 and Kimberly, 1.

At night Maritza sells traditional food, also known as “antojitos” such as: sopes, enchiladas, tacos, beverages and candy.  Her husband helps her do the prep work.  She sells at night because that’s when her husband is off work.  She has been doing this for over 5 years since she decided to go into it because her husband’s salary didn’t quite suffice to meet her children’s expenses and now school is more expensive.

Maritza joined a credit group because she needed a loan that she used to buy the necessary raw materials to make her food items.  With this money she will be able to buy the following ingredients: red tomatoes, green chilies, dry chilies, maize to make masa, onions, garlic, oil, lard, chicken and firewood to cook them with.

One of Maritza’s dreams it to have a place where she can continue to sell her dishes to more people, that her sales increase so that she can invest more in her business and provide employment to women who need it.  She also hopes that her children finish a career in school, that none of her five children is left without an education, that they have the opportunity to improve themselves and aspire to better living conditions; that her children accomplish what she was unable to do.

Most of the group members are women; there is only one man.  They are hard working, enthusiastic and filled with infinite hope.  They believe in their dreams and in the goodness of others.

Maritza is totally grateful for the noble gesture of help shown by those who support Fundación Realidad, to those around the world who contribute their little grain of sand through Kiva to improve the lives of those less fortunate.  In name of her fellow members she sends a strong hug.

Following are the names of the other members of “Las Consentidas” and their respective productive activities:

Maritza M. A.. – Antojitos Sales.

Zoila A. C..- Snack and Candy Sales.

Digna González González.- Chicken Sales.

Maximina Hernández S..- Snack and Candy Sales.

Julia V. C..- Antojitos Sales

Brayan David R. Nicolás.- Groceries.

Alicia V. C..- Catalogue Shoe Sales.

Estela M. Benítez.- Perfume Sales. 

Fidelfa Minerva M. C..- Costume Jewelry and Accessories. 

Juventina Martínez López.- Perfume Sales.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make traditional meals better known as “antojitos.”  The list of ingredients includes: tomatoes, green chilies, garlic, onion, cheese, oil, firewood to cook with and meat.

loans.name: Azianfo

texts.fr: Azianfo  a  49 ans  et est marié. Il a en sa charge 7 enfants.  Pour s’occuper de ses enfants, il fait la vente de meuble  et compte dans cette activité 11 ans déjà. IL achète au grand marché de Lomé et revend à Akodessewa.  IL demande ce prêt pour acheter 10 armoires, et 25 portes pour satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en:
Azianfo is 49 years old. He is financially responsible for 7 children. To provide for his children he sells furniture and has already been practicing this activity for 11 years. He buys at the large Lomé market and resells at Akodessewa.

He is requesting this loan to buy 10 armoires and 25 doors in order to meet the demand of an increasing number of customers.

loans.use: Furniture purchase

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabet  tiene 24 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 4 años decidió generar ingresos económicos para su familia, desde entonces trabaja de manera independiente, además que posee un talento para la cocina y es así que prepara tamales (plato típico peruano), por otro lado vende también algunos platillos en las afueras de un centro educativo. Se siente muy contenta de desarrollar esta actividad, pues le  permite ser independiente y obtener ganancias para el bienestar de su familia. En adelante desea implementar su negocio y captar más clientes. Es crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.
