Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para preparar tamales.
texts.en:
Elizabet is 24 years old.  She lives with her husband and 3 children in her own home.  More than 4 years ago she decided to make income for her family.  Since then she has been working independently.  She has a talent for cooking and she prepares tamales (a typical Peruvian dish).  She also sells some dishes outside a school.  She feels very happy to be in this business since it allows her to be independent and earn money for the well-being of her family.  In the future, she would like to keep her business going and attract more customers.

This is Elizabet's second loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has this financial support and she also likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to those people who will fund her loan since it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will use her loan to invest in buying ingredients with which to make tamales.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make tamales with

loans.name: Las Españolas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Españolas, por el nombre de la comunidad Nueva España, está ubicada en Atlacomulco Estado de México. Este grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes. 

Citlali L. López es integrante de este grupo. Tiene 25 años estudio hasta el 3ro de secundaria es casada y tiene un hijo de 9 meses. Ella se dedica a la atención de su negocio de abarrotes que inicio hace 3 meses y por las mañanas trabaja en su invernadero de plantas que lo inicio hace 3 años. Solicita el préstamo para incrementar sus productos en su abarrotería y así satisfacer la demanda de los clientes y mejorar su estabilidad económica. También desea en un futuro poner un cyber cafe que le aporte un ingreso mas. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente feliz porque tiene la oportunidad de mejorar su negocio y cumplir con sus objetivos en un plazo no muy largo y con esto espera brindarle una estabilidad económica a su hijo y familia.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Las Españolas' (The Spanish Women) after the Nueva España (New Spain) community.  It is located in Atlacomulco, in the State of Mexico.  The group has 9 members.

Citlali L. López is a member of this group.  She is 25 years old and studied up to the third year of secondary school.  She is married and has a 9 month-old son.  She works in her grocery business which she set up 3 months ago and in the mornings she works in her plant greenhouse which she set up 3 years ago.  She is requesting this loan to increase the products in her grocery store and thereby satisfy her customers' demand and improve her financial stability.  She would also, in the future, like to set up an Internet café which will bring her another income.  As she requests this loan she feels happy because she has the opportunity to improve her business and achieve her goals in a fairly short space of time.  She thereby hopes to be able to provide her son and family with economic stability.

loans.use: To invest in her business and satisfy her customers' demands

loans.name: Wazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Wazeeran comes from a small city called Khanewal in Pakistan. She has been living there in a  two-room brick house with her family for over 20 years. She is 38 years old, married to Q. S. who works in a tea processing factory for a reasonable income. 

Wazeeran supports her family by running a small grocery store adjacent to her home. From her shop, she fills the timely grocery needs of her customers. She is the mother of 2 sons and 3 daughters. Only her 2 younger children are able to attend school and other stay at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her grocery store business. With the loan, she will buy groceries in bulk quantity for increasing her sales and income. 

She started doing this business 15 years ago and she is very hopeful that a loan investment will bring her business to more profitable position.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She has established a good credit record in the previous loan year by paying her installments on time.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Wazeeran.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est mariée  et a  en charge 3 enfants. Elle  a 35 ans. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus, la vente de produits génériques.  Elle cumule 5 ans d’activité  déjà. Elle achète au grand marché de Lomé et revend au marché local d’akodessewa. Le crédit demandé servira à l’achat de nouveaux lots de produits pour mieux répondre à la demande.
texts.en:
Abla is married and is in charge of three children. She is 35 years old. 

Her income generating business is the sale of generic items. She has already accumulated five years of experience.
The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase new batches of goods in order to better meet the demand.

loans.use: Purchase of generic goods

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.es: Martha Luisa Becerra S., tiene 41 años de edad y vive en Los almendros, municipio de Soledad, con sus 2 hijos en las edades de 12 y 14 años, allí tiene su negocio llamado “Tienda y Comunicación  donde Martha”,  que funciona desde hace 10 años en un local arrendado,  pero con un gran numero de actividades, vende ranchos víveres, refrescos, ofrece servicios de fotocopiaje, internet, telecomunicaciones, fax y hasta toma de muestras para exámenes de laboratorio, todo esto comenzó  distribuido en 2 locales y ella viviendo en uno de ellos, lo cual le generó altos costos por el arrendamiento , así fue como  entregó un local  y trasladó a uno de ellos sus negocios y su vivienda,  allí le ayudan sus  hijos  y también tiene un empleado de medio tiempo, porque ella se combate también  los medios día,  vendiendo almuerzos  y los fines de semana perros calientes, hamburguesas y fritos, porque Martha quiere un futuro mas promisorio para sus hijos a quienes quiere ver convertidos en gente de bien y exitosa. Este traslado le significa adecuaciones locativas que requieren inversiones no presupuestadas, pero se traducen en mayor disponibilidad de tiempo para atender los diversos negocios, por eso recurre a un Credikiva el cual invertirá en una estera metálica, un congelador y en la adecuación locativa de su negocio. Este es su tercer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organización que la ha apoyado para ubicar su negocio en un punto muy comercial y con mayor seguridad. Su sueño es poder conseguir una vivienda propia para brindarle las mejores condiciones habitacionales a sus hijos y proporcionarle una educación de calidad. Su gran desafío es el alto nivel de competencias que la obliga a diversificar constantemente sus productos para ofrecer multiples servicios que sus clientes requieren y necesitan.
texts.en:
Martha Luisa Becerra S. is 41 years old and lives in Los Almendros, municipality of Soledad, with two children age 12 and 14 years. That is where she runs her business called “Tienda y Comunicación donde Martha” (Shopping and Communication at Martha’s), which she has been operating for ten years in a leased facility. 

She offers a wide number of services: selling snacks, groceries and drinks, photocopies, internet, telecommunications, fax and even taking samples for laboratory tests. The business started by being distributed over two locations, one of which she lived in. This created high leasing costs, so she finally gave up one of the locations and is moving her business and lodging to the other.

She is assisted by her children and also has a part-time employee. She also challenges herself at noon, selling lunches and on week-ends selling hot dogs, hamburgers and fries. Martha wants a more promising future for her children, whom she wants to see becoming good and successful people.

The move means local adjustments requiring unbudgeted investments, but will result in greater time availability to meet the diverse business requirements. As a result she is requesting a Credikiva loan which will be invested in a metal shutter, a freezer and in the realignment of her business leases. This is her third financial loan granted by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation,  which has helped her establish her business in a very commercial and secure location. 

Her dream is to acquire a home of her own to provide the best living conditions for her children and ensure they receive quality education. Her greatest challenge is the high level of competence that requires her to constantly diversify her products and offer the multiple services her customers demand and need.

loans.use: Invest in a metal shutter, a freezer, and the realignment of her business leases

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is an ambitious thirty-eight-year-old married man with eight children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been a farmer for eighteen years now and he is still yielding ever better results which have enabled him to pay school fees for his children. However his dream is to farm extensively and increase his yields. Charles needs the loan to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.use: Buying seedlings for planting

loans.name: Avenida Lopez Avelar Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Avenida López A., se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Jantetelco, en el estado de Morelos, México, está conformado por 10 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, ellas son la señora Francisca A. B. va  a comprar con su préstamo zapatos para vender por mayoreo por catalogo, la señora Ángela C. Hernández va a comprar perfumes por mayoreo para vender por catalogo, la señora Tranquilina F. P. va a comprar zapatos por mayoreo para vender, la señora María de los Ángeles Aragón C. va a comprar elotes, camotes para vender hervidos, la señora Isabel B. C. va a comprar  verduras, carnes, platos y cucharas desechables para su venta de sopes, la señora Eustolia A. R. va a comprar cosméticos por mayoreo para vender, la señora Gloria Yecenia N. B. va a comprar arroz, huevos, carnes, yogurt, frutsis, etc., la señora Amada M. C. va a comprar calzado por mayoreo para surtir sus pedidos de ventas por catalogo, la señora María de Jesús V. Aragón, va a comprar blusas, faldas, camisas, etc. Para surtir su tienda, la señora Alberta Eugenia V. S. va a comprar chamarras, pantalones, blusas, faldas, suéter, para surtir su tienda de ropa. La señora Eustolia A. R. es integrante del grupo, ella tiene 43 años de edad estudio hasta e 6º año de primaria, ella tiene 5 hijos Tomas de 26 años de edad, Rafael de 24 años de edad, Salvador de 20 años de edad ellos tres trabajan, Oscar de 16 años de edad no estudia no trabaja y Fabián de 8 años de edad está estudiando la primaria, la señora Eustolia tiene su negocio de venta de productos fuller por catalogo y artículos de regalo y solicito su préstamo para comprar perfumes, cremas, lápiz labial, sombras, reloj de pared, juguetes para niños pequeños, motos, carritos artículos de plástico, inicio su negocio hace 4 años una persona paso en la calle y le invito le regalo un sartén, cuando la invitaron a formar parte de grupo con los créditos fue utilizando para el negocio. Ella considera importante y especial su negocio porque le ha ayudado económicamente y con las promociones de fuller las pide  y después las va vendiendo, la parte favorita de trabajar su negocio es porque de ahí mismo tiene ingresos le queda para ella y para sus hijos, le da gran satisfacción cuando gana regalos y los vende lo que le motivo a seguir vendiendo fue el primer regalo que recibió. Sus clientes son sus vecinos y familiares, atiende de 20 a 30 clientes y su negocio es popular  por que ya tiene tiempo vendiendo y la conocen, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para invertir en mas productos y en las promociones, su esposo le ayuda la lleva a entregar su pedido y a cobrarles a los clientes. En Jantetelco el clima es templado, elaboran los dulces cristalizados chilacayote, jamoncillo, higos, camote, calabaza y fruta de horno polvorones, cerditos, payasitos, también siembran camote, sorgo, milpa, frijol, cacahuate. La señora Eustolia desea mejorar su viviendo le falta el repellado, sus  planes o esperanza son poner su negocio más grande, vender verduras, plástico y tener un carro para utilizarlo en el negocio, ella está muy contenta con el préstamo que le dieron por que le va a ayudar a crecer a su negocio. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por prestarnos y confiar en nosotros, que no nos cobren tanto interés, y que nos regalen algo en el mes de Diciembre o el día de las madres, un reloj de pared o una vajilla”.
texts.en: This caring group is called Avenue López A. and is located in the Jantetelco community, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. It is formed of 10 female members who know one another and are neighbors. Mrs. Francisca A. B. will use the loan to buy shoes to sell by wholesale through a catalog. Ángela C. Hernández  will buy wholesale perfumes to sell by catalog. Mrs. Tranquilina F. P.  will buy wholesale shoes to sell. Mrs. María de los Ángeles Aragón C. will buy corn and sweet potato to cook and sell. Mrs.  Isabel B. C. will buy vegetables, meats, disposable plates and spoons for her soup sales. Mrs. Eustolia A. R. will buy wholesale makeup to sell. Mrs. Gloria Yecenia N. B. will buy rice, eggs, meat, yogurt, fruits, etc. Mrs. Amada M. C. is going to buy wholesale footwear to take orders by catalog. Mrs. María de Jesús V. Aragón will buy blouses, skirts, shirts, etc. to supply her clothing store. For her store, Mrs. Alberta Eugenia V. S.  will buy jackets, pants, blouses, skirts, and sweaters. Mrs.  Eustolia A. R. is a member of the group, 43 years old, stayed in school until 6th grade in elementary, and has 5 children. Tomas who is 26, Rafael who is 24, Salvador who is 20, all work. Oscar who is 16 does not study and works and Fabian is 8 years old and in elementary. Mrs. Eustolia sells Fuller products by catalog,  birthday gifts and is requesting the loan to buy perfumes, creams, lip sticks, eye shadows, wall clocks, toys for small children, motorcycles, toy cars. She started her business 4 years ago when a person passed by and invited her. She gave that person a frying pan when they invited her to become a part of the group to begin using the loans for business. She considers her work important and special because it has helped her economically and she is able to order Fuller sales then resell them. Her favorite part of working with Fuller is the income she receives for herself and her children. It gives her such satisfaction when she wins gifts and sells them that it motivates her to continue selling. That was the first gift she received. Her clients are family and neighbors. She serves 20 to 30 clients and her business is popular because she has spent much time selling. The profits she makes are used to buy more products and promotions. Her husband helps her deliver her orders and charge her clients. In Jantetelco the climate is temperate. Crystalized chilacayote candies are made, milk candy, figs, sweet potatoe, squash,  and  fruit cakes,  shortbread, and other local breads. They also sell squash, sorghum, maiz, beans, and peanuts. Mrs. Eustolia wishes to improve her home since it is missing  plastered walls.  Her plans or hopes are that her business grows, sell vegetables, plastic, and have a car to use with her business. She is very happy with the loan they granted her because it will help her grow her business. The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Reality Foundation “Thank you for loaning to us and trusting in us, please do not charge us too much interest, and give us something in December or for Mother’s day, maybe a wall clock or dishes.”

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, lip sticks, eye shadows, wall clocks, toys for small children, motorcycles, toy cars, and fuller products.

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Marie is the coordinator of her group, Con Dios Adelante 1 & 2 (Forward with God). She lives in a modest home with her two children. She says that her most difficult challenge was when she became a widow. She enjoys attending church and worshiping God and plans to continue to do so in the future.

Marie is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for five years, starting when she first decided to sell clothes and bought a bag of used clothing. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying more clothes. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to respond to her household's needs.

This Esperanza associate set out with us because she wanted to start a business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and the tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Yubu

texts.en:
Yubu is a 33-year-old married man with two children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after six household members and his dream is to have enough savings to support his children in school.

It is now nine years since he started driving for a living and this has helped him pay school fees for his children. He also has a piggery that is promising him good results in the future. Yubu needs the credit facility to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.use: To buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo a 34 ans et mariée. Elle a 3 enfants en charge. Elle exerce comme activité la vente d’alimentation générale et a remboursé plusieurs crédits  déjà.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend au marché à Akodessewa. Elle compte dans cette activité près de 10 ans. L’objet de ce crédit sera essentiellement destiné à l’achat de 4 cartons de spaghetti, 3 cartons de lait, 5 bidons d’huiles, 5 cartons de savons et 4 cartons de sucre pour satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Adjo is 34 years old and married. She has three children in her care. She has a business selling general foodstuffs and has already repaid several loans. She purchases supplies at the big market of Lomé and resells the goods in Akodessewa's market. She has been in this business for almost ten years. This loan will be used to purchase four cartons of spaghetti, three cartons of milk, five cans of oil, five cartons of soap and four cartons of sugar, in order to satisfy more customers.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For property management: wire and fencing posts.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 30 años, vive con su hijo y sus padres en la propiedad que poseen. Hace más de 10 años decidió abrir una tienda para generarse ingresos extras, ya que ella tiene como profesión la docencia,  en donde lo práctica en un centro educativo. Desde entonces durante las mañana se dirige al colegio a enseñar y por las tardes ya se dedica por completo a su tienda. En ocasiones sus padres la apoyan en la atención de los clientes cuando ella no se encuentra. Ambos trabajos le ha permitido sostener a su hijo y ayudar a sus padres en la economía del hogar. En adelante desea mejorar y crecer su tienda, ya que es una de las más concurridas, puesto que sus clientes han visto la variedad de productos y el bajo precio que tiene. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de productos ya que se acerca la fiestas navideñas en donde tiene más ventas.
texts.en:
Flor is 30 years old.  She lives with her son and her parents in their own home.  More than 10 years ago she decided to open a store to make more income since she is a teacher and works in a school.  Since then, she goes to school to teach in the mornings and in the afternoons she devotes herself entirely to her store.  Sometimes her parents help her by serving customers when she isn't there.  Both her jobs have allowed her to support her son and help her parents with the household finances.

In the future, Flor would like to improve and expand her store since it is one of the busiest as her customers have seen the variety of products and the low prices which she offers.

This is Flor's second loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and she also likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She thanks all the people who will help fund her loan because it will be very useful in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying products since the Christmas period is approaching and this is when she has most sales.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products to stock her store

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Susana is the coordinator of her group, Con Dios Adelante 4, 5 & 6 (Forward with God). She lives in a modest home with her four children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to work hard to get what she wants and to give her children what they need. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy resting after a working day.

Susana is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for six years, starting with some capital she and her husband saved. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying stocks of clothes, shoes, and cosmetics etc. She will re-invest the profits in her business because this is high season for sales. She dreams of having her own house.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she invested in her business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and the tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: Shoes, clothes, accessories, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Ligia Columbia

texts.es:
Ligia de 60 años, tiene una pequeña papelería. Vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes. 

Escogió tener una papelería ya que necesitaba tener una mejor viva económica para su familia. Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar diversa papelería vendiendo cuadernos a $ 1.00, plumas, lápices, papelería etc. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm por trabaja todos los días a esa hora ha podido surtir su negocio con juguetes y ropa.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas, papelería y otros artículos para su papelería. En el futuro quiere comprar un local en el centro de la ciudad para que sus ventas se eleven.
texts.en:
Ligia is 60 years old.  She has a small stationery store.  She lives in an urban area called Guasmo which is noted for the fact that most of its residents are salespeople.

Ligia chose to have a stationery store because she needed a better financial life for her family.  Little by little, with effort, she was able to buy products for her store, selling exercise books for $1.00, pens, pencils, stationery, etc.  She works from 8.00am to 8.00pm.  By working these hours every day she has also been able to stock her business with toys and clothes.

Ligia will use her loan to buy exercise books, pens, stationery products and other articles for her store.  In the future, she would like to buy premises in the city center so that her sales will increase.

loans.use: To buy exercise books, pens

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert, a 30-year-old married man with six children, is charged with the responsibility of looking after eight household members living in his Fort Portal, Uganda home. For two years, Robert has been working on a tea estate and also has a motorcycle transport business. His desire is to own at least four motorcycles for the business, and he is now requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja y su hija en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 3 años ofrece el servicio de transporte, con una movilidad que alquila, desde entonces recorre las calles de la ciudad, llevando al cliente a su destino. Sin embargo, sabe que correo riesgo de se asaltado o ser victima de accidente, por ello siempre se mantiene atento a todo para la seguridad del clientes como para su propia seguridad. Diariamente logra alcanzar los ingresos necesarios para el beneficio de su familia, considera que éste trabajo el es rentable, porque es un servicio que tiene mucha demanda, por ello desea tener más adelante su propia movilidad. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en el pago del mantenimiento mecánico de la movilidad que esta a su cargo.
texts.en:
Carlos is 29 years old.  He lives with his partner and his daughter in his parents' home.  For more than three years he has been offering transport services with a vehicle which he rents.  He works  the city streets, taking customers to their destinations.  However, he knows that he runs the risk of being assaulted or suffering an accident.  For this reason, he is always alert to everything for his customers' safety as well as his own.

Every day he manages to make enough money for his family.  He considers that this work is profitable because it is a service which is in high demand.  For this reason, he would like, in the future, to own his own vehicle.

This is Carlos' fourth loan with MFP.  He is very happy to know that he has financial support.  He also likes being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive of each other.  He is grateful to all the people who will fund his loan since it will be very useful to him in making progress in his business.  He will use his loan to pay for a service for the vehicle which he is using.

loans.use: To pay for a service for the car which he is using for his work

loans.name: San Agustin De Jonacatepec Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama San Agustín de Jonacatepec, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Jonacatepec, en el estado de Morelos, México, este grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes que se conocen ellos son la señora Isabel C. S. y va a comprar con su préstamo aceite, azúcar, frijol, arroz etc. Para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, la señora Regina Ángeles S. va a comprar lencería para iniciar su negocio, la señora Julia L. N. va a comprar frutas de temporada para vender cacahuate, etc., la señora Cristina R. L. va a comprar tortillas, masa, queso, arroz, frijol, etc. Para la elaboración y venta de su producto antojitos mexicanos, la señora Lidia A. Martínez va a comprar zapatos por mayoreo para vender, la señora Cenobia Lavín R. va a comprar todo tipo de chiles y semillas para vender,  el señor Eduardo L. Gutiérrez va a comprar pollo por mayoreo para vender, la señora Ivalu Ávila Pérez va a comprar verdura, carne, platos etc. Para la elaboración y venta de sus productos, antojitos mexicanos, la señora Vianey R. L. va a comprar cacahuate para tostarlo y venderlo, la señora Luz María García Millán va a comprar tostadas, pollo, leche, queso, etc. Para elaboración y venta de sus productos (antojitos mexicanos). El señor Eduardo L. Gutiérrez es integrante del grupo, el tiene 47 años de edad, es soltero, el estudio la licenciatura es maestro de educación física, el solicito su préstamo para su negocio tiene una pollería en el mercado municipal para invertirlo en la compra de material productos de pollo por mayoreo. El señor Eduardo ofrece a sus clientes pollo por pieza, longaniza, carne enchilada. El inicio su negocio hace 24 años por necesidades porque tenía crianza de pollo y tenía que salir el producto y fue así que inicio la microempresa, le otorgo el lugar que tiene en el mercado la presidencia municipal, su negocio es importante porque de ahí depende su mamá y de ahí tiene ingresos para todos sus gastos y con este negocio puede tener el sustento de su familia, la parte favorita de su negocio es el trato con la gente va conociendo a varias personas, sus clientes son las señoras, las muchachas, los señores y varia la clientela, su negocio es popular por el buen trato a los clientes, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio son costos elevados, y la competencia hay mas pollerías cerca de su puesto. Las ganancias del negocio las invierten en comprar más producto, también quiere invertir en una rosticería y lo piensa lograr trabajando y con el buen trato a los clientes. Al señor Eduardo su negocio le ha ayudado a salir adelante con todos los gastos y problemas que se van sucitando, las mejoras que desea hacer a su vivienda son hacer mas habitaciones y hacer arreglos en general y sus sueños y esperanza son tener mejores ingresos, tener una casa bonita y llevar a pasear a su mamá. El está muy contento con este préstamo que le proporcionan porque va a invertir en pollo para su negocio. Jonacatepec es un pueblo tranquilo, hermoso y la gente es sencilla y amable sus alrededores son hermosos porque es tranquilo y está rodeado de cerros, es de clima templado. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos la oportunidad que nos dan para salir adelante junto con la Fundación y con el trabajo de nosotros mismos y esperando un futuro mejor”
texts.en: This caring group is called Saint of Jonacatepec which is located in the Jonacatepec community in the state of Morelos, Mexico. This group is formed of 10 members who know one another. One of the members is Mrs. Isabel C. S. who is going to use her loan to buy oil, sugar, beans, rice, etc. to supply her grocery store. Mrs. Regina Ángeles S. is going to buy lingerie to start her business. Mrs. Julia L. N. is going to buy seasonal fruits to sell peanuts, etc.  Mrs. Cristina R. L. is going to buy tortillas, dough, cheese, rice, beans, etc. for the production and sale of her Mexican meals. Mrs. Lidia A. Martínez is going to buy wholesale shoes to sell. Mrs. Cenobia Lavín R. is going to buy all types of chillies and seeds to sell.  Mr. Eduardo L. Gutiérrez is going to buy chicken wholesale to sell. Mrs. Ivalu Ávila Pérez is going to buy vegetables, meat, plates, etc. for the production and sale of her products and Mexican meals. Mrs. Luz María García Millán is going to buy fried tortillas, chicken, milk, cheese, etc. for the production and sale of her products and Mexican meals. Mr. Eduardo L. Gutiérrez is a member of the group, is 47 years old, single, and is a licensed physical education teacher. He requested the loan for the poulterer's shop he has in the town market. He wants to buy materials and wholesale poultry. Mr. Eduardo offers his clients chicken in pieces, sausage, and seasoned in spices. He started his business 24 years ago since he had a chicken farm. The municipal president granted him the place he has in his poulterer’s shop. This business is very important since his mother depends on it, he is able to make payments, and he can support  his family. His favorite part of his job is meeting people in his clientele such as women, young women, men, and variations. His business is popular for treating his customers well. The obstacles he faces are high costs and the competition he has since other poulterer shops are located nearby. The profits he will receive from his sales will be used to buy more products, a rotisserie, and he plans on achieving that with hard work and treating clients well. Mr. Eduardo’s business has helped him succeed with all of the costs and problem that life brings. In the future he wishes to add more rooms to his home as well as make some general repairs. His dream is to make the most profits possible, have a nice house, and take his mother out more. He is very happy with the loan he is offered because he will but more puoltry for his business. Jonacatepec is a calm village, beautiful, and filled with simple and friendly people. The surroundings are beautiful because it is calm and enclosed by hills. And it is in a temperate zone. The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Reality Foundation “We are very thankful for the opportunity you give us along with the Foundation and our own work and the hope for a better future.”

loans.use: To buy chicken wholesale to resell.

loans.name: Katherine Dionede

texts.es:
Katherine de 39 años, vende productos de uso personal y ropa. Para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ella empezó a trabajar vendiendo perfumes cremas y ropa. Poco a poco ha incrementado su clientela porque trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos. 

Vive con su esposo y hijos en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes. Ella recorre las calles vendiendo sus productos con ayuda de una de sus hijas. Para facilitar más los pagos de las personas ella da a crédito los productos y así a los clientes se les haga más fácil pagar. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos como perfumes, cremas, ropa. En el futuro quiere tener un local en la “Bahia” (lugar de cinco cuadras donde se encuentran la mayor parte de comerciantes de Guayaquil).
texts.en:
Katherine is 39 years old.  She sells personal products and clothes.  To help her husband with household expenses, she started to work selling perfume, creams and clothes.  Little by little she has increased her number of customers because she works from very early in the morning offering her products to her neighbors and friends.

Katherine lives with her husband and children in an urban area called Guasmo which is noted for the fact that most of its residents are salespeople.  She walks the streets selling her products with the help of one of her daughters.  In order to make payments easier for her customers, she leaves her products on credit which makes it easier for her customers to pay.

She will use her loan to buy products such as perfume, creams and clothes.  In the future, she would like to have premises in 'Bahia' (a five block area where most of the salespeople in Guayaquil are based).

loans.use: To buy perfume, creams and clothes

loans.name: La Unidad 2 Group

texts.en:
Karen is the coordinator of her group La Unidad 2 ("the unit"). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and a child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have her own house.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying sharing good things with her child.

Karen is excited to be taking her 7th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for around 3 years, starting with her first Esperanza loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying accessories and silver jewelry. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business and she is dreaming of buying a vehicle to expand her territory and increase her sales.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she liked the program and it is for business; her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, an area famous for agricultural activities and its rural scenery. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and uncertain electricity.

loans.use: to buy accessories and silver jewelry

loans.name: Jairo Manuel

texts.es:
Jairo Manuel está solicitando su segundo credikiva, esta entusiasmado porque su negocio Abner A.C. Manufacturas Cuero y Textil”, donde se dedica al diseño, elaboración y comercialización de manufacturas en cuero y textiles tales como finos calzados para dama y caballeros, gorras y elegantes botas, se ha fortalecido con ese capital en efectivo del anterior credikiva; ahora tiene nuevos proveedores y se incrementaron sus ventas; su sueño se encamina a mejorar su infraestructura con una mejor maquinaria e idearse un punto de venta, para incrementar la rotacion de sus productos y continuar mejorando la productividad. El se siente sinceramente agradecido por el apoyo que ha recibido de sus financiadores a través de Kiva y con los funcionarios de la Fundación por su oportunidad en el servicio y su amabilidad en la atención. Con su nuevo credito invertirá materias primas en un 20% y con el resto comprará una maquina guarnecedora y un horno alogeno para mejorar el ensamble. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Jairo, ingrese al siguiente enlace:

http://kiva.org/lend/181179
texts.en:
Jairo Manuel is requesting his second loan through Kiva. He is enthusiastic because his business, Abner A.C. Textile and Leather Manufacturers, has greatly grown from his first Kiva loan. He designs, produces, and sells leather and textile products such as footwear for women and men, hats, and elegant boots. He now has new suppliers and his sales have increased. His dream is to improve his infrastructure with better machinery and devise a selling period, to increase the rotation of his products and continue improving the quality.  He is sincerely grateful for the help he has received from his financial bankers through Kiva and the employees of the Foundation for the opportunity to serve and their attentive friendliness. He will use 20% of his loan to buy essential materials and the rest will be used to buy a halogen oven to improve the assembly process. If you would like to know Jairo's story, click on the following link:


http://kiva.org/lend/181179

loans.use: He will use 20% of the loan to buy essential materials and the rest will be used to buy a halogen oven to improve the assembly process.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara tiene 43 años, comparte su vida con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, juntos viven en su casa que es propia. Hace más de 12 años se dedica a la venta de verduras en un pequeño mercado de su localidad. Desde entonces, todas la mañanas hasta el medio día realiza sus ventas, pero su jornada de trabajo siempre comienza en las madrugadas, porque debe abastecerse diariamente de  verduras frescas, que le son traídas los mayorista que a esa hora están distribuyendo a los menorista. Este producto tiene fácil venta, ya que siempre el cliente requiere de las verduras para la preparación de sus alimentos, por ello éste negocio le es rentable, logrando así administrar los ingresos que utilizará para el sostenimiento de su familia, así como para invertir nuevamente en su trabajo. Por esta razón que continuará trabajando en su puesto de mercado con la mentalidad de crecer más. Es el crédito número 18 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar más verduras y tubérculos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Clara is 43 years old.  She shares her life with her husband and her four children.  They live together in their own home.  Clara has been selling vegetables in a small market in her town for more than 12 years.  She makes her sales every morning up until midday.  However, her day's work always begins early in the morning because she has to stock up with fresh vegetables early every day when the wholesalers are distributing to retailers.  Clara's products sell easily because customers always require vegetables to prepare their meals.  For this reason, her business is profitable.  She manages to make enough money to support her family and re-invest in her work.  For this reason, she will continue working on her market stall and hopes to expand her business even further.

This is Clara's 18th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to the people who will fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying more greens and root vegetables to stock her business.

loans.use: To buy more greens and root vegetables to stock her business

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a twenty-six-year-old married man with one child living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda, and longing to secure a stable and sustainable income for his family. For two years he has been in the motorcycle transport business and also has a retail shop, and this has helped him to provide the basics for the family. His vision is to have at least three motorcycles for transportation purposes. Edward needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela lives in Khanewal which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area called Ahmed Nagar in a two-room brick house for the past 24 years. 

She is married to M. R. who runs a grocery store business. He has a small grocery store in the market from where he sells daily use items soaps, toothpaste, sugar, tea, etc. to his customers. He started this business many years ago and improves the financial condition of his family through this store.  

Jameela has 3 daughters and 2 sons. All of them are enrolled in school and are getting their education except the eldest one who helps his father in his business. He didn’t have any interest in studies and left school after completing the 8th class. 

Jameela herself is a housewife, stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in his business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity and increase his sales. Jameela is hopeful that a loan investment will have a good impact on her husband’s business and makes it more profitable. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Jameela.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing soap, sugar and tea leaves for sale

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
El Señor Román V. S. es padre de 5 hijos a los cuales apoya y ayuda en su educación, el trabaja con la tienda más de 4 años aproximadamente lo cual le ayuda a desenvolverse en la actividad a la cual se dedica y también se dedica a la agricultura con pequeños cultivos los cuales son indispensables ya que solo le alcanza para poder sobrevivir, el se levanta a muy tempranas horas para ir a trabajar en el chaco para poder llevar el pan de cada dia, también trabaja como peón en algunas ocasiones porque con la actividad que tienes no es suficiente para poder dar una buena comodidad a su familia.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de mercadería para tienda de abarrotes y mejorar el servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Roman V. is a father of 5 children who he supports and helps in their studies. He has worked in the store approximately more than 4 years. He also has small crops since they are sufficient enough to survive. He wakes up very early to work in the farmlands to be able to deliver the bread everyday. He also occasionally works as an assistant because the job he has isn't enough to offer his family a comfortable standard of living.

This is the first loan he obtains from our institution which will be used to buy merchandise for a grocery store and improve the service for clients which in turn will increase profits and his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for a grocery store.

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad is a very supportive lady. She always supports her family in every way possible. Besides performing her responsibilities of a housewife, she also gives required time to her  clothes sewing business. She sews clothes to support her family in fulfilling the basic needs of life. Besides her business, she is also a very caring mother. She is raising her 5 children very well. 

Her husband is a daily wage laborer but also runs his animal sales business which helps him to make extra income. He buys animals from the animal markets at cheap rates, raises them and sells them to the required customers at a good profit. He has been doing this business for the past seven years and has a good knowledge of animal breeds.  

Shamshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy some goats for reselling. She is hopeful that through the loan investment, her husband will be able to make good profits, which she will use for the education of her children. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. She is a responsible client who has always paid her installments on time in every loan year.  

She comes from a city called Khanewal and lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family. Khanewal is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and famous for its agriculture industry. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamshad.

loans.use: To buy goats for animal sales business

loans.name: Edreda

texts.en:
Edreda is a forty-five-year-old single woman with eight children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of owning her own residence. For twenty-three years, she has been a tailor and this has enabled her to pay school fees for her children with a dream of owning a tailoring school. 

Edreda needs the loan to buy clothes for sale.

loans.use: Buying clothes for resale

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Jose J. F. es soltero y no tiene hijos, desde muy pequeño el se dedico a trabajar, el trabajaba de ayudante de albañil, ayudante en chapería , en todo tipo de trabajo donde podría aprender y ganarse un poco de dinero para poder subsistir ya que sus padres lo abandonaron y lo dejaron a cargo de su abuela que es una persona de edad la cual no puede estar todo el tiempo sobre él, después de mucho tiempo ahorro un poco de dinero y se compro una motocicleta y empezó a trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato “CARRASCO” en la localidad de Ivirgarzama, el tiene una antigüedad de más de 5 años dentro esa institución la cual es muy conocida por el servicio eficaz que brinda tanto la institución como sus afiliados.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y mejorar el servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. José Jiménez F. is single and has no children.  From a very young age he has worked.   He’s worked as a bricklayer assistant, a metalworker assistant and any other job where he could learn something and earn a bit of money to subsist on because his parents abandoned him and left him in the care of his grandmother who is a woman of a certain age that can’t be always after him.  

After a long time he saved up some money and was able to buy a motorcycle and started working as a mototaxi driver in the “CARRASCO” syndicate in Ivirgarzama.  He has been in this institution, which is very well known for the efficient service it and its affiliated members provide.

This is the first time the client has gotten a loan from our institution and he will use it to buy a new motorcycle since his current one has outlived its usefulness and he wants to improve customer service so that his income and quality of life will improve.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Imtiaz's Group

texts.en:
Imtiaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in his business of making furniture. Her husband is a carpenter by trade and makes furniture on order. He also makes furniture for his own shop to display his talent to attract more customers. He is a talented and hardworking person and due to his unique furniture designs he gets good orders from his customers. With the loan, he will buy wood and nails in larger quantity and a furniture polisher to make more furniture and improve his sales. 

Imtiaz herself is a housewife and comes from a city called Khanewala in Pakistan. Khanewal is a small city, famous for its agriculture industry. She stays at home and does her household work. She is a mother of 3 sons and 2 daughters. All of them are enrolled in school and are getting their education except the youngest one who is just 3 years of age. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application.  In her previous loan year, she has built a good credit behavior and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Imtiaz.

loans.use: To buy woods, nails and furniture polisher for furniture-making business

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is a twenty-two-year-old, enterprising man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is in the motorcycle transport business and has been in the sector for a year now. He confesses that he has encountered challenges of seasonal customers and security threats but none the less he feels the sector is worthwhile since he is assured of daily income. His vision is having at least three motorcycles for transportation. Tom needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Purchasing a motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina lives in Khanewal, which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family where she moved after her marriage to M. I..
 
A talented lady, Sakina performs her duty as a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients to supplement the household income. She is good at her art and receives regular orders every month. 

Her husband is a private entrepreneur and operates a small grocery store. He stocks all the necessary items of a grocer to fulfill the needs of his customers. 

Sakina has 3 sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a school and getting their education, except her eldest son. He got his education through the fifth class and now works in the factory. He supports his family financially from his earnings.

Sakina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity to further expand his business. She is hopeful that her husband will make his business better after a loan investment. This is Sakina's second loan application. In her previous loan, she paid her installments on time and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sakina.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Pedro Teofilo

texts.es:
Pedro de 59 años (lo encontramos arreglando su casa), trabaja vendiendo ropa desde las 08h00am para poder cubrir con sus gastos ya que a su edad es un poco complicado conseguir trabajo. Vive con su esposo y hijos en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes.

Vende pantalones, blusas, camisas a un precio muy económico y en ocasiones vende por docenas. Para que a sus clientes se les haga más fácil pagar la ropa él se las da a crédito para que las paguen en cuotas. Con el préstamo quiere comprar blusas, pantalón para surtir más la ropa y dirigir una parte para la construcción de su casa. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local propio para tener mas ingresos y así sus clientes se sientas cómodos comprando.
texts.en: Pedro is 59-years-old (in this picture he's working on his house). He sells clothes starting at 8 a.m. to be able to pay his expenses because at his age it's a little difficult to find work. He lives with his wife and children in an urban zone called Guasmo. Most of the people who live there are merchants. He sells pants, blouses, and shirts at reasonable prices. Sometimes he sells by the dozen. To make the transaction easier for his customers he sells on credit and allows them to pay in installments. With this loan he wants to buy blouses and pants to stock up his merchandise and set aside some money for the construction of his house. In the future he wants to have his own shop in order to make more income and make his customers feel more comfortable as they shop.

loans.use: Purchase of shirts and pants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cleaning equipment such as waxes, shampoos, disinfectants, air fresheners, mops, and brooms, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of thread, fabric, and toys

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: Ham, a 53-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal Uganda, is charged with the responsibility of looking after his wife and children. Ham owns his home and his wish is to establish a stable and sustainable venture that will earn income for the family. He has been working as a night watchman for three years, and this has enabled him to educate his children. His business plan is to own at least two motorcycles to supplement his salary. Ham intends to buy a motorcycle with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam, a 36-year-old man with two children living in his house in Fort Portal Uganda, desires to establish a family business to support his children sustainably. For two years he has been a retail trader and has reaped a number of benefits, and the business is steadily growing. His business aspiration is to become a wholesale trader. Sam needs the loan to buy beers and sodas for sale, as the festive season is fast approaching

loans.use: Purchasing beers and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 55 años es viuda y comparte con su hijo en su casa que es propia. Hace más de 10 años que posee una tienda, de esa manera se genera los ingresos que necesita para sostener a su familia. Ella vende frutas, dulcesy demás productos comestibles, en un local arrendado cerca de su casa. En ocasiones su hijo lo ayuda en la venta, por lo que es su principal apoyo. Su jornada laboral empieza en la madrugada, ya que a esa hora llegan los distribuidores de frutas y verduras y reparten a comerciantes menoristas, como es su caso. Espera continuar con al venta de éstos productos, puesto que le es rentable y con esos  ayuda en la manutención de su familia.  Ella se siete satisfecha con su trabajo, pues le hace una persona independiente, y por tal desea aumentar de mercadería y tener mas variedad de productos. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería y aprovechar esta época navideña donde realiza más ventas.
texts.en: Genoveva is 55-years-old. She's a widow and she owns her own house, which she shares with her son. For more than 10 years she's had a store to generate income that she needs to maintain her family. She sells fruit, candy, and other food products in a rented store space near her house. Sometimes her son helps her sell because it's his principal means of financial support. Her work day begins at dawn because that's when the fruit and vegetable distributors arrive to deliver their products to the retailers. She hopes to continue with the sale of these products because it is profitable and provides support in maintaining her family. She's satisfied with her work because it makes her independent. She wants to increase her merchandise and offer more variety. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She's very happy to know that she has financial support and she's happy to be part of her communal bank because all the members are people that she knows; they're responsible and supportive. She would like to thank everyone who gives to this loan because it will be very useful in the progress of her business. With this loan she'll invest in the purchase of merchandise to prepare for the Christmas shopping season.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit and other products to stock her store

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a forty-seven-year-old single mother living with two children in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a dream of educating her children to higher institutions of learning. She has been in service as a teacher for twenty years now. Margret needs the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Paying school fees for her children

loans.name: Hussainia's Group

texts.en:
Hussainia is a very supportive lady. She is always willing to help her family in difficult times. She comes from a small city called Khanewal and lives with her husband and 3 sons in a combined family system. Khanewal is a city known for its agriculture industry in Pakistan. 

She herself is a housewife, stays at home and does her household work. Among her three sons only her eldest son is able to attend school due to financial constraints. He is studying in 4th class while the others stay at home and don’t study. Hussainia’s husband is a daily wage laborer. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her brother-in-law with his animal sales business. With the loan, he will buy some goats and resell them at a good profit. Hussainia knows that her brother-in-law has been doing this business for many years and he has good experience in this field so he will utilize the loan money in a positive manner and improve his business conditions. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she has built a good credit behavior and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Hussainia.

loans.use: To buy goats for animal sales business

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 30 años, vive con su madre y su hijo en casa de sus padres, ya que su esposo trabaja en otro país. Hace más de 6 años vende ropa, llevando a diversas zona de su ciudad, y cada 15 días viaja a la ciudad de Lima para conseguir la mercadería que previamente sus clientes le pidieron además que lleva también prendas con nuevos diseños. El gran gusto por la ropa y accesorios que compra le han dado ventaja ante los clientes, por eso no deja de vender. La ropa que vende generalmente es para niños, aunque también por ocasiones lleva chompas y casacas para personas adultas. Durante este tiempo de trabajo ha experimentado todo tipo de situaciones  favorables y desfavorables que la han enseñado a vender con éxito y afrontar las dificultades,  una de ellas fue la de conseguir un local estable en la ciudad de Lima, hoy vende su  mercadería sin dificultad alguna. En adelante desea mejorar su negocio con mayor variedad de ropa. Es el crédito número 5 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Irma is 30 years old and lives with her son in her parent's house because her husband works in another country. 

For more than six years, she has sold clothing in different areas of her city.  Every 15 days, she travels to the city of Lima to get the merchandise her customers ordered and also brings back new clothing.  Her taste in the clothing and accessories that she buys has given her an advantage with her customers, so she is always selling things.  The clothing she sells is usually for children, but she sometimes has sweaters and jackets for adults.  During this time, she has experimented with all types of favorable and unfavorable situations, that have taught her to sell successfully and confront difficulties.  One difficulty she faced was getting a store established in the city of Lima.  Today she sells her merchandise without difficulty.  In the future, she would like to improve her business and sell a larger variety of clothing.

This is her fifth credit with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She likes being part of her community bank because all of the members are people who she knows, and they are responsible and supportive.  She thanks everyone who helps make this loan possible because it will be very useful in her business' progress.  

She would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise for her clothing store.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to stock her store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 58 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 20 años venD. lana así como prendas D. vestir para bebe. Su puesto D. venta se encuentra en un pequeño mercado cerca D. su casa. DesD. entonces atienD. todo los día por las mañanas a sus clientes, en ocasiones una D. sus hijas la apoyan en la atención al cliente. Durante este tiempo, ha visto conveniente implementar la venta D. telas con motivos para bebe y niños; así como algunos artículos y juguetes para infantes. Por lo que ha hecho más rentable su negocio y eso la anima a continuar en el trabajo. Es el crédito número 18 con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. más mercadería, D. esa manera aumentará sus ganancias.
texts.en: María is 58 years old, she lives with her husband and their children in their own house. For more than 20 years she has been selling wool as well as babies’ clothes. Her selling stall is located in a small market close to her house. Since then she tends to her customers every morning, and sometimes one of her daughters help her in tending to the customers. During this time she has reputed convenient to increase the sale of cloths bearing decorations for babies and children, as well as some articles and toys for infants. In this way her activity has become more profitable, and this encourages her to keep on working. This is her 18th loan with MFP: she is very happy to know she can count on financial support, and on top of this she likes being a part of her communal bank because she knows all of its members, who are very responsible and caring people. She is thankful to all the people who will manage the loan she has asked for, as this will be very useful in making her activity grow. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products, in order to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Ana Marilu

texts.es:
Ana de 41 años, vende empanadas (hechos de harina y rellenas de queso). Vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes.

Desde hace 5 años atrás su suegro le dejo una máquina para hacer masas de harina con facilidad, fue entonces que ella decidió comenzar su negocio de venta de empanada (hechos de harina y rellenas de queso). Las elabora con ayuda de un empleado en las mañana y las vende en la tarde repartiéndolas a sus clientes.  Con frecuencia como son muchos los pedidos se le hace un poco dificultoso obtener el dinero para invertir en lo que necesita ya que primero le hacen el pedido y después le pagan. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pinzas, harina para su negocio de empanadas. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old, she sells empanadas (made of flour and filled with cheese). She lives Guasmo de Guayaquil, an urban zone where most of the inhabitants are informal merchants.

About 5 years ago, her father-in-law left her a machine to easily prepare dough; it was then that she decided to start with her activity selling empanadas (made of flour and filled with cheese). She prepares them with the help of an employee in the morning, and sells them in the evenings distributing them among her customers. As she has many requests, it is frequently difficult to gain the money to buy what she needs, because her customers make their requests first and pay her later.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy tongs and flour for her empanadas activity. In the future she wants to finish building her house.

loans.use: To buy tongs and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy milk, flour, beans, butter, cheese, eggs, coffee, sugar, beef, pork and chicken.

loans.name: Melvin Armando

texts.es:
el señor Melvin Armando A. C. esta casado con la señora Oneyda Giselle Alvarado y viven en el barrio Morazan de la ciudad de Nacaome, Melvin es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, en dicha pulperia tambien vende ropa nueva, este es un nuevo producto que esta empezando a vender.
el credito lo utilizara una parte para comprar mercaderia y la mayor parte para la compra de ropa nueva, desea comprar ropa ya que viene la epoca de navidad y este tipo de prodcuto se vende bastante.
El señor Melvin junto a su esposa son personas muy dedicadas a su familia y su deseo es crecer como
comerciantes y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Melvin Armando A. C. is married to Mrs. Oneyda Giselle Alvarado. They live in the Morazan neighborhood in the city of Nacaome. Melvin is a storekeeper. He works selling products for daily consumption. He has a small general store in his home. In that general store he also sells new clothing. This is a new product he is beginning to sell.
Melvin will use a part of the loan to buy merchandise. He will use the larger part to buy new clothing. He wants to buy clothing because the Christmas season is coming and this kind of product sells a lot.
Mr. Melvin and his wife are people very dedicated to their family. Their wish is to grow as small business owners and to provide a better quality of life for their children.

loans.use: Purchase of lard, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, eggs, soft drinks, churros, toothpaste, candies, razors and clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edgardo José

texts.es: Edgardo José de 65 años, vive en el municipio de Galapa,área metropolitana de Barranquilla, allí tiene su negocio de vender viveres, ranchos y abarrotes, que inició con la experiencia del año 2008 que le suministró su trabajo en una tienda que administraba, propiedad de su hija y que ella por motivos laborales dejó a él. En la actualidad tiene buenos clientes y Edgardo vende de contado y algunos creditos muy selectos. Este es el segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mraio Santo Domingo, con  su credikiva, comprará viveres, ranchos, refrescos en mayor cantidad antes de que sus precios aumenten, porque en Diciembre es justamente lo que sucede.Con su anterior financiamiento, aumentó su capacidad de compra de contado y encontró mejores precios en este sistema lo que incrementó ligeramente  sus utilidades. El sueño de Edgardo José es ampliar su tienda y adicionarle gradualmente productos de papelería que le ayudan a diversificar su oferta y potencializar nuevos clientes, porque su mayor desafio es tener un capital de trabajo para ello permanentemente, mientras su negocio rrefleja una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 6 dias, y de sus mercancia de 27 , en tanto su rentabilidad es de un 23% y su capacidad de pago de un 65%.
texts.en:
65-year old Edgardo José lives in the municipality of Galapa in metropolitan Barranquilla where he runs a business selling supplies, snacks, and groceries. He started the business in 2008. He used to manage his daughter’s shop, which she then left to him for work reasons.

Nowadays Edgardo has a good customer base; he sells on account and offers credit to select customers. This is his second loan with Kiva partner the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the money he plans to buy more supplies, snacks, and drinks before prices go up in December, which is usually what happens. With his previous loan, he bought more stock at better prices so his profits went up slightly. 

Edgardo’s dream is to expand his store and gradually bring in stationery to sell. This will help him diversify into other areas and bring in new customers. His biggest challenge is having enough working capital. His customers pay their bills every six days, and he pays for his merchandise every 27 days. His profit margin is 23%, and he has a credit capacity of 65%.

loans.use: to buy more supplies, snacks, and drinks before prices go up

loans.name: Jose Lupario

texts.es:
El señor Jose Lupario F. V. esta casado con la señora Luz Marina Posadas y tienen un hijo, viven en la Colonia Nueva Esperanza de la ciudad de Nacaome.
El Sr. Lupario tiene su negocio que es una pùlperia la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion en donde tiene mucha clientela.
Su esposa vende baleadas en la estacion de buses del mercado municipal de nacaome. 
El señor Lupario es una persona de muy buena reputacion en su comunidad, sus vecinos y amigos dan muy buena 
opinion de el.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.
texts.en:
Jose Lupario F. V. is married to Luz Marina Posadas and they have one child.  They live in Nueva Esperanza district in the city of Nacaome.

Mr Lupario has a small grocery store which is located in his home.  He has a lot of customers.

His wife sells 'baleadas' (a popular Honduran food - wheat tortillas filled with fried beans).  She sells these at Nacaome market's bus station.

Mr Lupario is a man who has a very good reputation in his community.  His neighbors and his friends have a very good opinion of him.

He will use his loan to buy merchandise to stock his grocery store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, butter, oil, beans, bread, soft drinks, soups, margarine, pasta, oats, mosquito spray, batteries, candles, matches, soap, razors, toilet paper, flour, cinnamon and eggs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Cecilia

texts.es:
Rosa de 54 años, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes).  Para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que él es ebanista ella empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos Yambal. 

Poco a poco incremento su clientela vendiendo perfumes desde $ 20.00, cremas a $ 6.00,  bisutería desde su casa con unas vitrinas que compro para que la gente que pasara viera los productos. Ahora trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 16h00pm desde su casa y en ocasiones con el catalogo a sus conocidos.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, ropa. En el futuro quiere alquilar un local amplio para vender toda la línea de sus productos.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 54, sells Yambal products (Yambal is a business that offers enterprising women the opportunity to start selling independently).  In order to help her husband, a cabinetmaker, with the household expenses, she started to work selling Yambal products.

Little by little she has gotten more customers.  She sells perfume starting at $20, creams for $6, and costume jewelry from her house.  She bought some display cases so that the people passing by would see her products.  She works from 9:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  She works from her house, and she sometimes sells by catalog to her acquaintances.

She wants to use the loan to buy Yambal products like perfume, cream, and clothes.  In the future she wants to rent an ample space in order to sell the entire line of products.

loans.use: Perfumes and creams

loans.name: Enyel Bladimir

texts.es:
el joven Enyel Bradimir C. B. esta casado con la joven Candida Waleska Flores y viven en el barrio las Brisas de la ciudad Nacaome.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de calzado nuevo y de esta manera poder incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias. desea tener mas surtido de calzado ya que esta temporada de navidad es una epoca en donde el nivel de ventas se incrementa notablemente.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y tambien para salir adelante con su esposa.
Ellos son un matrimonio joven y tienen muchas ganas de superarse, comentan que ahorita que estan jovenes tienen todas las energias para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Enyel Bradimir C. B. is married to Candida Waleska Flores.  They live in the Brisas neighborhood in the city of Nacaome.

He will use the loan to buy new footwear.  That way he will be able to increase his sales and his income.  He wants to have more footwear stock because the Christmas season is when sales increase considerably.

He needs the income to cover the household expenses.  He also needs it so that he and his wife can get ahead.

They are a young couple, and they have a great desire to improve themselves.  He says that now, when they are young, they have the energy to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy footwear for women, men, and children

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas al Progreso”  ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 09 hijos (4 independientes), la señora estudió hasta 2do año de educación primaria.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 01 año, su   primer préstamo  fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la elaboración de pan y picarones (dulce).

Juliana solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizará para comprar harina para la elaboración de pan.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener un negocio de venta de ropas. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y las capacitaciones que recibe por parte de su promotora.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the Azangarinas al Progreso Community Bank located in the district of Azángaro, in the province of Azángaro, which is in Puno department. She is 53 years old, married, and has nine children (four of whom have left home). She completed grade 2 of primary school. 

Juliana has been working with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan of S/.300 soles was invested in her business--she makes bread and picarones (a Peruvian fritter-like dessert, served with syrup). She will use this new loan of S/.1000 soles to buy flour to make bread.

Her dream is to start a business selling clothing. She really enjoys the meetings organized by her Community Bank as well as the training sessions put on by her loan officer.

loans.use: to buy flour at wholesale prices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wool fibers and sheep feed

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina tiene 53 años, comparte su vida al lado de su  esposo y de sus 2 hijos de los 5 que tienen, juntos habitan en su casa que es propia. Desde que era niño, se ha dedicado a la actividad agrícola, siendo sus padres, quienes le enseñaron las técnicas del cultivo, hasta hoy se mantiene como una fuente de ingresos importante para su familia. Actualmente trabaja administrando los ingresos, además que también se dedica a la venta de animales, así como la venta de leche que extrae de las vacas que posee. Los productos que cultiva principalmente son: el maíz y la papa, y cuando tiene que sembrar o cosechar, contrata peones para estos trabajos forzados; una vez recolectada la producción son llevados a comercializar a la ciudad de Lima. Paralelamente a estas actividades, trabaja de manera dependiente, como personal administrativo en un centro educativo muy cerca de su casa solo por medio día y esto le da tiempo para atender sus actividades agrícolas. En adelante  desea mejorar la producción de sus cosechas. Es el crédito número 17 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Martina, age 53, lives in her own house with her husband and two of their five children.  Ever since she was a girl she has worked in agriculture.  Her parents taught her how to farm.  Even now farming is an important source of income for her family.

She currently works managing the income.  She also sells animals, and she sells milk that her cows produce.  She mainly grows corn and potatoes.  When she needs to plant or harvest, she hires workers for these jobs.  Once the production is collected, it is taken to sell in the city of Lima.

She also works as an administrator in an educational center that is very close to her house.  She only works half days, and this gives her time to take care of her crops.  Later, she wishes to improve the production of her harvests.

This is her 17th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.
