Son activité principale est le petit commerce de divers produits (ustensile de cuisine, tissu, vaisselles etc.) qu’elle mène dans son quartier. C’est dans les différents marchés de Louga qu’elle achète ses produits.

Ses bénéfices l’aide à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et a constituer aussi une bonne épargne.
texts.en:
There are 12 women in this group who are neighbors. Their friendship began with small gatherings where they contributed to their neighborhood “tontines” [a revolving credit system]. On March 28, 2008 upon the opening of the Banc Villageois, they gave the group a name to better affirm their friendship.

Coumba DialL. Sy, standing on the right of the photo, is the group leader. She is a very energetic woman. She is a widow mother of five children.

Her main activity is the small retail of various goods (kitchen utensils, fabric, dishes etc…), which she conducts in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies at the various markets in Louga.

Her income helps her to provide for the needs of her family and to also build up good savings.

loans.use: To develop and promote her income-generating activity.

loans.name: Juan Concepción

texts.es:
Juan tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Pacasmayo, una zona bastante comercial ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con un puesto de venta en el mercado de su localidad en donde ofrece a sus clientes carne de pollo, el negocio ya cuenta con un año de antigüedad y durante este tiempo el ha logrado contar con una clientela fidelizada. Los ingresos que el obtiene de esta actividad los utiliza para construir su vivienda en un pequeño terreno que adquirido. Actualmente vive en casa de su madre.

Juan desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Juan es una padre bastante entregado a su familia y que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. En su localidad sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old, married, and lives with his family in the district of Pacasmayo, a commercial zone located in the region La Libertad, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the region Lambayeque.

He has a stand in the market of his town where he offers his customers chicken meat. The business is now one year old, and during this time he has managed to earn a faithful clientele. He uses the income he earns from this business to build his home on a small lot that he purchased. He currently lives in his mother's house.

Juan wishes to expand his business with the purchase of more merchandise so that he can increase his sales and receive higher profits. For that reason he thought it best to request a loan of 2,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will help him realize his goal.

Juan is a selfless father to his family and really wants to get ahead. In his town, his neighbors and acquaintances have a lot of respect for him and hold him in great esteem.

loans.use: To buy chicken meat to expand his sales business in the market.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

Para la señora María este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy contenta con los créditos, las facilidades que brinda la institución para obtener los créditos y para realizar los pagos. Tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 14, 13 y 11 años, los dos mayores están en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su marido es agricultor.

Se dedican a la agricultura junto a su esposo, siembran maíz, habas, habichuelas y maní. Además de sembrar y cultivar la tierra el esposo también se dedica al comercio ya que lo que produce lo lleva a los mercados a vender, también le compra verduras a otros agricultores para aumentar sus ventas y obtener más ingresos, trabajan de lunes a viernes en el campo y los sabados y domingos en la venta de legumbres en el mercado.

Este crédito es para comprar verduras para vender, fertilizantes y semillas ya que pronto comienza el invierno y tienen que empezar a sembrar. Su deseo es tener una casa bien construida.
texts.en:
In the canton of Rocafuerte, the members of the "Mujeres Trabajadores" ["Hard-Working Women"] communal bank meet every two weeks. This area is known for its delicious sweets that the local people make, which are recognized throughout the country. 

For María, this is the second loan cycle in her communal bank, and she is very happy with the loans and the conditions that the institutions provide to obtain the loans and make the payments. She is 32 years old, and she is in a common-law marriage, in which she has three children, aged 14, 13 and 11. The two older children are in secondary school and the youngest is in primary school. Her husband is a farmer. 

She works in agriculture together with her husband, planting corn, beans, green beans and peanuts. In addition to planting and cultivating the fields, her husband also works in commerce, since he takes what he produces to the markets to sell. He also buys vegetables from other farmers to increase his sales and obtain more income. Both of them work from Monday to Friday in the fields, and Saturday and Sunday they sell vegetables at the market. 

This loan is to buy vegetables to sell, as well as fertilizers and seeds, because the winter growing season is coming and they need to start planting. Her desire is to have a well-built house.

loans.use: Buying vegetables, fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
María Rosa es una madre D. familia D. 56 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito D. Pacasmayo, una zona bastante comercial ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más D. dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con un puesto D. venta ubicado en el mercado D. su localidad. Allí ofrece a sus clientes diversos abarrotes y alimento balanceado para animales. El negocio ya tiene veinte años D. antigüedad y cuenta con una clientela fidelizada, gracias a el pueD. colaborar con el sostenimiento económico D. su familia.

María Rosa desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos D. modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales pueda lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y D. buen trato, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
María Rosa is a 56-year-old mother who lives with her family in the district of Pacasmayo, a fairly commercial zone located in the La Libertad region, over two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.
She runs a stand at her local market, where she offers her customers various groceries and animal feed. The business is twenty years old and, thanks to her loyal customer base, she is able to help support her family.
María Rosa would like to expand her business by acquiring more products that will increase her sales and income. She is requesting a 1500 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach her goal.
She is quite a responsible and pleasant woman. People who know her have great respect for her.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery products

loans.name: María Octavila

texts.es:
María Octavila tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito D. Pacasmayo, una zona bastante comercial ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más D. dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con aves D. corral y animales menores en su domicilio, los engorda y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta al publico en general en el mercado D. su localidad. El negocio es una importante fuente D. ingresos para la economía D. su familia por lo que siempre trata D. mantenerlo D. la mejor manera posible.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. alimento para lograr que sus animales se desarrollen D. mejor modo y puedan ser vendidos a mejor precio, sobretodo en estas fechas en las cuales la demanda aumenta debido a la proximidad D. las festividades naviD.ñas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Octavila is 58 years old, married, and lives with her family in Pacasmayo district, a rather large commercial zone located in La Libertad region, more than two hours from Chiclayo city, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She raises domestic birds and small animals in her home. She feeds them and then when they have grown enough she sells them to the public in her local market. The business is an important source of income for her family so she always tries to maintain it the best way possible.

María wishes to expand her business by buying feed so that her animals grow in the best way they can and can be sold at the best price; above all in these days the demand is increasing because of the upcoming Christmas holidays. Therefore she has asked Edpyme Alternative for a 1000 nuevos soles loan.

loans.use: Buy food to improve her business raising and selling animals.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PROSPERIDAD”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Edgar; El socio tiene 25 años de edad, El socio  es soltero; el socio  se dedica a administrar una pequeña empresa de elaboración de tortas y también la venta y distribución de las mismas, el socio trabaja en las tiendas de magisterio y de San Jerónimo.  El socio es natural de la ciudad de Abancay, el socio tiene un pequeño y propio negocio el apertura una tienda de distribución de gas para lo cual requiere mercadería y el invertirá el dinero en la compra de mercadería. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en mercadería. 

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Edgar is a member of the “Prosperidad” (Prosperity) community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Edgar is 25 years old.  He is single and runs a small company which makes, sells and delivers cakes.  He works for stores in Magisterio and San Jerónimo.  He is originally from the city of Abancay.  Edgar is going to open a business which distributes gas and for this reason he requires merchandise.  He will invest his loan in buying merchandise.

Edgar is grateful for his loan and appreciates it.  He pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise

loans.name: Rusia Mia

texts.es:
Rusia es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a una hija en el sector San Antonio, una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una ciudad bastante conocida a nivel nacional por su potencial turístico y comercial.

Ella cuenta con un puesto de venta de ropa en uno de los mercados de la ciudad. Rusia adquiere sus productos en la ciudad de Lima y los comercializa entre el público que diariamente acude a este mercado de abastos. El negocio tiene una antigüedad de tres años. Las prendas que vende son para todo público y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fidelizada. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad le sirven para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Rusia desea surtir en inventario de su negocio debido al cambio de temporada. Por ese motivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales comprará diversas prendas como jeans, blusas, conjuntos para niños, entre otros, atendiendo a las solicitudes de sus clientes ya que existe una alta demanda por productos debido a que es conocida por dicha actividad en la zona.

Rusia  se ha propuesto invertir en mostrar una mayor calidad de prendas puesto que es la única que vende prendas novedosas y de calidad  en el mercado.
texts.en:
Rusia is a 36 year old mother who lives with her husband and daughter in San Antonio, an urban zone on the outskirts of Chiclayo city, a city rather well known nationally for its touristic and commercial potential.

She has a stand selling clothing in one of the markets in the city. Rusia acquires her products in Lima and sells them to the public who come to this market daily for supplies. She has had this business for three years. The clothing she sells is for everyone and she actually has a faithful clientele. The income she earns with this business enables her to help her husband support the family economically.

Rusia  wishes to stock her business’s inventory due to the change in season. For this she has approached Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 nuevos soles loan with which she will buy a variety of clothing such as jeans, blouses, children’s outfits, and more according to her customer’s needs as there is a high demand for products since she is known for this business in this area of the city.

Rusia  has proposed to invest in the highest quality clothing as she is the only person who sells new, quality clothing in the market.

loans.use: Buy clothing to expand her business in the market

loans.name: Nilda Alberta

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Nilda,  ella tiene 44 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado 5 hijos, cuatro son mayores de edad y el menor estudia en colegio y es el que vive con ella. El marido se dedica a la agricultura. Hace muchos años ella estudió belleza y es a eso lo que ella se dedica.
 
Tiene un salón de belleza, donde sus clientes llegan a realizarse muchos trabajos de belleza personal, realiza cortes de cabello, tinturados peinados y maquillajes, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 18h00, hay días que tiene mucho trabajo y su hija es quien le ayuda.  También vende productos y tratamientos de belleza.

Este crédito es para comprar shampoo, tintes, cremas  y otros productos de belleza. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace dos ciclos y le gusta por la facilidad para realizar los pagos. Su sueño es tener un gran spa.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Hard-Working Women) community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious desserts and sweets which its residents make and which are are known throughout the country.

Here we meet Nilda.  She is 44 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  They have 5 children; four are grown up and the youngest is in school and still lives at home.  Nilda's husband is a farmer.  She studied to be a beautician and this is her business activity.

Nilda has a beauty salon where her customers come to receive a number of different personal beauty treatments.  She cuts hair, colors hair and does make up.  She works every day from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  There are days when she has a lot of work and her daughter helps her out.  She also sells beauty products and treatments.

This loan will be used to buy shampoo, dyes, creams and other beauty products.  Nilda has been a member of her community bank for two loan cycles.  She likes the ease with which she can make her payments.  Her dream is to own a big spa.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, dyes, creams and beauty products

loans.name: Fermin Edilman

texts.es:
Fermin tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a dos hijos menores de edad en la localidad de La Clake, una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada a pocos minutos del distrito de Reque, situado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con un par de bueyes con los que suele ofrecer servicio de yunta a los agricultores de la zona. El es bastante conocido entre los agricultores del lugar y de zonas aledañas. Adicionalmente posee una pequeña bodega instalada en su vivienda, con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades el solventa la economía de su familia y trata de sacarlos adelante.

Fermín desea incursionar en el negocio de venta de leche, por lo que desea adquirir una vaca la cual pienza utilizar para este fin, por ello ha querido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles. 

El es bastante conocido en la zona por su honradez y carácter servicial. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Fermín is 38 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two small children in La Clake, a rural area located a few minutes from Reque, located twenty minutes from Chiclayo city.

He has a pair of oxen with which he offers plowing services to farmers in the area. He is rather well-known among the famers in the area and in neighboring villages. In addition, he owns a small store located in his home. With the income he receives from these activities he supports is family economically and tries to help them get ahead.

Fermín wishes to have a business selling milk, so he wants to buy a cow in order to accomplish this goal. He has asked Edpyme Alternative for a 2000 nuevos soles loan.

He is well-known in the area for his honor and character for services. His greatest goal is to continue growing as a businessman to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: Buy a cow in order to have a business selling milk

loans.name: María Ricardina

texts.es:
María tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos en el caserío El Romero, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la confección artesanal de  alforjas (accesorio utilizado por los agricultores de la zona para cargar alimentos y utensilios durante las horas de trabajo) y manteles de hilo. Ella nos comenta que tuvo que empezar a trabajar en este negocio debido a que los ingresos que su esposo percibía como agricultor no bastaban para sostener la economía familiar.

María hace su trabajo en base a pedidos que llegan a hacerle los vecinos de su caserío y de caseríos aledaños. Elaborar una sola alforja le toma cerca de 20 días. Su negocio ha ido desarrollándose y ahora su nivel de pedidos ha aumentado, ella desea adquirir algunos materiales como hilos, lanas y lanillas para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, que aumenta durante estas semanas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

María ya ha tenido un préstamo financiado por el fondo Kiva y brindado a través de Edpyme Alternativa mediante su producto Capital Semilla. Gracias a este préstamo ella pudo adquirir material para cumplir con algunos pedidos que tenía pendientes. Ella se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and three children. They live in the El Romero neighborhood in the district of Mórrope, located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She makes hand-crafted saddlebags (an accessory used by farmers in the area to carry food and tools during the work day) and table cloths. She tells us that she had to start working because her husband’s income as a farmer was not enough to cover the family expenses.

María works based on orders made by people in her neighborhood and those from neighboring areas. It takes 20 days to make one saddlebag. Her business has been developing and now the number of orders has increased. She wants to obtain some materials like thread, wool and flannel to satisfy the demands of her customers which are increasing during these weeks. For this reason, she thought it was a good idea to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2000 nuevos soles.

María has already had a loan financed by the Kiva fund and offered though  Edpyme Alternativa’s Capital Semilla product. She is very grateful for the people who collaborated with her through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy materials to increase her saddlebag and tablecloth business

loans.name: Zolila Rosa

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Zoila es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, nos cuenta que le agrada mucho ya que le ha servido  para sacar su negocio adelante. Tiene 61 años de edad, tiene 8 hijos de una relación de unión libre que tuvo pero en la actualidad está separada ya 13 años, sus hijos ya todos son mayores de edad aunque dos de ellos viven aun en su casa.
 
Se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo, además de estos productos también vende dulces que los compra o se los mandan  de Santo Domingo y que a sus clientes les encantan. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 19h00, dice que su negocio lo tiene ya por varios años y que gracias a Dios  le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz, azúcar, atún, aceite, detergentes y dulces. Sus sueños son tener una tienda mucho más grande y surtida, y tener salud para ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Hard-Working Women) community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious desserts and sweets which its residents make and they are known all over the country.

Zoila is a founding member of her community bank.  She tells us that she likes it a lot as it has helped her to get ahead in her business.  Zoila is 61 years old.  She has 8 children from her common-law marriage but she has been separated from her partner for 13 years.  Her children are all grown up although two of them still live at home.

Zoila is a saleswoman.  She has a grocery store where she sells not only groceries but also sweets which she buys or has sent from Santo Domingo.  Her customers love them.  She works every day from 6.30am to 7.00pm.  She says that she has had her business for several years and, thanks to God, it has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, tuna, oil, detergents and sweets.  Her dreams are to have a much bigger and better-stocked store and for herself and her family to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, tuna, oil, detergents and sweets

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el Anexo Barrio Muro del Caserío Tranca Sasape, una zona rural ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope, una zona de pobladores humildes que suelen dedicarse a la agricultura y al comercio, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Ella aves como gallinas, patos y pavos al aire libre cerca de su vivienda, las suele alimentar de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando estas aves ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona y al público en general. Adicionalmente cuenta con un pequeño taller de costura en su vivienda en donde suele confeccionar diversas prendas para damas y caballero en base a pedidos. Con estos ingresos ella se encarga de colaborar con el sostenimiento diario de su familia.

Matilde desea adquirir alimento balanceado para sus animales ya que desea que estos se desarrollen de mejor modo para que sean vendidos a un mejor precio, sobretodo durante la temporada navideña que es cuando la demanda aumenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante hogareña y trabajadora. En la imagen nos muestra su pequeño taller de confección.
texts.en:
Matilde is 56 years old.  She is married and lives together with her family in Barrio Muro annex of Tranca Sasape, a rural area of Mórrope district.  This is an area of unassuming people who usually work in agriculture and commerce.  It is in Lambayeque province, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Matilde raises and sells young animals.  She raises hens, ducks and turkeys in the open air near her home.  She usually feeds her birds on grain and natural fodder.  When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the traders who usually visit her area and also to the general public.  Matilde also has a small sewing workshop in her home where she makes different garments for men and women to order.  With this income she contributes to the daily support of her family.

Matilde would like to acquire basic feed for her animals since she would like them to develop as well as possible so that she can sell them for a good price, particularly during this Christmas period which is when demand increases.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Matilda is a home-loving and hard-working woman.  In the photo she shows us her small dressmaking workshop.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed to improve her business raising and selling animals

location.town: Anexo Barrio Muro - Tranca Sasape - Mórrope - Lamb

loans.name: Sop Dabakh Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP DABAKH est composé de 12 femmes qui habitent la même concession, elles sont de la même famille et mènent diverses activités telles que la couture, la coiffure  et le petit commerce.

La responsable Daba F. est célibataire sans enfant en charge, elle est couturière mais vend des tissus et des produits cosmétiques. Elle est à droite sur la photo.

Le prêt reçu de 170 000 F lui permet de renforcer son activité ; 

avec ses bénéfices elle se prend en charge et participe aux dépenses familiales pour soutenir sa mère.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP DABAKH is made up of 12 women who live in the same area. They are all from the same family and carry out different activities, such as sewing, hairstyling, and small-scale retail.

Daba F., the group's leader, is single with no dependent children. She is a seamstress and also sells fabric and beauty products. She is on the right in the photo.

The 170,000 franc loan will allow her to increase her business: with her earnings, she can meet her own needs and contribute to the family's expenses to support her mother.

loans.use: To increase business activity

loans.name: Jose Odar

texts.es:
José tiene 25 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el barrio San Antonio de Padua, una zona urbano marginal situada en las afueras de la ciudad de Lambayeque, una zona bastante comercial situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica al negocio de la crianza y venta de animales menores desde hace tres años. El cría sus animales en algunos corrales situados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente ofrece servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte).

José desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta, sobredoto en estas semanas que es cuando la demanda aumenta debido a la proximidad de las fiestas navideñas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en: José is 25 years old, married and lives with his family in the San Antonio de Padua barrio, a marginally urban area situated on the outskirts of the city of Lambayeque. It is a rather commercial area located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. José has made a living raising and selling small animals for the past three years. He raises the animals in some corrals located behind his home, and when the animals reach a good level of development he sells them to businesspeople who often visit his area. Additionally, he offers delivery and passenger transportation service with a mototaxi (a motorcylcle with an attached cabin). José wishes to acquire more animals and balanced feed so he can expand his business, especially since this is time of year when demand is high because Christmas is approaching. To do this, he is requesting a loan of 1,500 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase animals and feed to expand business

loans.name: Gema Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

Gema tiene 20 años de edad, esta casada y fruto de esta relación tiene una hermosa pequeñita de 5 meses de nacida la cual es el mejor regalo según nos cuenta. Su esposo es militar activo. Estudia cosmetología en un instituto en la ciudad de Manta y este año termina sus estudios.

Tiene un salón de belleza, donde sus clientes llegan a realizarse muchos trabajos de belleza personal, realiza cortes de cabello, tinturados peinados y maquillajes, trabaja todos los días desde las 14h00 hasta las 19h00, trabaja solo en las tardes ya que en las mañanas tiene que ir a sus estudios. También vende productos y tratamientos de belleza.

Este crédito es para comprar shampoo, tintes, cremas  además de implementos que aún le faltan en su salón, además para pagar su tesis. Es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez con la que consiguió el crédito. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y tener un gran SPA.
texts.en:
In the canton of Rocafuerte, the members of the "Mujeres Trabajadoras" ["Hard-Working Women"] communal bank meet every two weeks. This area is known for the delicious sweets prepared by the local people which are recognized throughout the country. 

Gema is 20 years old and married. With her husband she has a beautiful little girl only 5 months old, which is her greatest gift, as she reports. Her husband is an active member of the military. She is studying cosmetology at an institute in the city of Manta, and this year she is finishing her studies. 

She has a beauty salon where her customers come for many personal beauty treatments. She offers haircuts, hair styling, hair coloring, and makeup. She works every day from 2 p.m. to 7 p.m.; she works only in the evenings because she has to go to her classes in the mornings. She also sells beauty products and treatments. 

This loan is to buy shampoo, hair dyes, and creams as well as tools that she still needs in her salon, and also to pay for her thesis. It is her first loan cycle in the communal bank, and she likes it because of the speed with which she obtained the loan. Her dreams are to finish her studies and open a large spa.

loans.use: Buying shampoo, hair dyes, creams, and tools for her salon, and also paying the costs for her graduation thesis

loans.name: Lourdes Del Rocío

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento en su vivienda, allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes y vecinos diversos productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, sobretodo porque se encuentra ubicado en una zona céntrica. Adicionalmente comercializa productos de belleza por catálogo entre los clientes que llegan a su tienda. El negocio le hace sentir bastante activa y con las ganancias que obtiene se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

Lourdes desea ampliar sus negocio con la compra de más productos, ya que durante esta temporada la demanda aumenta. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 28 years old.  She is single and lives with her family in the Mochumi district, an agricultural area with plenty of business activity, which is found more than 1/2 hour from the city of Chiclayo.
She has a small store in her residence.  She sells diverse necessities and groceries to customers and neighbors.  Her business has prospered, mostly because it is located in a central zone. She also sells beauty products through a catalog to her customers.  She feels quite active with her business and has income sufficient to sustain and advance her family.
Lourdes wants to expand her business by purchasing more products.  This is the season when demand increases; therefore, she has requested a loan of $550 (1500 nuevos soles) from Edpyme Alternative (local lending institution).

loans.use: Purchase of additional inventory

loans.name: Nelida Isabel

texts.es:
Nelida es una madre de familia de 46 años de edad, tiene tres hijos dependientes, reside en el distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega situada en su domicilio en donde ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace dos años y durante este tiempo se ha hecho bastante conocida entre los vecinos de la zona, los que siempre acuden a su negocio porqye prefieren la calidad de productos y el buen trato que ofrece.

Nelida desea adquirir más productos para ampliar su negocio, en especial durante la temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda suele aumentar. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los que espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: Nelida is a 46-year-old mother of three children and lives in the district of Lamayeque, an area with quite a lot of commercial movement located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She runs a small bodega out of her home where she offers a wide variety of products, including primary-need items and groceries, to her customers for daily consumption. She has dedicated herself to this activity for the past two years, during which time she has become well known among her neighbors, who always visit her business because they prefer the quality of her products and her good customer service. Nelida wants to acquire more products to expand her business, especially during Christmastime when demand is typically high. To achieve this objective, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles.

loans.use: Purchase products to expand business

loans.name: Maryorie Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Maryorie es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, nos cuenta que le agradan mucho las reuniones educativas y por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 35 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 15, 11 y 9 años, el mayor esta en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su marido trabaja en una camaronera.
 
Es una buena ama de casa que además se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, ella prepara almuerzos por encargo los mismos que tiene que llevar a entregar en los lugares donde le realizan los pedidos, también en las tardes vende corviches y empanadas en su casa en la cual tiene un pequeño puestito, aunque también fabrica para entregar por docenas.
 
Este crédito es para comprar arroz, carne, plátano, maní y otros productos para la preparación de los alimentos. Su sueño es ver que sus hijos sean unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the canton of Rocafuerte, the members of the "Mujeres Trabajadores" ["Hard-Working Women"] communal bank meet every two weeks. This area is known for the delicious sweets prepared by the local people, which are recognized throughout the country. 

Maryorie is a founding member of her communal bank, and she reports that she very much enjoys the educational meetings and the speed in obtaining loans. She is 35 years old and maintains a common-law marriage, from which she has three children, aged 15, 11 and 9. The older child is in secondary school and the younger one in primary school. Her husband works at a shrimp farm. 
 
She is a good at-home mother who also works preparing and selling food. She prepares lunches to order, which she has to take for delivery to the places where the orders come from. In the evenings, she also sells ceviches and empanadas from her home, where she has a little stand; she also prepares them for delivery by the dozen. 

This loan is to buy rice, meat, plantains, peanuts and other products to prepare the food she sells. Her dream is to see her children become good professionals.

loans.use: Buying rice, meat, plantains, peanuts and groceries in general

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Victoriano tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Yencala León del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito poblado por gente humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales menores. El cría animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona y al público en general. El negocio le sirve para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Victoriano desea adquirir algunos animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar sus ventas durante esta  temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Victoriano is 28 years old.  He is single and lives with his family in the town of Yencala León, in Mórrope district, a district of humble and hard-working people who work as farmers.  The district is in Lambayeque province, more than forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Victoriano raises and sells young animals.  He raises young animals in the area behind his home and when they have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to traders in his area and to the general public.  His business helps to cover his personal expenses and helps to support his family financially.

Victoriano would like to acquire some animals and balanced feed to increase his sales during this Christmas season which is when his demand increases.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy young animals and balanced feed to increase his business raising and selling animals

loans.name: Dolores Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Dolores, ella tiene 29 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado dos hijos de 8 y 7 años, los mismos que estudian en escuela, el marido es agricultor.
 
Es una ama de casa que le ayuda a su esposo en sus actividades, se dedican a la agricultura, siembran y cultivan plátano y coco, y en temporadas invernales siembran maíz, maní y verduras, producción que cuando la cosechan la llevan a los mercados para venderlos a comerciantes del lugar. Además de esto también compran coco a los agricultores y los llevan a vender en el mercado de Portoviejo, esto lo hacen los sabados o domingos.

Este crédito es para comprar semillas, abonos  químicos y fertilizantes. Está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y está muy a gusto en el grupo. Su sueño es comprar un carro ya que en el que llevan los cocos es fletado.
texts.en:
The members of the “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Working Women) communal bank meet every two weeks in the Rocafuerte hamlet.  This area is known throughout the country for the delicious sweets prepared by its inhabitants.  Here we find 29 year old Dolores.  She is in a live in relationship and has two children, ages 8 and 7.  Her life partner is a farmer and the children attend school.

She works as a housekeeper and also helps with the farming chores.  Together they raise bananas and coconuts.  In the winter months they plant corn, peanuts, and other vegetables.  They sell their harvest to local merchants at the marketplace and also buy coconuts from other farmers and take them to the Portiviejo market on the weekends.

They will use the money from this loan to buy seeds, chemicals, and fertilizer.  She has been part of the communal bank since it began and she is very happy to be a part of this group.  She would like to be able to buy a car because the one they use to deliver the coconuts in is leased.

loans.use: Seeds, chemicals, and fertilizer

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el caserío Macuaco, una localidad rural de pobladores humildes y trabajadores que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito agrícola de Oyotún, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con un terreno agrícola en la zona donde reside. Allí el suele sembrar arroz dos veces por año y con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de sacar adelante a la economía de su familia. El ya cuenta con más de diez años dedicándose a esta actividad y debido a ello conoce mucho del manejo de estos cultivos.

Emilio desea adquirir fertilizantes para poder asegurarse una buena producción de su cultivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. Emilio es una persona bastante hogareña y estimada por las personas de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Emilio is 56 years old, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Macuaco, a rural village of modest and hardworking residents that is located in the Oyotún agricultural district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

Emilio owns agricultural land in the area where he lives. He usually plants rice two times a year there and with the income he receives from this, helps his family get ahead economically. He has been doing this work for ten years now and because of this, knows much about managing these crops. 

Emilio would like to acquire fertilizer in order to be assured of a good production of his crop. Therefore, he thought it would be a good idea to apply for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa that will help him to achieve his goal. Emilio is very much a family man and is respected by the people in his community.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer in order to maintain his rice crop.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma F. is from the village of New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 38 years old. Norma is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Norma operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling health and medicinal products in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Norma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Norma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 65 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Nueva Arica una zona agrícola ubicada una hora y media al sureste de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con animales menores en algunos corrales situados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Los alimenta diariamente de granos y pastos naturales y cuando ya están completamente desarrollados los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde vive y eventualmente los vende en una feria que suele realizarse una vez por semana en el vecino distrito de Cayaltí.

Julio desea adquirir más animales menores y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, sobretodo en la temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda por sus animales se incrementa, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Julio es una persona bastante responsable y muy entregada a su familia y a su negocio. Las personas que le conoce le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Julio is 65 years old, is married, and resides with his family in the agricultural zone of the Nueva Arica district, located one and a half hours southeast of the city of Chiclayo. 

He has small animals in some corrals located behind his home. He feeds them daily with grain and grass, and when they are completely grown he offers to sell them to businesspeople who often visit the area where he lives. He eventually sells them at a market that is set up once a week in the neighboring district of Cayaltí. 

Julio would like to acquire more small animals and balanced feed in order to expand his business and increase his sales, especially in the Christmas season since this is when the demand for his animals increases. For this reason, he thought it would be a good opportunity to apply for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa. 

Julio is a very responsible person who is very devoted to his family and his business. The people who know him have much esteem and respect for him.

loans.use: To buy small animals and balanced feed in order to expand his business raising and selling the animals.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty M. is from the village of New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 30 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Betty owns a retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Betty joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Betty from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.en:
Cesar is sixty-seven years old.  He maintains a stable home along with his wife and their two youngest children and a grandchild.  Both children are adults and independent, however they have elected to continue to live close by.  The family lives in the town of Tambogrande and own a parcel of farmland nearby.

On this parcel of land Cesar has a number of products he plants.  He has a fruit orchard from which he harvests mangoes and limes.  He also has a portion of the land available to rotate various crops throughout the year.  He works hard to maintain good production.

The requested loan will be used for the current harvest and also to purchase planting supplies and fertilizer.  Cesar is an experienced farmer and knows how to estimate the costs and potential profits of his activities.  He hopes to be able to earn a good profit on these crops in order to continue to improve his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase planting supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Trigidia

texts.en:
Trigidia is forty-seven years old.  She lives in the village of Santa Elena in the district of TambogranD. in northern Peru.  TambogranD. is a primarily rural region with a large number of small fruit farmers and families that raise animals.  Trigidia lives there with her husband and her father.  They share a happy and stable home.

Trigidia raises goats in the land near her home.  She raises the animals in corrals and feeds them local plants or feed which she purchases.  She sells them in local markets for their meat.  She also has a small stall in which she sells juices, a soy based drink and various foods, candies and other items.  Trigidia’s husband works during the week near the city of Piura running heavy machinery and earning stable wages.  He comes home each Saturday to spend time with the family.

The requested loan will be used to purchase additional feed for the animals and improve the selection of merchandise that Trigidia sells.  She hopes to be able to get a good bulk discount on the feed and improve the profit margin of her businesses.  She is proud to manage these portions of the family business and improve her family’s well being.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for the animals and improve the selection of merchandise that Trigidia sells.

loans.name: María Juda

texts.en:
Maria is sixty-seven years old.  She lives in the village of 8-4 Bajo Cuceta.  It is a small community in the district of TambogranD. in northern Peru.  She shares the home which she owns with her husband and one grandchild.  The area in which they live is rural and primarily populated by small fruit farmers and individuals who raise animals.

Maria raises sheep in the rear portion of her home.  She has corrals to protect her animals and keep them from wandering away.  She feeds them local plants and feed which she purchases.  She raises the sheep for their meat and sells them in local markets.  She usual sells the animals live to various wholesalers.

The requested loan will be used to improve her corrals.  Her corrals are currently in disrepair and she would like to make a major investment in order to bring them up to standard and to improve the assets of her home.  She hopes that this will reduce the time required to care for her animals and also improve the growth process.  She hopes these changes in her business will reduce health care expenses and increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To improve her corrals.

loans.name: Chheurn

texts.en:
Mr. Chheurn K., age 27 has been living in a small wooden house located in a rural area of Kampong Chhnang Province.  He lives with his one school-aged child and his wife, who works in farm fields together with him for many years. 

From day to day, Mr. Chheurn K. works on his farm, planting rice and vegetable crops which he will sell to buyers when they are mature.  In the past, Chheurn K. has hired a villager’s cow to plow his land but now he wants to reduce this expense by taking out a loan to buy his own cow to plow his farmland.

loans.use: To buy his own cow to plow his farmland.

loans.name: Am

texts.en:
Mr. Am S. is a 48-year-old who lives in Takhmao City. Mr. Am S. is a local fisherman, and he can earn an income of approximately $3 per day. He usually needs to take eight hours a day to fish, in and around the river in his community. He catches around 5 kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers who are retail sellers in the market. 

His wife’s name is Sambok (pictured); she is 44 and has a shop where she sells rice. This couple is blessed with five children, one of whom is single. The remaining four are married, and they are employed as garment worker in a factory.  

Mr. Am S. is concerned that he is obliged to walk to sell his fish and he dreams of having a vehicle to pick up his fish, but he doesn’t have money yet to buy one. Therefore, Mr. Am S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for his transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle to transport his fish to sell

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban S., age 35, is a fisherman who now lives in Takhmao City. Ban S. and his wife work in the same business, and they normally earn an average of $6 per day to help cover their family’s daily living expenses. This couple has been married for many years, and they have five children. All of them are still studying in school. 

Ban S. and his wife always get up every morning and drive their boat toward the middle of the river and then fish. After fishing is done, they hurry up to bring their fish to the busy market and sell it to their regular buyers. Ban S. will use his loan to purchase nets and other fishing implements so he can catch more fish. Ban S. was not available that day, so his wife and her daughter are pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase nets and other fishing implements

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda M. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 40 years old. Merlinda is married and has two children, aged 18 and 19. Both of her children are in college now and it has been a challenge for Merlinda to sustain their education. 

To make a living, Merlinda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making "puto" (rice cakes) and other delicacies for sale. Merlinda hopes to venture into other types of products.

Merlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Orm

texts.en:
Mr. Orm C., age 52, is a married man living in Takhmao City. To earn a living, Mr. Orm C. works making bricks in a factory in his district and he earns a proper salary every month in order to support his family’s daily expenses. Mr. Orm C.'s wife is employed as a cleaner in the factory. Besides working, Mr. Orm C. is also a farmer and he owns a piece of farmland that he inherited many years ago from his grandparents. In the past, Mr. Orm C. has always hired the neighbor’s cow in order to alleviate the chore of plowing the farmland. Now he hopes to buy his own cow and that is why he is applying for a loan from Kiva. This will provide him with an additional fixed asset. 

Note: Mr. Orm C.’s son is pictured here because he was not available when the photograph was taken.

loans.use: To buy his own cow.

loans.name: Ranulfa

texts.en:
Ranulfa T. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 43 years old. Ranulfa is married and has an 18-year-old child. To make a living, Ranulfa raises pigs for breeding. 

Ranulfa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ranulfa has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Ranulfa is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Mr. Rene D. is from the village of Pulot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old. Rene is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Rene owns and operates a motor cab. He has been engaged in this kind of business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for this activity.

In 2010, Rene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rene is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to fully pay for his current motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children’s education and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.en:
Ricarda C. is from the town of Trinidad. She is married. To make a living, Ricarda prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Ricarda works hard to help provide for her family. She hopes to have a stable income.

Ricarda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ricarda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Ricarda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase vegetables and other ingredients. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and other ingredients

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Ra Y. has spent her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has six children, all of whom are single and living with her. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, and he also helps her to farm. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. Ra Y. is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Unfortunately, her cow is getting old and can no longer support her during the plowing process. Ra Y. is looking for a loan to purchase a new cow to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase new cow to replace the old one.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino M. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 59 years old. Rufino is married and has four children. His eldest child is 29 years old and the youngest is 15. Rufino operates "habal-habal" (motorcycle) transport services. He works daily. Rufino is also an operator of a rice mill. He says his income from it also helps in their daily needs. Rufino works hard to build his transportation business.

Rufino joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rufino has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rufino is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Chey

texts.en: Chey P. is a 40-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Chhnang Province. Chey P. is married to Khoum Kna, also 40 years old. This couple, who work together in the farming business, have seven children. Six of the children are married and one is single. Due to the coming harvesting season, Chey P. has decided to seek a loan on Kiva for capital to buy more rice during the time when rice is commanding its lowest price. She will then sell it later when the price is increasing.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Glory Fe

texts.en:
Glory Fe is from the village of Taguima, Tudela Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she raises crops . She has been engaged in her business for twenty years and earns approximately 5,000 a month from this activity.

In May 19, 2006, Glory Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and as well as to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fertilizers and farm supplies. Glory Fe is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To Purchase Additional Fertilizers and Farm Supplies

loans.name: Jose Rene

texts.es:
Jose de 35 años, tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales.

Siempre le gusto el comercio y cuando tuvo la oportunidad de tener su negocio con un pequeño capital compro víveres para tener su propia tienda. Por la buena decisión de colocar la tienda en la parte delantera de su casa ahora lo conocen en el sector muchas personas. Trabaja desde las 07h00h hasta las 16h00pm atendiendo la tienda vende arroz, azúcar, bebidas, enlatados, snack etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar y aceite ya que son los víveres que más consumen las personas. 

En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio para tener más dinero y asegurar su vejez y la de sus padres ya que no tiene hijos y es soltero.
texts.en:
Jose is 35 years old and has a little grocery store in the front part of his house. He lives in an urban zone called Guasmo, which is characterized by the fact that most of its inhabitants are informal merchants.

He has always liked selling, and when he had the opportunity to open his business with a small amount of capital, he bought groceries so that he could have his own store. Thanks to the good decision to open the store in the front part of his house, he is now known by many people in his area. He works from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. tending the store, where he sells rice, sugar, soft drinks, canned foods, snacks, etc. With the loan, he wants to buy rice, sugar, and cooking oil, since these are the groceries that people consume most. 

In the future, he would like to expand his business to earn more money and save for his old age and that of his parents, since he is single and has no children.

loans.use: Buying rice and canned goods

loans.name: Hin

texts.en: The woman in the photograph is Hin S., age 29, who lives in the province of Kompong Chhnang, which is the best territory for farming. Her husband is a local farmer. Hin S. is a married woman who is devoted to her two young children, both of whom attend school and depend on her care. Hin S. owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows a various crops on it. She now plants a peanut crop and she estimates that she will harvest it within the next two months when the plants mature. Hin S. will use the income from selling her mature crop to better meet her family’s needs. Because her income is just enough for family’s daily expenses, her house is frequently cracking during the heavy rainy season. To solve this problem, she is requesting a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house.

loans.name: Mary An Janit

texts.en:
Mary An Janit is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture raising crops. She has been engaged in her business for four years and earns approximately 3,000 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Mary An Janit joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fertilizers such as manure.
Mary An Janit is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her farm.

loans.name: Hok

texts.en: Hok S., 29, is married to Sophal, 30, and they are villagers in the province of Kompong Chhnang. Hok S. is good at making bamboo baskets for the market. She and her husband trek sometimes through the village seeking bamboo and take them home and then put them into water for almost a week. After that, they dry them in the sunshine for three days. They split the bamboo into smaller pieces and then she and her husband start making them into baskets. This couple was married a few years ago, but they have only one lovely child. Currently, Hok S. wants to invest in her business in a bigger size than present, but she is lacking some capital to run it well. So Hok S. would like to request a loan to purchase more baskets for selling.

loans.use: To purchase more baskets for selling.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old, married, and has seven adult children. To make a living,she operates a specialized retail store. She has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns approximately 8000 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Jovita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital.
Jovita is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 8th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her retail store.

loans.name: Mien's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four low-income people who live together in Siem Reap province. Mrs. Mien P. has been recruited to be the leader of this group by the other borrowers. She is 38, married, and the mother of five children. Four of her children are students. The other is no longer in school and is working as a porter. Mien P. currently earns her daily living by working as a carrying laborer in the local market, earning $3 each day. Her husband is also a porter in the same the market. The family’s living conditions are not comfortable because their house needs repairs. Mien P. is seeking a loan to make some improvements to her house.

The other three borrowers include: 
Mrs. Ren K., a fish porter, who is asking for a loan to repair her broken house.
Mrs. Am P. will use this loan for repairing her broken house.
Mrs. Hoat N. is applying for a loan to purchase more pigs and ducks to raise.

loans.use: To make some improvements to her house.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates business manufacturing hollow blocks to sell in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for five months and earns approximately 2,000 a month from this activity.

In June 12, 2008, Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her second loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her manufacturing business.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Vorn B., 35, is a village man living in Russey Keo City. To help meet the family's daily needs, Vorn B. works driving a horse and cart taxi. He owns a cart and he uses it to pick up passersby and merchandise in and around his community. Vorn B. has a life partner with his wife (pictured) a seller. Her products include plastic products and fast food, and she earns an income of approximately $3 per day. They have two children who are studying in school. Vorn B. has been facing difficulties transporting his customers because his horse cart is slow and that affects how he can satisfy the needs of his customers. Because of this problem, Vorn B. decided to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle to which he will attach his existing cart. He will use this to transport his customer more quickly.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to which he will attach his existing cart to transport his customers more quickly.

loans.name: Ghulam Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Sughran is a housewife. She prefers to stay at home and perform her household responsibilities. She lives in Khanewala, Pakistan, a city that is famous for its agriculture industry. She has lived in the Basti Zahoorabad area with her family for over 9 years. 

She is the mother of three sons. Her eldest son operates a shop in the market where he sells milk and yogurt. Her youngest son is studying in 4th class. The middle one is free and doesn’t do anything. 

Sughran has applied for a loan from Asasah, a Kiva field partner, to help her husband's fruit business. He sells fresh fruits from his four-wheeled cart by visiting different streets of the city. He buys fruit cheaply from the fruit markets and sells them for a good profit. With the loan, he will buy a new cart and seasonal fruits to improve his business. He needs to replace his cart because many parts are broken and its wheels are out of order.
  
Sughran hopes that the loan investment in her husband’s business will be a profitable one and he will be able to improve his business. She is a regular Asasah borrower and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and attended every meeting.

In the photo, Ghulam Sughran is the woman who is holding the Asasah Passbook.

loans.use: To buy a new cart and seasonal fruits for her husband's fruit business

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad lives in Khanewal, a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan that is known for its agriculture industry. She lives in a 2-room brick house with her family. 

Irshad is a widow who suffered the sudden death of her husband few years ago. It was a very difficult time for her but she never gave up and fought the circumstances bravely. She started working in her husband’s fields along with her eldest son. She worked very hard to raise her children. She has a family background of farming, so she managed to work in the field and to teach her son how to grow seasonal crops and care for the fields.
 
Now that as her eldest son is grown, she no longer works. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She has 4 sons, but none of them go to school because of poor financial conditions.
 
She has applied for a loan from Asasah, a Kiva field partner, to help her son improve his business. With the loan, he will purchase fertilizer and seeds to grow seasonal crops in his fields to increase the family's household income. She hopes that a loan will make her son’s business more profitable and bring renewed happiness to her family. 

She is a new Asasah borrower and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to grow seasonal crops

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is married to M. B. who has a grocery store business. He operates his store in the market where he sells daily-use items such as soaps, tooth paste, and rice. She lives with her family in a two-room brick house in Khanewal, a small city of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She doesn’t have any children, so she spends her time staying at home doing her household responsibilities. Her brother also lives with her and he works in the field. He grows different seasonal crops to improve his financial condition.
 
Zubaida has applied for a loan from Asasah, a Kiva field partner, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more groceries so his grocery store can serve many more clients. He opened his business 2 years ago. Zubaida hopes that a loan will make her husband's business more profitable. 

She is a new Asasah borrower and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her. 

In the photo, Zubaida is the woman with he Asasah Passbook.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery store

loans.name: Irshaad's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad is 41 years old. She is married to A. S., who does labor work to improve the financial condition of the family. He works for daily wages, but his income is not guaranteed every day because on some days, he is able to get work but on other days, he is not. To assist him financially, his eldest son runs a grocery store business in the market. With their combined earnings, they support the family and pay the school fees of the other children.
 
Irshad lives in a small city called Khanewal in Pakistan. She owns a 2-room brick house where she and her family have been living  for 25 years. She has given birth to 4 sons and 2 daughters. Her three sons and two daughters are getting their education from a local school.
 
She has applied for a loan from Asasah, a Kiva field partner, for her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy more groceries for his grocery store and make a good profit by selling them to more customers. He started his business 10 years ago and Irshaad hopes that, with the loan investment, her son’s business will grow further and he will make better profits. 

She is new Asasah borrower and is confident that this will become a long-term relationship with Asasah.
 
In the photo, Irshaad is the woman who is holding the Asasah Passbook.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her son's grocery store

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul A. is 49 years old. She was born in a large, low-income family in the north of Kyrgyzstan. From early childhood, she was eager to study, which led her to graduating from the Industrial College with a diploma with honors. In 1985, Jumagul got married and soon gave a birth to her son, Tilek. Unfortunately, her happy marriage was broken by tragic death of her husband in car accident. 

To support her small family, Jumagul took any available work, but her earnings didn’t cover all of their expenses. In 1995, Jumagul decided to start her own sales business. With initial capital of only 1,000 Kyrgyz Soms (~$20 USD), she began to resell groceries at the local market. Thanks to her persistent desire to provide a good education for Tilek, she worked hard, managed to purchase a small shop at the new market in Cholpon-Ata town, and increase her floating capital to 60,000 Kyrgyz Soms (~$1280). 

Now, Jumagul plans to take a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Soms to broader her assortment of goods. It will allow her to increase her sales and acquire new customers. In the future, Jumagul dreams of hosting her son’s marriage and building a house where she can hear her grandchildren’s voices.

About Bai-Tushum: 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.
